cast: Vishnuvardhan|Dwarakish|Manjula|Felina|Loknath
overview: Shivaraj abandons his pregnant wife and flies to Singapore after entering into a partnership with Junie. Gopinath Rao sends Raja, Shivaraj's son, to Singapore on a mission.

title: Nanda
cast: Shivaraj Kumar|Sandhya|Maheen|Rangayana Raghu|Vanitha Vasu
overview: Nanda (Shivarajkumar) owns a canteen in the college and given his age and maturity, he is referred to as senior by all the students and they take his advise on various issues. In all this, there is one girl who goes by the name of Kavya (Sandhya) who is in love with him since Nanda helps in getting her sister married.Nanda falls in love with Kavya but as fate would have it, he tends to fall on the wrong books of Kavya

title: Kittu Puttu
cast: Vishnuvardhan|Dwarakish|Vaishali Kasaravalli|Loknath|M. P. Shankar
overview: Kittu Puttu is a 1977 Indian Kannada-language comedy drama film directed by C. V. Rajendran and produced by Dwarakish. The film stars Vishnuvardhan, Dwarakish, Manjula, K. Vijaya and Vaishali Kasaravalli. The film was widely appreciated for its songs and story upon release. The songs tuned by Rajan–Nagendra were huge hits.

title: Seetha Ramu
cast: Shankar Nag|Thoogudeepa Srinivas|Manjula|Sundar Krishna Urs|Prabhakar
overview: Seetharamu is a 1979 Indian Kannada-language film directed by V. Somashekhar. The film stars Shankar Nag, Manjula and Thoogudeepa Srinivas. The film is based on a science fiction plot of a brain transplant. The movie was remade in Telugu as Seethe Ramudaithe, starring Shankar Nag in his Telugu debut, and in Hindi in 1995 as Diya Aur Toofan. The song Ee Roopave Nannee Baalina was earlier used by Chellapilla Satyam for the 1978 Telugu movie Annadammula Savaal, which incidentally was a remake of the 1977 Kannada movie Sahodarara Savaal.

title: Inthi Ninna Preethiya
cast: Srinagar Kitty|Sonu Gowda|Bhavana Ramanna|Rangayana Raghu|S. P. Balasubramaniam
overview: Rajeev dejected in life, after he is unable to marry his girl Namana hits the bar. Rajeev is married off to parimala, by his brother with a hope that he mends his ways. His struggle with his addiction forms the plot.

title: Gowdru Hotel
overview: A remake of the Malayalam hit 'Ustad Hotel', the film sees an aspiring chef forced to work in a restaurant owned and run by his grandfather, to make ends meet, much against the wishes of his father.

title: Bara
cast: Anant Nag|C. R. Simha|Pankaj Dheer|Shivaram|Uma Shivakumar
overview: Based on the Kannada novel Bara by eminent writer U. R. Ananthamurthy, the story deals with the politics of famine in Karnataka. An idealistic officer eventually succumbs to bureaucratic apathy - famine relief arrives, but too late. Simultaneously shot in Hindi as Sookha; that version was released in 1983.

title: Gantumoote
cast: Teju Belawadi|Nischith korodi|Ram Manjjonaath|Roopa Rao|Surya Vasishta
overview: A 16-year-old girl embarks on a journey of life where she deals with understanding herself, the changing world, bullying, academic pressure and her transcending journey of first love.

title: Bangarada Panjara
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|Aarathi|K. S. Ashwath|M. V. Rajamma|Pandari Bai
overview: Bangarada Panjara is a 1974 Indian Kannada-language comedy film directed by debutant V. Somashekhar and co-produced by actor Raja Shankar. It starred Dr. Rajkumar in the lead role along with Aarathi, K. S. Ashwath, Pandari Bai and Lokanath. The movie saw a theatrical run of 25 weeks

title: Shivashankar
cast: Vishnuvardhan|Shobana|Ramesh Bhat|Mukhyamantri Chandru|Doddanna
overview: Shankar earns a living by running a poultry farm. He earns the wrath of a notorious criminal when he helps Moorthi, a police officer, arrest his henchmen.

title: Onti
cast: Arya|Meghana Raj|Sharath Lohitashwa|Devaraj|Girija Lokesh
overview: Onti, a carefree young man, catches the eye of a gangster, Silk after he saves Paaru from him. In retaliation, Silk murders Onti's dear friend which sets Onti on the path of revenge.

title: Parasangada Gende Thimma
cast: Lokesh|Reeta Anchan|Ramakrishna|B.R. Jayaram|Dingri Nagaraj
overview: Thimanna is an innocent tribal youth who is excited about his wedding. A salesman in village who help villagers by getting their needy items from distant city, His wedding is arranged with Marakani (Reeta Anchan), a city girl.

title: Vishnu Priya
cast: Priya Prakash Varrier|Shreyas Manju

title: Bhaagyavantharu
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|B. Saroja Devi|Ashok|T. N. Balakrishna|M.N. Lakshmi Devi
overview: Raj and his wife are thrown out of the house by their children. Raj works very hard and becomes rich. His children, for the love of money, welcome him home. Will he go back to stay with them?

title: Shiva
cast: Shivaraj Kumar|Ragini Dwivedi|Rangayana Raghu|Chi. Guru Dutt|Ravi Khale
overview: Shiva and Julie join forces to defeat the men who killed his father. In order to accomplish their mission, they seek the help of a villain.

title: Matinee
cast: Sathish Ninasam|Rachita Ram|Aditi Prabhudeva|Shivaraj KR Pate|Nagabhushana N S
overview: Arun owns a property in Bangalore where he invites his friends for a reunion. However, Arun receives an offer for the place but along with his friends, he is trapped in the house.

title: Veerakesari
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|Leelavathi|R. Nagendra Rao|K. S. Ashwath|Udaykumar
overview: Veera Kesari is a 1963 Indian Kannada-language swashbuckler film directed by B. Vittalacharya and produced by Sundarlal Nahatha and Doondi. The film stars Rajkumar, T. N. Balakrishna, Udaykumar and R. Nagendra Rao. The film has musical score by Ghantasala. S. Siddalingaiah was the assistant director of this movie. B. Vittalacharya shot the movie simultaneously in Telugu as Bandipotu, with N. T. Rama Rao.

title: Nagu Naguta Nali
cast: Shruti|Tara|Anjali|Sunil|Ramesh Bhat

title: Ghauttham
cast: Prem Kumar|Sarah|Kausalya|Anant Nag|Mohan
overview: Gowtham, a cheerful young lad, hails from a well-to-do family. Unfortunately, he is often misunderstood by his father but his life changes when he falls in love.

title: Bombay Dada
cast: Prabhakar|Vani Viswanath|Lakshmi|Vajramuni
overview: A man's brother-in-law is murdered by members of an underworld gang. He sets out to exact revenge by infiltrating the gang.

title: Hendtheer Darbar
cast: Ramesh Aravind|Meena|Rangayana Raghu|Sadhu Kokila
overview: Shivaramu is a married man who leads a miserly life. However, when he loses his government job, he is forced to join a politician's liquor company to fulfil his wife's greed for money.

title: Upendra Matte Baa
cast: Upendra|Prema|Sruthi Hariharan|Harshika Poonacha|Sai Kumar
overview: Upendra Matte Baa (Come again Upendra) is a 2017 Indian Kannada-language supernatural drama film directed by N. Arun Lokanath (Loki). The film stars Upendra in dual roles along with Prema and Sruthi Hariharan. The film's cinematography was handled by Swamy J. Gowda. The soundtrack and film score were composed by V. Sridhar.  After the death of a flirtatious zamindar named Upendra Raju, Yama sends his soul back to earth to fix the quarrels of his family.

title: Ajay
cast: Puneeth Rajkumar|Anuradha Mehta|Prakash Raj|Sumithra|Srinath
overview: Ajay hides Paddu in his house without the knowledge of his father, trying to send her to Australia as she has a passport and a VISA. There is triumph everywhere for Ajay, a settled profession, a beautiful wife and defeat of his opponent Prakash Raj and his team.

title: Kakana Kote
cast: Lokesh|Srinath|Loknath|Krishnaraj|Lavanya
overview: When the people of the Kuruba tribe in Kakana Kote are imposed by the higher authorities with an unjust tax, Kaka Nayak, the leader of the tribe, gets angry and decides to fight back.

title: Shabdavedhi
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|Jaya Prada|K. S. Ashwath|Mukhyamantri Chandru|Umashree
overview: Shabdavedi is about Sandeep Rajkumar, a strict police officer crusading against narcotics. The man is so straight that when his wife Jaya Prada refuses to reveal the identity of a key link in the drug ring that he is investigating. He beats her in lockup. Eventually he overcomes all the usual attempts to throw him off the chase like tarnishing his reputation and implicating him in lock-up death cases and tracks the ring down to its last man.

title: Naanobba Kalla
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|Lakshmi|Kanchana|Thoogudeepa Srinivas|Prabhakar
overview: A boy gets separated from his parents and grows up to become a thief. When he finds his parents and tries to return to them, his father who is a police officer refuses to accept him.

title: Critical Keertanegalu
cast: Apoorva Bharadwaj|Suchendra Prasad|Tharanga Vishwa|Tabla Nani
overview: A Lawyer called Kariyappa, he has been instrumental in filing the flaws in society, During IPL season, Gambling became a reality and millions became victims of the year. Realising that he comes to court to file an appeal against IPL for the of ban the IPL. He describes the four gambling events happened in Karnataka. All this as lawyer Kariyappa puts it infront of judge.

title: Mommaga
cast: V. Ravichandran|Meena|Prakash Raj|Umashree|C. R. Simha
overview: After the death of his parents, Surappa is raised by his grandparents. He grows up to become a beloved leader but loses power due to his evil cousin Nanja's treachery.

title: Chakravyuha
cast: Puneeth Rajkumar|Rachita Ram|Arun Vijay|Abhimanyu Singh|Sadhu Kokila
overview: A young man (Puneeth Rajkumar) finds himself in too deep after taking an injured protester to a hospital.

title: Doddmane Hudga
cast: Puneeth Rajkumar|Radhika Pandit|Bharathi Rao|Rangayana Raghu|Ambareesh
overview: Surya, a boy belonging to a big family of the town, moves out of the house when ignored by his father Rajivappa. However, after a few years, he comes back to rescue his land against Babu, an evil man.

title: Bhaktha Kumbara
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|Leelavathi|Manjula|T. N. Balakrishna|Rajashankar
overview: Bhakta Kumbara is a 1974 Indian Kannada biographical film, directed by Hunsur Krishnamurthy and produced by N R Anuradha Devi. The film stars Rajkumar, Leelavati and Balkrishna in lead roles. The film had a musical score by G.K. Venkatesh. Actress Sridevi essayed the role of Muktha Bai (as a child artist), thereby the latter making her Kannada film debut. The movie is based on the life of Gora Kumbhar, a potter turned into a saint who lived in the 13th and 14th centuries in Teredoki village. He supposedly lost his child while curing the clay by his legs for making pots, because he did not notice his child fumbling under his feet as he immersed himself in chanting the name of God. He was called Saint Gora Kumbara by the people of Maharashtra.

title: Huduga Hudugi
cast: Sammir Dattani|Lekha Washington|Sadha|Sanjjanaa Galrani|Anita Hassanandani Reddy
overview: When Sonia is asked to work with Sachin, a television anchor, she is reluctant. However, things take a turn when he decides to help her with her problems and she starts developing feelings for him.

title: Kalpana 2
cast: Upendra|Avantika Shetty|Priyamani|Tulasi|Chitra Shenoy
overview: Raghava has Nyctophobia. Raghava, who loves Nandhini, is a cinematographer for a TV channel and wants to shoot a fake haunted house, in order to increase TRP ratings. To their misfortune, they are haunted, not by one but by five ghosts.

title: Nishkarsha
cast: Vishnuvardhan|Anant Nag|B. C. Patil|Suman Nagarkar|Ramesh Bhat
overview: A daylight bank robbery alarms the police in Bangalore. The robber holds the bank staff and customers hostage as the police attempt to rescue the innocent and knock down the culprit.

title: Kalpana
cast: Upendra|Raai Laxmi|Sai Kumar|Babu Antony|Shruti
overview: Raghava is a fun-loving youngster who enjoys playing cricket with his friends. But at night he is afraid of ghosts and is always confined to his home under the care of his mother (Umashri). His brother (Achyuth Rao), sister-in-law (Shruthi) and their children live together in the same house. When Raghava and his friends go in search of another ground to play cricket, they find an abandoned field, which, it turns out, is haunted. At home, his mother and sister-in-law witness some strange happenings. With the help of a temple priest, they confirm the presence of a ghostly spirit haunting their home. Raghava begins to act funny and shows effeminate behaviour which is when the presence of the ghost is identified. The film goes on to unravel the mystery of the ghostly Kalpana and her relationship with Raghava.

title: Kempa
cast: Santhosh Balaraj|Sai Dhanshika|Pradeep Ram Singh Rawat|Lucky Shankar|Avinash
overview: The story is set on the backdrop of Gopinatham village where Kempa (Santosh) is living with his sister Pragna (Nayana) and his life changes when the STF forces who arrive there in the search for Veerappan end up killing her. Kempa is out to seek revenge and in no time kills the three STF guys who did it

title: Jana Mecchida Maga
cast: Sridhar|Chandrika|Anjali|Vajramuni|Jayanthi

title: Kanneshwara Rama
cast: Anant Nag|Amol Palekar|Shabana Azmi|B.V. Karanth
overview: Kanneshwara Rama (Kannada: ಕನ್ನೇಶ್ವರ ರಾಮ; English: The Legendary Outlaw) is a 1977 Kannada political drama film directed by M. S. Sathyu and produced by the Sharadha Movie Productions banner. The film is based on the novel Kannayya Rama written by the acclaimed writer S. K. Nadig. The story is set in the 1920s during which a young rebellious youth named Kanneshwara Rama opposes to the unjust orders given by the village head and becomes outlawed from the village.[1]  The film stars Ananth Nag as the protagonist along with Shabana Azmi, Amol Palekar, Dheerendra Gopal, Venkatesh in the key supporting roles. The film's score and songs were composed by B. V. Karanth who's also enacted as the dacoit cheiftan. The film, upon release, was critically acclaimed and was screened at various film festivals across India and abroad.

title: Urvashi
cast: Shruti|Ramesh Bhat|Shankar Ashwath|Nikhil
overview: A 1995 kannada movie directed by Amardeva starring Nikhil and Shruthi in the lead roles. Based on the novel of same name by Goruru.

title: Durgi
cast: Malashri|Ashish Vidhyarthi|Raghuvaran|Kalabhavan Mani|Avinash
overview: Durgi was living happily with her family in a small village. But 2 businessmen entered the village to make a sugar mill. They used to be drunk always. One day, they raped her sister and she died in hospital. When Durgi and her family were in agony, they killed Durgi's father. After this, she promises to kill everyone.

title: ACT-1978
cast: Yagna Shetty|Achyuth Kumar|Pramod Shetty|B Suresha|Avinash
overview: Geetha, a pregnant widow, goes to a government office as part of her long and continuous ordeal to get money from a government scheme that is hers. What seems to be a normal day of bureaucracy and corruption goes awry when she lands up with a bomb strapped to her stomach.

title: Chandramuki Pranasaki
cast: Ramesh Aravind|Prema|Bhavana Ramanna
overview: Chandramuki Pranasaki movie is based on triangle love story. In which ramesh loves prema but bhavana loves ramesh. She is replying for his letters instead prema. Finally they both will unite.

title: Kotigobba
cast: Vishnuvardhan|Priyanka Upendra|Avinash|Devaraj|Ramesh Bhat
overview: A humble auto driver leads a happy and content life with his ambitious siblings. However, his siblings are unaware of their brother's past.

title: Hendthighelbedi
cast: Anant Nag|Mahalakshmi|Sundar Krishna Urs|Devraj|Bangalore Nagesh
overview: When a meek businessman is wrongfully accused of a double murder by his friend, who is also the real culprit, he tries to look for evidence to prove his innocence.

title: Modalasala
cast: Yash|Bhama|Rangayana Raghu|Tara|Avinash
overview: A young man named Karthik falls in love with Deepa and decides to propose to her. However, Deepa makes him wait for the approval of her parents, who do not support the union.

title: Beedi Basavanna
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|Bharathi Rao|Vandana|Dinesh|T. R. Narasimharaju
overview: Beedi Basavanna is a 1967 Indian Kannada language film, directed and produced by B. R. Panthulu. The film stars Rajkumar, Bharathi, Vandana (B. Vijayalakshmi) and Narasimharaju. The film has musical score by T. G. Lingappa. B. R. Panthulu remade the movie in Tamil in 1970 as Thedi Vandha Mappillai with minor changes.

title: Aaram Aravind Swamy
cast: Anissh|Milana Nagaraj|Hrithika Srinivas|Gowrav Shetty|RJ Vikki
overview: This feel-good tale follows Arvind, a city recovery agent with a perfect girlfriend. When she urges him to confront their parents about marriage, he avoids the issue, triggering a series of comedic events that change his life. It`s a light-hearted exploration of love and commitment amidst his escapist tendencies

title: Aa Drushya
cast: Achyuth Kumar|Chaithra J Achar|V. Ravichandran|Arjun Gowda|Chethan Vicky
overview: Surya Tejas, a retired policeman, narrates the details of a case that he investigated years ago to a former colleague's son. In the process, he reveals what really happened on the day of the crime.

title: Karulina Koogu
cast: Prabhakar|Vinaya Prasad|Srinath|Doddanna|Shanthamma
overview: Mohan, an alcoholic, gets married to Sharada, a music teacher. Tragedy soon strikes their life when Antony sets his eyes on Sharada and tries to take undue advantage of her.

title: Buckasura
cast: Sihi Kahi Chandru|Makrand Deshpande|Sadhu Kokila|Suchendra Prasad|V. Ravichandran
overview: Arya, aka Money, is a lawyer who will do anything for money. When he gets an offer that he cannot refuse, he has to make a lot of choices to lead the live he wants. Will Arya get to lead a happily ever after with a wealthy future?

title: Katheyondu Shuruvagide
cast: Diganth Manchale|Pooja Devariya|Shreya Anchan|Ashwin Rao Pallaki|Raaghu Raamanakoppa
overview: A young resort owner, Tarun, is going through a rough time and tries to deal with disappointments, failures, and struggles of his life. In the process of doing so, he strikes up a great bond with a resort guest, Tanya. Will this bond help them to find a new meaning of love and life?

title: Brahma
cast: Upendra|Nasaar|Pranitha Subhash|Sayaji Shinde|Rahul Dev
overview: Brahma, a notorious gangster, escapes to Malaysia. He meets a girl who falls in love with him instantly. Everything changes when Brahma returns to India followed by the girl.

title: Bhakta Prahlada
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|Puneeth Rajkumar|Saritha|Anant Nag
overview: It is a Hindu mythological film directed by Vijay, and based on the tale of Prahalada. The film stars Rajkumar, Saritha, Puneeth Rajkumar and Ananth Nag. The soundtrack was composed by T. G. Lingappa. The film won State Film Awards in Sound recording and cinematography categories. This was the fourth Kannada film on Prahlada after the 1942 film Bhakta Prahlada, the 1958 film Bhakta Prahlada and the 1960 film Dashavathara. Of the four films, this was the only one which was not shot in black and white. This movie was dubbed in Telugu as Narasimhaavataaram.

title: Allama
cast: Dhananjay|Meghana Raj|Lakshmi Gopalaswamy|Sanchari Vijay|Suman Jadugar
overview: Story of the rebellious thinker Allama, also known as Allama Prabhu.

title: Seetharam Benoy
cast: Vijay Raghavendra|Shreeharsha Ninasam|Devi Prakash|Sathwik Hebbar|Manju Rangayana
overview: Seetharam, a cop, gets transferred to a remote village in Shimoga Dist Aanegadde finds himself in middle of a bunch of smart yet cruel thieves. The day he takes charge his house gets robbed. Matter of dignity and personal revenge, intense investigation then begins.

title: Amrutha Ghalige
cast: Sridhar|Padma Vasanthi|Ramakrishna|Umashree
overview: A young girl gets impregnated by her insincere boyfriend who leaves her to fend for herself. She marries her classmate, who is worried about her image. However, tragedy soon befalls her new world. Based on the novel Avadaana, by Dodderi Venkatagiri Rao

title: Kavacha
cast: Shivaraj Kumar|Kruthika Jayakumar|Meenakshi|Isha Koppikar|Dhritiman Chatterjee
overview: An unfortunate young girl becomes the target of a vengeful serial killer who is on the loose. The only person standing between the killer and the girl is a visually challenged man who has vowed to protect her at any cost.

title: Kotigalu Saar Kotigalu
cast: Ramesh Aravind|S. Narayan|Mohan Shankar|Prema|Tara
overview: Kotigalu Saar Kotigalu is a 2001 Kannada film directed by S. V Rajendra Singh Babu and produced by Jai Jagadish. The film stars Ramesh Aravind, S. Narayan, Mohan Shankar and Prema in lead roles. Music was composed by Hamsalekha.

title: Samskara
cast: Girish Karnad|P. Lankesh|Snehalata Reddy|B.R. Jayaram|Dasharathi Dixit
overview: Narayanappa, a Madhwa Brahmin man, dies in the Agrahara of the village Durvasapura. As per Madhwa customs, his last rites must be performed at the earliest. However, due to Narayanappa's rebellious actions in life, which included eating meat, consuming liquor and marrying a prostitute, there is disagreement amongst the Brahmins of the village as to who will perform his rites.

title: Makkaliralavva Mane Thumba
cast: Lakshmi|Anant Nag|Shankar Nag|T. N. Balakrishna
overview: Raja and Rani are a childless married couple who go through many tough times together. However, owing to their perseverance, they finally see better days.

title: Premigala Saval
cast: Prabhakar|Archana|V. Ravichandran|Mukhyamantri Chandru|Vajramuni
overview: After his lover Sita gets killed on the day of their wedding by her own father, Ramaswamy, Ramu swears revenge on him. However, he soon realises that his best friend Raja is connected to Ramaswamy.

title: Raajadhaani
cast: Yash|Prakash Raj|Umashree|Ramesh Bhat|Sheena Shahabadi
overview: Five aimless youths are offered money to assassinate a local gangster. This is the beginning of their downward spiral into a life of crime.

title: Immadi Pulikeshi
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|Udaykumar|K. S. Ashwath|T. N. Balakrishna|Jayanthi
overview: Immadi Pulikeshi is based on the story of the famous Kannada ruler Pulakeshin II of the Chalukya dynasty, who was significantly involved in branching out the dynasty to extend over most parts of the Deccan.

title: Double Engine
cast: Chikkanna|Sadhu Kokila|Prabhu Mundkur|Suman Ranganathan

title: Masanada Hoovu
cast: Ambareesh|Jayanthi|Aparna Vastarey|Hema Chaudhary|Loknath
overview: Singaru borrows money from Taradevi, who runs a brothel, and requites her by acquiring prospective clients. Smitten with Parvathy, who is forced into the flesh trade, Singaru tries to rescue her. Based on novel by TaRaSu.

title: Jai Lalitha
cast: Sharan|Disha Pandey|Ravishanker Gowda|Harish Raju|Aishwarya Devan
overview: Jai Lalitha is a remake of Malayalam movie Maya Mohini and it is a comedy entertainer in which, Sharan will be seen in female role thought the movie.  The film starts with a plane accident in which a small child narrowly escapes. He is then looked after by his maternal uncle, and all the family's wealth will be inherited to him. As per their astrologer, in the future he should marriage a girl whose star is Chothi Nakshatra, only then will he prosper in life. The boy grows up to be a young man, who is unsuccessful in anything he does.  He falls in love with the daughter of a wealthy businessman, who is settled in Mumbai. When he gets to know about their relation, he objects. In the meantime a friend of Sharan tries to convince Sharan's uncle about the marriage and the uncle agrees to visit the couple. But then, on the second day of the marriage Sharan's lover leaves him and returns to Mumbai.

title: Putaani Agents 123
cast: Srinath|Manjula|Master Ramakrishna Hegde|Master Bhanupraksh|Master James
overview: Murali, an honest police officer, is falsely charged in a murder case and sentenced to death. However, things take a turn when three students race against time to prove his innocence.

title: Anuroopa
cast: Anant Nag|Aarathi|C. R. Simha|T. N. Seetharam|Manjula
overview: A professor of sociology faces numerous challenges from a conventionally rigid social structure as he tries to bring about some changes for the betterment of the society.

title: Naa Ninna Mareyalare
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|Lakshmi|Leelavathi|T. N. Balakrishna|Loknath
overview: Due to her mother's disapproval, Usha has to leave her lover and get married to a man she does not love. However, fate brings the estranged lovers face to face again. The film is based on the short story Naanu Neenu Jodi by A. R. Anand.

title: Vijayanand
cast: Prakash Belawadi|Anish Kuruvilla
overview: Vijay, a 19-year-old boy, starts his transport business at a very young age from Gadag, a small city in the heart of North Karnataka. Although he faced many difficulties in the beginning, he bravely faced all of them and started his business with just one truck and till now he became the owner of 4300 vehicles. In this story, a father worries that his son may get into trouble by venturing into a new business that he doesn't know about. But the same son will one day grow up in the same industry and become a big businessman. Vijayanand Road Lines (VRL) has now grown into one of the largest transport companies in India. Vijay also ventures into media business.

title: Veera Kannadiga
cast: Puneeth Rajkumar|Anita Hassanandani Reddy|Bullet Prakash|Avinash|Sayaji Shinde
overview: A man protects a slum and strives to keep its inhabitants safe from the negative elements. He also aims to avenge his father's death against the criminals who killed him.

title: Kasidre Kailasa
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|Udaykumar|Vanisri|Pandari Bai|T. R. Narasimharaju
overview: Kasidre Kailasa is a 1971 Indian Kannada-language film directed and produced by K. Janakiram. The film stars Rajkumar, Udaykumar, Vanisri and Pandari Bai. The film has musical score by Satyam.

title: Satya In Love
cast: Shivaraj Kumar|Genelia D'Souza|Srinath|Bullet Prakash|Vinaya Prasad
overview: Satya In Love is a 2008 Kannada film directed by Raghava Loki and produced by Ramesh. The film stars Shivaraj Kumar, Genelia Dsouza, Srinath and Bullet Prakash in lead roles. Music was composed by Gurukiran.

title: Vrithra
cast: Nithya Shri|Girish Jatti|Jaya Hegde|Kantha Mani|Prakash Belawadi
overview: While investigating a seemingly open-and-shut case, sub-inspector Indra Rao uncovers a trail that leads her way beyond the obvious and simple answers. As she follows the evidence, she is posed with a choice that could change her life as a police officer forever.

title: Poli Kitty
cast: Ramesh Bhat|Avinash|Kashinath|Ilavarasi|Devaraj
overview: Diffident Kitti works for an ad agency. His accidental wedding with Lakshmi remains unconsummated, and he gets implicated in the murder of an aspiring model. He now has to prove his innocence.

title: Edagaiye Apaghatakke Karana
cast: Diganth Manchale|Dhanu Harsha|Nidhi Subbaiah|Nirup Bhandari|Radhika Narayan
overview: Dark Comdey Suspense Thriller

title: Navakoti Narayana
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|Sowcar Janaki|Dikki Madhava Rao|H. R. Shastry
overview: Navakoti Narayana is a 1964 Indian Kannada-language film directed by S. K. Ananthachari starring Rajkumar and Sowcar Janaki. The film is based on the life of Purandara Dasa, a prominent composer of Carnatic music who lived from 1484 to 1564. In the film, Rajkumar plays the role of Purandara Dasa. The music of the film was composed by Shivaprasad. This was the second Kannada movie on the life of Purandara Dasa after 1937 movie Purandaradasa.

title: Savaari
cast: Raghu Mukherjee|Kamalinee Mukherjee|Srinagar Kitty|Suman Ranganathan|H. G. Dattatreya
overview: Abhiram, a wealthy man, falls in love with Janaki, a doctor who serves the poor and needy. He dislikes her profession and tries to change her but things get complicated.

title: Mr. Bachelor
cast: Darling Krishna|Milana Nagaraj|Nimika Ratnakar|Chikkanna|Sadhu Kokila
overview: Mr. Bachelor is a Kannada movie starring Darling Krishna, Milana Nagaraj and Nimika Ratnakar in the lead.

title: Dandupalya 2
cast: Pooja Gandhi|Makrand Deshpande|Ravi Kale|Sanjjanaa Galrani|Tabla Nani
overview: ‘Dandupalyam 2’ is the sequel to 2012 thriller ‘Dandupalyam’ that chronicled the life and exploitations of the scandalous D-gang. ‘Dandupalya 2’ offers a whole new perspective to the already established story, making one question everything they already know.

title: Putnanja
cast: V. Ravichandran|Meena|Umashree|Lokesh|Pooja Lokesh
overview: Putnanja, a poor farmer, falls in love with Roja, a city-bred woman. They get married despite opposition from her mother, but differences soon crop up between them.

title: Arasu
cast: Puneeth Rajkumar|Divya Spandana|Meera Jasmine|Srinivasa Murthy|Komal Kumar
overview: Shivaraj falls in love with his manager's daughter, Shruthi. However, she refuses his proposal and challenges him to first earn Rs 5000 without using any influence. Shruthi makes Shivaraj a better person, and they both fall in love. But Shruthi finds out that her best friend Aishwarya is also in love with Shivaraj so she gives up her love for her best friend. Later when Aishwarya learns about SHruthi too being in love with him, she feels guilty and backs off the relationship. Instead, Shivaraj comes up with a mind baffling situation and he sets up both the girls with two of his friends and he finds another girl for himself.

title: Naanu Naane
cast: Upendra
overview: A 2002 Kannada film.

title: Babruvahana
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|B. Saroja Devi|Jayamala|Kanchana|Vajramuni
overview: Babhruvahana, like Arjuna at the beginning of the Kurukshetra war, faces a moral dilemma. Can he risk harming his parents? While Chitarangada alerts Arjuna to shoot an arrow at their son and take advantage of Babhruvahana’s momentary lapse due to a sense of devotion towards them (as Arjuna did with Karna), Uluci, the Naga princess and yet another abandoned wife of Arjuna’s, reminds Babhruvahana of the teaching of the Kurukshetra battle that in the battlefield there is no space for feelings even towards parents. What Babhruvahana must do is to establish his mother’s good name and thereby his own character. This film captures this conflict spectacularly. The eerie parallels with the moral dilemmas of the great Mahabharata battle aside, here all the familial relationships (in particular, strong mothers and dutiful sons) become exaggerated and demand our attention.

title: Victory
cast: Sharan|Asmita Sood|P. Ravi Shankar|Tabla Nani|Avinash

title: Bayaludaari
cast: Anant Nag|Kalpana|Ashok|K. S. Ashwath|T. N. Balakrishna
overview: Bayaludaari is a 1976 Indian Kannada-language film directed and produced by the Dorai–Bhagavan duo. It is based on the novel of the same name by Bharathi Sutha. This was the first movie of the director duo without Dr. Rajkumar in the lead. The film starred Anant Nag, Kalpana, and K. S. Ashwath. It was a musical blockbuster with all the songs composed by Rajan–Nagendra considered evergreen hits. Bayalu Daari was the first commercial success for Anant Nag who had earlier done art films and established himself as a leading star in the Kannada cinema with a chocolate hero image. This film was one the last big hits of Kalpana. The helicopter scenes formed a major highlight of the movie.

title: Monda
cast: Sai Kumar|Pavitra Lokesh|Sharath Lohitashwa|Vinaya Prasad|Jayasudha

title: Karmika Kallanalla
cast: Vishnuvardhan|Shankar Nag|Aarathi|Vajramuni|Prabhakar
overview: Mohan, a factory worker, tries to give his brother good education with his minimal wages. When he is falsely accused of a crime and dismissed from work, he resorts to illegal means to earn money.

title: Benkiyalli Aralidha Hoovu
cast: Suhasini Maniratnam|Jai Jagadish|Ramakrishna|Sarath Babu|Rajeev
overview: The eldest daughter takes the responsibility of supporting her mother and siblings after her father abandons them. She strives for the betterment of her family by living a selfless life.

title: Daali
cast: Dhananjay|Bhavya Trikha|Rachita Ram
overview: Daali is an upcoming Kannada language film directed by Prabhu Srinivas and produced by Yogesh Narayan under the banner Yogesh Motion Pictures. It is a spin-off of 2018 blockbuster film Tagaru starring Shivarajkumar, Dhananjay and Vasishta Simha. In Daali, Dhananjay reprises his role from Tagaru and it also features Rachitha Ram in an important role.

title: Arjun
cast: Darshan Thoogudeepa Srinivas|Anant Nag|Urvashi|Sanjjanaa Galrani|Meera Chopra
overview: Police officer Arjun has strong moral values and lets criminals off with a warning. But he is in a fix when he learns that his father is paying petty criminals to help him catch big criminals.

title: Dr. B. R. Ambedkar
cast: Vishnukanth B. J.|Bhavya|Tara|C. Ashwath|H. G. Dattatreya
overview: Based on the life of Indian social reformer, jurist, academic-politician, B. R. Ambedkar. The film covers the period from his birth right up to his death.

title: Havada Hoovu
cast: Mohan|Rajyalakshmi|Dheerendra Gopal
overview: Havada Hoovu is a 1983 Kannada film.

title: Mugulu Nage
cast: Apoorva Arora|Nikitha Narayan|Ashika Ranganath|Rangayana Raghu|Jaggesh
overview: Pulkesh is a very usual guy with an always smiling character. He stays in Mysuru with his father who is a history teacher, his mother who is an housewife also an art lover and his sister who goes to college. The very odd and interesting thing about Pulkesh is that he has never cried from the time he was born.

title: College Kumar
cast: Samyuktha Hegde|P. Ravi Shankar|Shruti|Achyuth Kumar|Sadhu Kokila
overview: Shivakumar works as a peon in an office and strives to ensure that his son Kumar fulfils his dreams. When the pressure gets to Kumar, he starts to rebel against his father.

title: Sagar
cast: Prajwal Devaraj|Radhika Pandit|Hariprriya|Vinaya Prasad|Avinash
overview: Rajasekhara is not willing to get into an arranged marriage and lies that he is in love with a girl called Kajal. But, trouble arrives when Kajal actually turns up and is even followed by a gangster.

title: Kudure Mukha
cast: Anant Nag|Aarathi|Ambareesh|Sundar Krishna Urs|Halam
overview: Professor Nataraj, a historian, unearths some invaluable secrets of the past. Rekha, his daughter, seeks the help of Mohan, to save his findings from notorious criminals.

title: Shubhamangala
cast: Aarathi|Srinath|Ambareesh|Shivaram|Loknath
overview: Hema and her friends lead a happy life with her father in a small town. Unfortunately, Hema's father passes away and she is forced to live with her cousin in a city.

title: Brahmachari
cast: Sathish Ninasam|Achyuth Kumar|Ashok Sharma|H. G. Dattatreya|Padmaja Rao
overview: A comedy romance film directed by Chandra Mohan, starring Aditi Prabhudeva and Sathish Ninasam in the lead roles.

title: Ganda Bherunda
cast: Shankar Nag|Ambareesh|Lakshmi|Srinath|Amrish Puri
overview: A young explorer and linguist stumbles upon ancient scrolls that contain information about precious treasure of the Bherunda kingdom. He sets out to find the wealth with a trusted few.

title: Bhale Huchcha
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|Aarathi|Srinath|Thoogudeepa Srinivas|Loknath
overview: Bhale Huchcha is a 1972 Indian Kannada-language film directed by Y. R. Swamy and produced by Gopal Lakshman. It stars Rajkumar and Aarathi. This film was dubbed into Telugu as Dasara Picchodu and released in 1973. This was the only Kannada movie of actress Helen.

title: Shivaji Surathkal: The Case of Ranagiri Rahasya
cast: Ramesh Aravind|Radhika Narayan|Avinash|Ramesh Pandit|Rohith Bhanuprakash
overview: Shivaji Surathkal, who is the Sherlock Holmes of the Karnataka Police Department, is handed over a high-profile case – the murder of the Home Minister's son. This brings him to an eerie resort in Ranagiri, near Madikeri, which seems to throw Shivaji off his game.

title: Hari Bhakta
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|Pandari Bai|Mynavathi|T. R. Narasimharaju|G. V. Iyer
overview: Hari Bhakta is a 1956 Kannada-language film directed by T. V. Singh Thakur. The film stars Rajkumar and Pandari Bai. It had Mynavathi, Narasimharaju, G. V. Iyer, H. R. Shastry playing supporting roles.[1] The movie is based on the life of Pundarika

title: Sodari
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|Pandari Bai|T. R. Narasimharaju|G. V. Iyer
overview: Sodari is a 1955 Indian Kannada-language film directed by T. V. Singh Thakur. The film stars Pandari Bai, Narasimha Raju and Rajkumar. The music for the film was composed by Padmanabha Shasthri. The story of the film is based on the life of Hemavati, the pious wife of King Kailasanatha. She faces numerous hardships along with her children when Kailasanatha loses his kingdom due to a drought. The actress Jayashree plays a negative role of Chanchaladevi, a cunning relative of Hemavati. The movie is based on GV Iyer's stage play Anna Thangi which was based on the popular legend of Nalla Thangaal whose story had earlier been adapted in Malayalam in 1950 as Nalla Thanka and later in Tamil as Nalla Thangal (1955).

title: Raaga
cast: Mithra|Bhama|Avinash|Rangayana Raghu|Sadhu Kokila
overview: Mithra is a blind man, whose happy-go-lucky demeanor and philosophies ensure that he is everyone's favourite. When a timid, insecure and rich blind girl, Anu, enters his life, he experiences a whole new feeling.

title: Shivamma
cast: Sharanamma Chatti|Chennamma Abbegere|Shivu Abbegere|Shruthi Kondenahalli|Chennappa Hansi
overview: Shivamma is an ardent sales rep for the energy drink Nuracle. The multilevel marketing method at Nuracle is her only belief and motivation for life. To Shivamma, living in a poor town on the outskirts of a city with her bed-ridden husband, a soon-to-be-married daughter, and brattish son, Nuracle’s worldview—“I will do it!”—is a source of confidence and hope.

title: Family Drama
cast: Sindhu Sreenivasa Murthy|Poornachandra Mysuru|Rekha Kudligi|Ananya Amar|Abhay
overview: Welcome to the Family of Liars... Cheaters...Murderers? Here's the Sneak Peek of Family Drama, a Dark Comedy Kannada film.

title: Phaniyamma
cast: L. V. Sharada Rao|Prathibha Kasaravalli|Archana Rao|Vishwanath Rao|Kasaragod Chinna
overview: Based on a true story, the film depicts the life story of a child widow who grows up facing the unkind treatment that society metes out to such women. Yet, she shows exceptional kindness to others.

title: Mayor Muthanna
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|M. P. Shankar|Rajanand|Bharathi Rao|Dwarakish
overview: Muthanna, a kind and principled man, becomes mayor through justice and service. Coming from a humble background, he earns the citizens' respect with his integrity. However, corrupt politicians and enemies challenge his good governance. Muthanna’s journey is tough, as he fights corruption and faces personal struggles—his dedication to righteousness and his sacrifices for the greater good shine through. A powerful drama filled with emotion and stellar performances, Mayor Muthanna is a landmark Kannada film known for its ethical themes.

title: Ayushman Bhava
cast: Shivaraj Kumar|Rachita Ram|Anant Nag|Prabhu|Suhasini Maniratnam
overview: Krishna enters a big household as the caretaker of the patriarch. He finds out that the granddaughter of the house, Lakshmi, has been kept locked in the household because of her mentally unstable condition and as a caretaker he decides to explore.

title: Preethse
cast: Upendra|Sonali Bendre|Shivaraj Kumar
overview: Preethse is a 2000 psychological thriller Kannada film starring Upendra, Shivrajkumar and Sonali Bendre.

title: Chandu
cast: Sudeep|Sonia Agarwal|Sadhu Kokila
overview: A 2002 Kannada film

title: Jai Maruthi 800
cast: Sharan|Sruthi Hariharan|Shuba Poonja|Sadhu Kokila|Arun Sagar
overview: Jai Maruthi 800 is an action comedy that is set in two distinct time periods. The film begins with an incident that occurs in the 16th century, which reaches its logical conclusion in the present day.

title: Drishya 2
cast: V. Ravichandran|Anant Nag|Asha Sarath|Prabhu|Navya Nair
overview: Rajendra Ponnappa, a cinema hall owner, thrives in life but is a changed man. However, when his family gets entangled in a criminal investigation, he must protect them from the legal institution yet again.

title: Mysooru Mallige
cast: Shankanada Anjanappa|H. G. Dattatreya|Girish Karnad|Shivamogga Venkatesh
overview: Padma is in love with poet Manju. After he goes missing while trying to save a friend from nationalists, a heartbroken Padma decides to get his poems published.

title: Bhajarangi
cast: Shivaraj Kumar|Aindrita Ray|Bullet Prakash|Sadhu Kokila|Tabla Nani
overview: A tantric terrorizes a village called Ramadurga. A man comes to the village to know the mystery of his birth. He learns that his grandfather was killed trying to save the village from the tantrik and he defeats him.

title: Mojina Maduve
cast: Devaraj|Tara|Disco Shanti|Mukhyamantri Chandru|Lohithaswa

title: Hide And Seek
cast: Rajesh Nataranga|Dhanya Ramkumar|Krishna Hebbale|Mythri Jaggi|Bala Rajwadi
overview: A police officer is on a trail to hunt an elusive Ghost Leader indulged in trafficking.When an order for a wealthy businessman's daughters is given, the hero takes the job, but it leads to unexpected twists and turns.

title: Bangarada Gudi
cast: Vishnuvardhan|Manjula|Vajramuni|K. S. Ashwath|Ambareesh
overview: Bangarada Gudi is a 1976 Indian Kannada film, directed by K. S. R. Das and produced by C. H. Prakash Rao. The film stars Vishnuvardhan, Manjula, Ambareesh and Padmapriya in the lead roles. The film has musical score by G. K. Venkatesh. The director remade the movie in Telugu in 1979 as Bangaru Gudi.

title: Alemari
cast: Yogesh|Radhika Pandit|Rakesh Adiga|Ramesh Bhat|Umashree
overview: Alemari (Kannada: ಅಲೆಮಾರಿ) is a 2012 released Kannada romantic action drama film starring Yogesh and Radhika Pandit in the lead roles. The story, screenplay, lyrics and direction is by Santhu. The music of the film was composed by Arjun Janya. B. K. Srinivas has produced the venture under BK Srinivasa Productions. The film released in theatres across Karnataka on 9 March 2012.

title: Bairagee
cast: Shivaraj Kumar|Dhananjay|Pruthvi Ambaar|Anjali|Yasha Shivakumar
overview: Huli Shiva, a hulivesha artiste, works in a police station, doing odd jobs. When he moves along with his inspector friend to a new city, he meets many new people, including Vathapi and Karna. While he discovers new friendships and love, he also witnesses an unfortunate incident that awakens the tiger within him once again. Does he find justice?

title: Dilwala
cast: Sumanth Shailendra|Radhika Pandit|P. Ravi Shankar|Sharath Lohitashwa|Ramesh Bhat
overview: Dilwala is a 2013 romantic drama Kannada film directed by Anil Kumar (Dilwala Anil). The film stars Sumanth Shailendra and Radhika Pandit.  Shailendra Babu produced this film which was backed with Arjun Janya's music and Sudhakar's cinematography.  Shot at the scenic locales of Bangalore, Mysore, Ooty and Dubai for two songs, the film speaks about a campus romance between a village farmer girl and a rich brat boy. The film received average response from the critics and performed above average at the box-office with the first weekend collections of up to ₹3.7crores.  Prem, a young college student, falls in love with his classmate, Preethi. Things turn sour for the lovers when Jayasimha, Prem's father, asks him to stop seeing Preethi as her father is his enemy.

title: Parajitha
cast: Srinivasa Murthy|Aarathi|Jai Jagadish|Aruna Mucherla|K. S. Ashwath

title: Mr 420
cast: Pranitha Subhash|Sadhu Kokila|Rangayana Raghu|Ganesh
overview: An easy go lucky guy and attempts pickpocketing for livelihood. After falling in love with the lady, the hero gets into trouble and how he wins over the circumstances is the story.

title: Love You Rachchu
cast: Rachita Ram|Ajai Rao|Achyuth Kumar|Raghu Shivamogga|B Suresha
overview: In the midst of a happy relationship, a couple encounters a bad turn in their lives. Will they be able to overcome the obstacles or will the worst times await them?

title: Katari Veera Surasundarangi
cast: Ambareesh|Upendra|Divya Spandana|Ajay|Doddanna
overview: A man gets killed and finds himself in front of Yama, the god of death. In heaven, when he falls for Lord Indra's daughter, he is promptly sent back to Earth. Now, he sets out to avenge himself.

title: Kula Gourava
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|T. R. Narasimharaju|Jayanthi|B. Jaya|V. Ravichandran
overview: Kula Gourava is a 1971 Indian Kannada language romantic drama film directed by Peketi Sivaram and written by G. Balasubramanyam. It stars Rajkumar in triple roles along with Jayanthi and Bharathi. The film was produced under Sri Eswari Productions of N. Veeraswamy. It had a very successful soundtrack composed by T. G. Lingappa. Popular actor-director V. Ravichandran, son of the film producer Veerasamy, appeared in the film as a child artist. The film swept 5 awards at the 1970-71 Karnataka State Film Awards including the best film, best actor, and best editor categories.

title: Belliyappa Bangarappa
cast: Kumar Bangarappa|Amala Akkineni|K. S. Ashwath|T. N. Balakrishna|Loknath

title: Gulabi Talkies
cast: Umashree|M. D. Pallavi
overview: Gulabi is a discarded fifty something woman, an outcast living on an island with the fisher folk. Her obsession for films is fulled with the introduction of a television in her life and her village hut becomes a hub.  Gulabi Talkies is a 2008 Kannada film by acclaimed Indian director Girish Kasaravalli. It is based on a short story by the same name by Kannada writer Vaidehi.[1]  The film premiered at the Osian's Cinefan Festival of Asian and Arab Cinema in New Delhi on 14 July 2008, where it won the Best Film and Best Actress awards in the Indian Competition section. Umashree won the National Award for Best Actress for her performance in the film.

title: Paramesha Panwala
cast: Shivaraj Kumar|Surveen Chawla|Srinivasa Murthy|Ashish Vidhyarthi|Chitra Shenoy
overview: Paramesha Panwala is a 2008 Kannada film directed by Mahesh Babu and produced by Aditya Babu. The film stars Shivaraj Kumar, Surveen Chawla, Srinivasa Murthy and Ashish Vidhyarthi in lead roles. Music was composed by V Harikrishna.

title: Jolly Days
cast: Pradeep|Kishori Balal|Hanumanthe Gowda|Sangeetha|Aishwarya Nag
overview: A group of college students, who are close friends, face several challenging situations during their four years at an engineering college.

title: Alimayya
cast: Arjun Sarja|Shruti|Lokesh|Silk Smitha|Kovai Sarala
overview: Anand reluctantly agrees to marry Lakshmi. Just when the two are settling into happy matrimony, trouble erupts owing to differences between their parents.

title: Jatta
cast: Kishore|Sukrutha Wagle|Achyuth Kumar|Pavana|Prem
overview: When forest guard Jatta's wife runs away with a tourist, he is not able to handle the loss and enslaves another woman in his forest home.

title: Krishnam Pranaya Sakhi
cast: Ganesh|Malavika Nair|Sadhu Kokila|Sharanya Shetty|Rangayana Raghu
overview: Krishna, a business tycoon, meets Pranaya, an orphan who runs an orphanage. Krishna, worried that his socio-economic status may separate him from Pranaya, pretends to be a driver and becomes employed by Pranaya. Pranaya soon learns about Krishna's identity, but she later accepts his love.

title: Gultoo
cast: Naveen Shankar|Sonu Gowda|Avinash|Rangayana Raghu
overview: Struggling to find a foot in the start-up scene, two aspiring entrepreneurs are entangled in a vicious loop of investigative trials following an unprecedented crime.

title: Badavara Bandhu
cast: Dr. Rajkumar|Jayamala|K. S. Ashwath|T. N. Balakrishna|Vajramuni
overview: Badavara Bandhu is a 1976 Indian Kannada language drama film directed by Vijay. It stars Rajkumar and Jayamala. The movie is also notable for the negative character played by K. S. Ashwath.The movie saw a theatrical run of 25 weeks and was declared a Blockbuster at the box office.

title: Jogi
cast: Shivaraj Kumar|Jennifer Kotwal|Arundathi Nag|Ramesh Bhat|Kishan Shrikanth
overview: After a crime lord is murdered by Madesha, Nivedhitha, a journalist, sets out to meet him. She ends up meeting an old woman and promises to help her find her son, who is none other than Madesha.

title: Mundina Nildana
cast: Praveen Tej|Radhika Narayan|Ananya Kashyap|Ajay Raj
overview: As three young professionals chase their wildly different dreams, their relationships with each other indelibly impact their journeys of self-discovery.

title: Gadibidi Ganda
cast: V. Ravichandran|Ramya Krishnan|Roja Selvamani|Nagesh|Jaggesh
overview: Gopal, a village boy, is forced to marry Mohana, a vibrant city girl. Later, he marries Nilambari, his childhood love from his village, and has to juggle between them both.

title: Aana
cast: Aditi Prabhudeva|Suneel Puranik|Chethan Gandharva|Prerana Kambam|Vikash Uttaiah
overview: Five friends, including two brothers, are desperate to get rich after losing their jobs following the COVID-19 pandemic, end up planning a kidnap for ransom. After successfully executing the kidnap, tides change and they end up struck as they start to experience strange happenings around them.

title: Habba
cast: Vishnuvardhan|Jaya Prada|Ambareesh|Urvashi|Devaraj
overview: Ram falls in love with Seetha, who refuses to marry him owing to a dark family secret. Ram's brothers then devise a plan to unite the lovers.

title: Nagarahavu
cast: Upendra|Jyothika|Ambika|Sadhu Kokila|Doddanna
overview: Ajay Sharma is set out to kill Madan Chopra and destroy his family, who is responsible for Ajay's father, Vishwanth's death. Will Ajay succeed?

title: Malla
cast: V. Ravichandran|Priyanka Upendra|Mohan Shankar|Umashree|Pavitra Lokesh
overview: Shiva, a florist's son, grows up to become a gangster. After his father is murdered, he sets out to take revenge against the culprits.

title: Paduvaaralli Pandavaru
cast: Ambareesh|Ramakrishna|Jai Jagadish|Aarathi|Shubha
overview: Five men come together to fight against a corrupt landlord to secure justice for the tyranny caused by him in their village.

title: Mukunda Murari
cast: Upendra|Sudeep|P. Ravi Shankar|Kavya Shah
overview: A shopkeeper takes God to court when his shop is destroyed by an earthquake

title: Jaana
cast: V. Ravichandran|Kasturi Shankar|Shruti|B. C. Patil|Anandaraj
overview: Ravishankar, a bank manager, is transferred to Bengaluru where he falls in love with the CM's daughter, Kasturi. Ravi decides to step up when the terrorists kidnap her to settle scores with the CM.

title: Nanne Preethse: I Love You
cast: Upendra|Rachita Ram|Sonu Gowda|Sayaji Shinde|Brahmanandam
overview: When Santu meets Dharmika after few years of romantic college life, will he win the lost love, or is there something surprise round the corner.

title: Cheluveye Ninne Nodalu
cast: Shivaraj Kumar|Sonal Chauhan|Ramesh Aravind|Prem Kumar|Kavya
overview: The life of Vishwa, a tourist guide, takes a turn when he meets Prakruthi.

title: Banallu Neene Buviyallu Neene
cast: Divyaa Unni|S. Narayan|Shashikumar|Rekha Vedavyas|Shobaraj
overview: Gopala Krishna is forced into rehabilitating Lalitha, an amnesiac. He pretends to be her husband in order to help her recover but problems arise when her real husband shows up.

title: Nagara Mahime
cast: Sripriya|Sundar Krishna Urs|Dinesh|Musuri Krishnamurthy|M. S. Umesh

title: Tabbaliyu Neenade Magane
cast: Naseeruddin Shah|Om Puri|Lakshmi Krishnamurthy|T. S. Nagabharana
overview: The movie explores the cultural problems experienced by an American woman, newly married to an Indian, adjusting to Indian norms and customs. It depicts a modern man who studies agriculture in the United States, returns to India with an American wife with their different views. The theme is one alienation from the fellow human beings.

title: Huttu Habbada Shubhashayagalu
cast: Diganth Manchale|Kavitha Gowda|Chethan Gandharva|Madenuru Manu|Sujay Shastri
overview: At a birthday party, birthday boy Avinash was murdered by someone in the house. Who is the killer and what is the motive behind the crime?

title: Ricky
cast: Rakshit Shetty|Hariprriya|Achyuth Kumar|Ravi Kale|Pramod Shetty
overview: City-bred wildlife conservationist Ricky falls in love with a simple village girl Radha. Their love story takes an unexpected turn when Ricky leaves on an outdoor assignment. Set against, a naxal backdrop, it is a story that will have you experience many edge of the seat moments.

title: Physics Teacher
cast: Prerana Kambam|Mandya Ramesh|Rajesh Nataranga|Sumukha
overview: The film chronicles the journey of a_young Physics teacher who believes that nothing in this world exists without a scientific reason. Superstitions do not hold any importance in his life, until there arises a situation that challenges his ideologies. Will he lose faith in his ideologies? Or Will he fight harder?

title: Mane Devru
cast: V. Ravichandran|Sudharani|K. S. Ashwath|Disco Shanti|Tennis Krishna
overview: A woman divorces her husband when he blurts out in a drunken stupor that he slept with a widow. He hatches a plan to reconcile with his family after failing to reason with her.

title: Nagarahavu
cast: Vishnuvardhan|Diganth Manchale|Divya Spandana
overview: Naganika's family is in charge of an ancient monument that Kapali has his eyes set on. When Kapali kills her to seek the monument, Naganika transforms into a snake in her next life to seek revenge.

title: Mrugashira
cast: Manasa Himavarsha|Prajwal Devaraj|Sadhu Kokila|Manasa|Thriller Manju
overview: Prajwal, a happy-go-lucky college-goer, accidentally lands into a forbidden land, along with two unexpected partners, a drunkard and an insurance agent. The story then turns into a quasi-fantasy tale, mixing action, romance, comedy and all other possible genres.

title: Samyuktha
cast: Shivaraj Kumar|Chi. Guru Dutt|Balaraj|K. S. Ashwath|Sundar Krishna Urs
overview: A young man falls in love with a girl and will go to any extent to prove his love for her. However, things take a turn when he is challenged to stay in a haunted house.  This was the 6th movie of Shivarajkumar as a lead hero. The movie is based on the novel Samyuktha authored by Kakolu Saroja Rao. Originally, the movie was supposed to star Chi Gurudutt and Balaraj in lead roles, however, Shivarajkumar was later brought on board as one of the leads of the movie to garner recognition amongst the audience. The soundtracks for the movie were composed by director Singeetam Srinivasa Rao and background score was composed by Shankar-Ganesh. This was also the first horror thriller movie of Shivarajkumar.

title: Chef Chidambara
cast: Aniruddha Jatkar|Nidhi Subbaiah|Rachel David|Sharath Lohitashwa
overview: Chidambara, a professional chef, tries to help a rich lady in return she would help him out of his financial crisis but gets entangled when a person dies at his flat. Can Chidambara get out of this mess?

title: Ravi Shastry
cast: V. Ravichandran|Sneha|Anant Nag|Doddanna|Vinaya Prasad
overview: Ravi Shastry, a barber's son, pretends to be a Brahmin to secure a livelihood. His wedding to Bhanu, the Brahmin community head's daughter, is stalled when his bluff is called.

title: Sowbhagya Devathe
cast: Shruti|Rajesh|Sridhar|Vinaya Prasad|Sai Kumar

title: Taandob
cast: Shakib Khan|Sabila Nur|Jaya Ahsan|Afzal Hossain|Shahiduzzaman Selim

title: Summer Holiday
cast: Arif|Lion|Zubayar
overview: An eight-year-old city boy Shuvo is restricted from mixing with others. He goes to spend the summer holiday in the village with his grandmother and enjoys freedom for the first time. Here, Shuvo meets Moinna whom everybody believes is a "bee fated" boy that gets attacked by the bees wherever he goes. Bitten by honey bees, recently Moinna has been captivated at home under the strict surveillance of his mother. Feeling claustrophobic, Moinna conspires with his younger brother Anaira to get out of home exploiting Shuvo. Wandering around the village with Moinna, Shuvo starts discovering a new world but suddenly Moinna is found missing.

title: Toofan
cast: Shakib Khan|Mimi Chakraborty|Masuma Rahman Nabila|Chanchal Chowdhury|Misha Sawdagor
overview: Born into tragedy, Galib rises from village outcast to criminal mastermind "Toofan" in 90s Bangladesh. As authorities close in, he takes desperate measures to maintain his empire, sparking a dangerous game of power and identity.

title: Paglu 2
cast: Dev|Koel Mallick|Rimjhim Mitra|Tota Roy Chowdhury|Rajatabha Dutta
overview: Dev is a high school drop out from and a worthless village lad. He is hell bent on getting married. But the girl he wants to marry rejects him stating that he doesn't have college education. Dev, who is clever and street-smart decides to go to Kolkata for further education. While travelling in the train, he bashes up a bunch of rowdies teasing college girls. At the college in Kolkata, he meets Riya (and falls in love with her. A city gangster, Rudra,is in love with her and blackmails her to marry him. He beats anyone moving closely with Riya. Meanwhile, henchmen of the dreaded chieftain Dubai Keshto, from Dubai, are looking for Dev in the city.

title: Borbaad
cast: Shakib Khan|Idhika Paul|Jisshu Sengupta|Misha Sawdagor|Samm Bhattacharyya
overview: After a heartbreak by Nitu, Ariyan Mirza seeks revenge, guided by his father Adib Mirza's wisdom. Their story transforms from romance to violence, culminating in courtroom confrontations over justice.

title: MR-9: Do or Die
cast: Frank Grillo|Michael Jai White|Kelly Greyson|Matt Passmore|Sakshi Pradhan
overview: Elite Bangladeshi CIA agent Masud Rana – codename MR-9 – teams up with an American CIA operative to bring down an international criminal organization headed by a ruthless businessman.

title: The Grave
cast: Gazi Rakayet|Gazi Amatun Nur Duti|Ashiul Islam|A.K. Azad Shetu|Sushama Sarker
overview: Shirja Mia is grave digger. He begs from village to village to get death news. Now he has only two things in his life. One is a doll which he bought for his daughter and other is a number which he has got from his ancestors. His ancestors believed that if someone could dig hundred graves he would surely be placed in heaven. But no one could ever reach the target. When shirja was young he came to a Char and got married. They had a lovely daughter named Rahela. He had to go to town for work. Rahela asked for a doll from the town. One day Shirja bought a doll, but he couldn't come back to Char due to bad weather. Next day he heard that the tidal bore had washed out the Char. Later he came back to Char. But he didn't find his daughter and wife anywhere. The Char was full of dead bodies. At that time he started digging graves. When one grave left to reach the hundredth, he falls in big crisis with a girl like his daughter. Will Shirja be able to complete one hundred graves?

title: Jongli
cast: Siam Ahmed|Shobnom Bubly|Prarthana Fardin Dighi|Noireta|Dilara Zaman
overview: Liza made a difficult decision at the moment of the birth of her illegitimate child in the hospital. So she had no choice but to abandon the child in the dustbin. As she was leaving the baby in a dumpster on the road behind the hospital in the dark of night, she came face to face with Dr. Tithi—the very doctor who had delivered Liza's baby in the operating theater. Tithi brought her back to the hospital and began to tell her a story. A story intertwined with Tithi herself, a 6-year-old girl named Pakhi, and a wild-hearted man named Johnny.

title: Pather Panchali
cast: Kanu Bannerjee|Karuna Banerjee|Chunibala Devi|Uma Das Gupta|Subir Banerjee
overview: A depiction of the life of an impoverished early twentieth century rural Bengali family.

title: Poran
cast: Sariful Razz|Bidya Sinha Saha Mim|Yash Rohan|Shahiduzzaman Selim|Rosey Siddiqui
overview: A street level drug supplier falls in love with a college student. Despite avoiding him at first, the girl later uses him for her own benefit by acting of being in love with him. Later she falls in love with another boy but still can't break the relationship with the first lover as he accepts all her demands and changes himself leaving all his drug supplying works behind. The girl falling in dilemma hands the boy to Police. But fate brings them face to face again to experience some tragedy.

title: Athhoi
cast: Arna Mukhopadhyay|Anirban Bhattacharya|Sohini Sarkar|Mimi Dutta|Ditipriya Roy
overview: A contemporary retelling of William Shakespeare's timeless tragedy Othello, exploring the intricacies of human emotions and the consequences of unchecked manipulation, all within a Bengali context.

title: Cosmic Sex
cast: Rii Sen|Ayushman Mitra|Murari Mukherjee|Papia Ghoshal|Rwik
overview: Cosmic Sex is a 2014 art-house Independent Bengali Film written and directed by Amitabh Chakraborty and produced by Putul Mahmood. The film deals with the connection between Sex and Spirituality.Cosmic Sex is the story of a young man Kripa who is on the run from sex and violence one night in Kolkata when he meets a woman Sadhavi who strangely resembles his dead mother. She gives him shelter and teaches him to travel inwards through sex. The film deals with Dehotatva (worshipping through one’s own body) and explores the connection between Sex and Spirituality. The film stars Rii Sen who won the best actress award at Osian's Cinefan Festival of Asian and Arab Cinema for her bold act in the movie.[

title: Daagi
cast: Afran Nisho|Tama Mirza|Sunerah Binte Kamal|Shahiduzzaman Selim|Rashed Mamun Apu
overview: Nishan spent more than twelve years behind bars. The story begins as he steps out of prison, only to find that the world he left behind has changed drastically. Society refuses to accept him as one of its own. Thus begins Nishan's struggle to survive in an unfamiliar world.

title: Gandu
cast: Anubrata Basu|Rii Sen|Kamalika Banerjee|Silajit Majumder|Joyraj Bhattacharya
overview: After Nihilistic rapper Gandu steals from his mother's lover, he embarks on a drug-fueled rampage with a rickshaw puller.

title: Apur Sansar
cast: Soumitra Chatterjee|Sharmila Tagore|Alok Chakravarty|Swapan Mukherjee|Dhiresh Majumdar
overview: Apu, now a jobless ex-student dreaming vaguely of a future as a writer, is invited to join an old college friend on a trip up-country to a village wedding.

title: Killbill Society
cast: Parambrata Chatterjee|Koushani Mukherjee|Biswanath Basu|Sandipta Sen|Arijita Mukhopadhyay
overview: As Ananda Kar returns, now as Mrityunjay Kar, truth and destiny collide in a journey of love, healing, and purpose. With its iconic music and unexpected twists, Killbill Society is set to redefine `existence` through its compelling story.

title: Mujib: The Making of a Nation
cast: Arifin Shuvo|Nusrat Imrose Tisha|Nusraat Faria Mazhar|Gazi Rakayet|Raisul Islam Asad
overview: Biopic on the father of the nation of Bangladesh, Sheikh Mujibur Rahman. The film will showcase his growing up as a child to his standing up against all injustice in his youth to fighting for the independence of his country. How he led a country to it's independence with his inspirational presence and fight for the justice.

title: Onko Ki Kothin
cast: Riddhiman Banerjee|Prosun Shome|Parno Mittra|Sankar Debnath|Ushasie Chakraborty
overview: Babin, Dolly, and Tyre are three slum kids with big dreams of becoming a doctor, nurse, and engineer. When Babin's father falls critically ill, they steal an oxygen cylinder that sets off a chain of events.

title: ESHA MURDER: Cycle of Karma
cast: Azmeri Haque Badhon|Puja Agnes Cruze|Sumit Sengupta|Misha Sawdagor|Shatabdi Wadud

title: Dispassionate Love
cast: Sagnik Mukherjee|Debleena Sen|Prakriti Dutta Mukheree
overview: Recalling memories of a friend who committed suicide, three lovers slowly slide into an anguish labyrinth of desire, loss and longing. They entangle in a colliding maze of forsaken loves, failed expectations and imperfect anticipations. A disintegrating web arises in which love exists, but as dispassionate yearning. Here affection is an indifferent desire that burns the soul to death.

title: The Music Room
cast: Chhabi Biswas|Gangapada Basu|Kali Sarkar|Tulsi Lahiri|Padmadevi
overview: An aging, decadent landlord’s passion for music becomes the undoing of his legacy as he sacrifices his wealth in order to compete with the opulent music room of his younger, richer neighbour.

title: Chokkor 302
cast: Mosharraf Karim|Sumon Anowar|Rawnak Hasan|Intekhab Dinar|Tareen Jahan
overview: When a young man is murdered, Inspector Mainul begins what seems like a straightforward case. But as he digs deeper, hidden truths, shifting motives, and shocking twists begin to unravel, turning the investigation into a gripping race to uncover the real killer.

title: Ke Tumi Nandini
cast: Bonny Sengupta|Rupsha Mukherjee|Shankar Chakraborty|Saayoni Ghosh|Sayantani Guhathakurta
overview: Ke Tumi Nandini is the journey of a young, spirited girl Nandini (Rupsha), who is of tom-boyish nature and aspires to be a medical student. She develops a liking for a man named Abir ( ...

title: Khadaan
cast: Dev|Jisshu Sengupta|Idhika Paul|Barkha Bisht|Sneha Bose
overview: Shyam comes from the remote areas of Purulia to work as a laborer in the coal mines of the Damodar Valley. The story of Mohan and Shyam will proceed with their rise, reckoning of friendship.

title: Sonar Kellay Jawker Dhan
cast: Parambrata Chatterjee|Koel Mallick|Gaurav Chakrabarty|Saheb Chatterjee|Suprobhat Das
overview: The adventure that began in Sonar Kella continues. Haunted by visions of a hidden treasure, Mukul Dhars fate is on the line. As danger closes in, Bimal, Rubi, and Kumar set off on a thrilling journey through the secrets of Jaisalmer Fort. Chasing riddles, uncovering legends, and seeking a mythical stone, they venture into a world that could change their lives forever.

title: Shiva
cast: Prosenjit Chatterjee|Sabyasachi Chakraborty|Tota Roy Chowdhury|Subhasish Mukherjee|Biplab Chatterjee
overview: Shiva is a 2002 Bengali film directed by Zillur Rahman and starring Prosenjit Chatterjee as the titular character.

title: Aparajito
cast: Karuna Banerjee|Smaran Ghosal|Pinaki Sengupta|Kanu Bannerjee|Santi Gupta
overview: Apu and his family have moved away from the country to live in the bustling holy city of Benares. As he progresses from wide-eyed child to intellectually curious teenager, eventually studying in Kolkata, we witness his academic and moral education, as well as the growing complexity of his relationship with his mother.

title: Dhoomketu
cast: Dev|Subhashree Ganguly|Rudranil Ghosh|Chiranjeet Chakraborty
overview: Megh is a married person, who works as manager of a tea estate in North Sikkim. In a certain crisis he became jobless and struggles to make ends problems of his life because there are not many options for livelihood around in the hills. He fights to bring back joy into his family's life.

title: Teen Ekke Teen
cast: Tapas Paul|Sreelekha Mitra|Koneenica Banerjee|Subhendu Chatterjee|Paran Banerjee
overview: Teen Ekke Teen (2006) is an Indian Bengali comedy film directed by Malay Bhattacharjee.

title: Charulata
cast: Madhabi Mukherjee|Soumitra Chatterjee|Shailen Mukherjee|Shyamal Ghoshal|Gitali Roy
overview: In 1870s India, Charulata is an isolated, artistically inclined woman who sees little of her busy journalist husband, Bhupati. Realizing that his wife is alienated and unhappy, he convinces his cousin, Amal, to spend time with Charulata and nourish her creative impulses. Amal is a fledgling poet himself, and he and Charulata bond over their shared love of art.

title: Mission Extreme 2: Black War
cast: Arifin Shuvo|Misha Sawdagor|Shatabdi Wadud|Sadia Nabila|Taskeen Rahman
overview: As a terror leader threatens the nation's stability, ADC Nabid pursues their group while navigating a wave of anonymous attacks. Nabid must act fast to stop the terrorists before it's too late.

title: Surongo
cast: Afran Nisho|Tama Mirza|Mostafa Monwar|Shahiduzzaman Selim|Nusraat Faria Mazhar
overview: Moyna and Masud's marriage takes a tumultuous turn when their differing desires clash. While Masud leaves for Malaysia, Moyna seeks comfort in the arms of another man. Can they start afresh?

title: Premrog
cast: Sudip Mukherjee|Meghna Haldar|Suman Bannerjee|Mrinal Mukherjee|Ashok Mukherjee
overview: Sickness of love triangle concerning the police officer, his wife, her lover.

title: Babli
cast: Subhashree Ganguly|Abir Chatterjee|Sauraseni Maitra|Sohini Sengupta|Sandip Bhattacharya
overview: Babli, a chubby straight-spoken, prideful, sweet girl is escorted by Abhirup Sen, a handsome, soft-spoken, humble guy on her journey from Imphal to Dimapur. At Kolkata airport, Babli meets her school friend Jhuma Bose, a smart and attractive air hostess who has fallen for Abhirup. Will Babli and Abhi ever get together?

title: Rabindra Kabya Rahasya
cast: Ritwick Chakraborty|Srabanti Chatterjee|Bidipta Chakraborty|Shantilal Mukherjee|Rwitobroto Mukherjee
overview: Serial killing. United Kingdom. Rabindranath Tagore.

title: Agantuk
cast: Abir Chatterjee|Sohini Sarkar|Debapratimm Dasgupta|Devlina Kumar|Siddhartha Ray
overview: An old lady, Shobharani Basu, is found dead in her apartment. A self-appointed private investigator calls it a murder. What could be the cause of her death?

title: The Hero
cast: Uttam Kumar|Sharmila Tagore|Bireswar Sen|Somen Bose|Nirmal Ghosh
overview: Arindam, a matinee idol, is going by train to collect an acting award. On the train, he is confronted by Aditi, a journalist who somewhat unwillingly starts to take his interview. Arindam, won over by Aditi's naivete, starts to disclose his past, his fears and his secrets.

title: Insaaf: Tale of Legends
cast: Sariful Razz|Mosharraf Karim|Tasnia Farin|Misha Sawdagor|Fazlur Rahman Babu

title: Khelaghar
cast: Prosenjit Chatterjee|Santu Mukherjee|Soumitra Bannerjee|Rituparna Sengupta|Supriya Choudhury
overview: Based on the short story by Dibyendu Palit, four brothers in an Indian Bengali family conspire against each other over property.

title: Paglu
cast: Dev|Koel Mallick|Rajatabha Dutta|Tulika Basu|Parthasarathi Chakraborty
overview: Deb and Rimi are in love, but Rimi's father is against their relationship. Her father tricks her into coming to US to keep her away from Deb, but he follows her to US and tries to win her back.

title: Shotyi Bole Shotyi Kichhu Nei
cast: Suhotra Mukhopadhyay|Kaushik Sen|Kaushik Ganguly|Anirban Chakrabarti|Sauraseni Maitra
overview: Twelve jury members debate fiercely over a murder trial. Only one juror is convinced that the convict is not guilty of the crime and he tries to convince the rest that the boy is innocent.

title: The Stranger
cast: Ehan Rashid|Ratan Deb
overview: A coming-of-age story that navigates the journey of a family in which the young son grapples with questions about his gender identity.

title: Kacher Manush Dure Thuiya
cast: Pritom Hasan|Tasnia Farin|Rupanty Akid|Samapti Mashuk|Khalilur Rahman Kadery
overview: A Tale of Touch. ‘Kacher Manush Dure Thuiya’: is a story of going away for the needs of life, and returning to the stirring of feelings. This long-distance relationship saga unveils the poignant struggles of lovers separated by thousands of miles – a narrative steeped in the complexities of distance, evoking doubt, mistrust, anger, and resentment, ultimately culminating in separation. It's a poignant portrayal of the profound longing for physical closeness, encapsulated in the simple yet profound act of a hug, bridging the chasm between distant hearts.

title: Jor
cast: Jeet|Dipankar Dey|Rudranil Ghosh|Subrat Dutta|Varsha Priyadarshini
overview: Surja (Jeet) is a sportsman. He loves to run and win championships in Kolkata. Once on a championship tour, he goes to Siliguri. There he runs into an influential gang leader Indrajit (...

title: Chirodini Tumi Je Amar
cast: Rahul Banerjee|Priyanka Sarkar|Rudranil Ghosh|Gita Dey|Tina Datta
overview: Pallavi, a rich, beautiful school student, falls in love with Krishna, a scooter mechanic, and gets married without her parents' approval. The situation takes an ugly turn when her family tries to separate them.

title: The Big City
cast: Madhabi Mukherjee|Anil Chatterjee|Haren Chatterjee|Haradhan Bandopadhyay|Vicky Redwood
overview: After her husband loses his job, a housewife from a middle-class, conservative family in Calcutta gets a job as a salesperson.

title: Bhootpori
cast: Jaya Ahsan|Bishantak Mukherjee|Ritwick Chakraborty|Sudipta Chakraborty|Shantilal Mukherjee
overview: The film chronicles the tale of a deceased woman and a little boy who meets the restless soul of the departed woman. The woman seeks help from the little boy to unravel the mystery behind her death.

title: The Adventures of Goopy and Bagha
cast: Tapan Chatterjee|Rabi Ghosh|Santosh Dutta|Harindranath Chattopadhyay|Ajoy Bandyopadhyay
overview: Goopy Gyne and Bagha Byne are banished from their respective villages for being bad musicians. However, with their skills, they succeed in pleasing the king of ghosts who grants them three boons. How will they succeed in preventing the war between Halla and Shundi which is looming large?

title: A Night of Knowing Nothing
cast: Bhumisuta Das
overview: L, a student in India witness to the government's violent response to university protests, writes letters to her estranged lover while he is away.

title: Mirror Game
cast: Chanchal Chowdhury|Masuma Rahman Nabila|Partha Barua|Lutfur Rahman George|Gousul Alam Shaon
overview: Ayna is an actor and the prison is his stage. He slips into the characters of the powerful convicted in exchange of money and take their place in prison. This strange profession is borne out of a society that doesn't give him a chance to follow his passion of acting, but forces him to act in the real life. Falling in love with the girl next door changes his life equation and he decides to end this career with one last performance. But this one takes him too deep in the rabbit hole. The story unfolds on how an underdog survives in a society that is merciless and struggles his way out from the clutch of crime game which he is a part too.

title: The Japanese Wife
cast: Rahul Bose|Raima Sen|Chigusa Takaku|Rudranil Ghosh|Moushumi Chatterjee
overview: Snehmoy and Miyage are pen friends who exchange wedding vows through letters. Fifteen years pass but they never meet. Yet the bond of marriage is strong between them. This unusual relationship comes under a cloud when a young widow, Sandhya, comes to stay with Snehmoy along with her eight-year-old son Poltu. Snehmoy and the little boy bond and the arithmetic teacher discovers the joy of palpable bonds and fatherhood. There develops an inexplicable thread of understanding with Sandhya too. But Snehmoy remained loyal to his unseen Japanese wife.

title: Magic
cast: Ankush Hazra|Oindrila Sen|Payel Sarkar|Bidipta Chakraborty|Subrata Guha Roy
overview: A thrilling tale of two people going through major ups and downs; and then not knowing it particularly.

title: Chandramallika
cast: Victor Banerjee|Ranjit Mallick|Samrat Mukherji|Subhasish Mukherjee|Chumki Choudhury

title: THE 7
cast: Nafis Ahmed|Imtiaz Barshon|Intekhab Dinar|Amjad Hossen|Khijir Hayat Khan
overview: A periodical war film based on the journey of 7 brave freedom fighters during the hit of battle in 1971 Liberation war of Bangladesh.

title: Tonsil
cast: Kali Bannerjee|Madhabi Mukherjee|Satya Bandopadhyay|Bhanu Banerjee|Jahar Roy
overview: Tapan Sinha's first Comedy Film & Madhabi Mukherjee's Debut Film.

title: The Cloud-Capped Star
cast: Supriya Choudhury|Anil Chatterjee|Gyanesh Mukhopadhyay|Bijon Bhattacharya|Gita Dey
overview: A selfless young woman, the daughter of a middle-class refugee family from East Pakistan, sacrifices her own happiness for her unappreciative family.

title: Priyotoma
cast: Shakib Khan|Idhika Paul|Shahiduzzaman Selim|Lutfur Rahman George|Kazi Hayat
overview: Shumon finds himself entangled in the arms of a politician's silly daughter, an encounter that would forever alter the course of his existence. Her sudden demise leaves an indelible mark on Shumon's life, shattering his world and leaving him forever transformed.

title: The Royal Bengal Tiger
cast: Shraddha Das|Jeet|Priyanka Sarkar|Abir Chatterjee|Shantilal Mukherjee
overview: Abhirup is a typical Bengali guy who has a happy family but he doesn't know how to protest. Everything was going very good but suddenly from his office to his personal life so many problems accrued in his life due to his scaredy attitude. Then his imaginary childhood friend Anjan comes into his life and changes his life completely.

title: Friday
cast: Nasir Uddin Khan|Tama Mirza|Bari Mohammed|Farzana Chobi|Mayiha Ahmed Adity
overview: Story of a woman who called 999, not for seeking help or support but to surrender to police. What was the reason behind it? This web film is inspired by a true event.

title: Ei Raat Tomar Amaar
cast: Anjan Dutt|Aparna Sen|Parambrata Chatterjee|Shruti Das|Rohit Mukherjee
overview: An elderly couple in their 70s revisit the regrets, heartbreaks, longing and acceptance in their five-decade-long marriage, all in one poignant night at their hillside retreat.

title: Boomerang
cast: Jeet|Rukmini Maitra|Kharaj Mukherjee|Rajatabha Dutta|Saurav Das
overview: A scientist with a brilliant brain builds a humanoid robot. But a series of events leads to thrill and comic situations that create a boomerang effect.

title: Distant Thunder
cast: Soumitra Chatterjee|Bobita|Sandhya Roy|Chitra Banerjee|Paritosh Banerjee
overview: Gangacharan is the new Brahmin of a village, where he assumes various duties: teaching, organizing religious events, and trying to prevent epidemics. But in that year 1943, war is raging (as reminded by the planes occasionally heard flying over the countryside), and a major famine is under way. As food shortages reach catastrophic proportions, Gangacharan attempts to preserve his privileged situation, while his generous wife, Ananga, conversely tries to help and support the community.

title: Hawa
cast: Chanchal Chowdhury|Nazifa Tushi|Shohel Mondol|Nasir Uddin Khan|Sariful Razz
overview: When eight sailors onboard their fishing trawler find a mysterious girl mid-sea, ill fortune falls upon the boat as they don't catch any fish the next few days. The fishermen try to make it back home, although the sea has other plans for them.

title: Glossary of Non-Human Love
cast: Satarupa Das|Jayshree Mukherjee|Sagnik Mukherjee|Megha Roy|Bijoli Sarkar
overview: In a parallel universe in our own space-time continuum, humanity has been overrun by artificial intelligence. The machines are better, faster and more efficient at everything, outstripping their makers. However, one aspect of humanity escapes them: love. Their guidebook attempts to capture the phenomenon in 64 terms, including jealousy, regret and ardour. Posing in homey and romantic settings, they run through the entire spectrum with digital precision, yet without a hint of passion.  Director Ashish Avikunthak outlines a worrying, yet confusing impression of a posthuman future in which technology has overtaken and annexed humanity. He presents the new masters of the universe as 2.0 versions of the Hindu pantheon. Yet while Hanuman, Shiva and Kali sometimes reveal all too human traits, this is definitely not the case when it comes to love. Loves dies out with humanity.

title: Ayesha’s Voyage
cast: Runa Khan|Shahiduzzaman Selim|Mrittika Haque|Amrita Saha|Nobonita
overview: Ayesha spends the whole day at her husband's house. Their child died in an accident on the way to their first outing with the child. After that till present she spends her days alone in the house. In the same old routine life of her and her husband. Despite repeated plans, her husband does not want to go anywhere except office. Ayesha is also under house arrest all day. No one comes to her nor does she go anywhere. Then suddenly one day the dream of a new life shows her the way to live in a new way.

title: Dilkhush
cast: Ujan Chatterjee|Aishwarya Sen|Soham Majumdar|Madhumita Sarkar|Kharaj Mukherjee
