overview: Dilkhush follows the story of eight individuals who find themselves in the loop of urban melancholy. Discovering love with the help of AI makes their ordinary lives extraordinary.

title: Torulatar Bhoot
cast: Prasanta Sutradhar|Indraneil Sengupta|Basabdatta Chatterjee|Ishaa Saha
overview: A group comes to a village resort for a day's outing. Melange of people of different age groups with their pranks, frolics, idiosyncrasies and pasts. In the village they come to know about a legend. There is a large water body called Torulatar Dighi, where the ghost of Torulata larks beneath the dark water and kills boys. And the group,which is supposed to return to Kolkata that evening, gets stranded in the resort owing to a road block.

title: Saba
cast: Mehazabien Chowdhury|Rokeya Prachy|Mostafa Monwar|Syeda Taslima Hossain Nodi|Shirin Alam
overview: With her father missing, Saba is the sole caregiver to her paraplegic mother, Shirin, who suffers from acute heart disease. Although Shirin's condition binds them together, her frustration with their situation often manifests as bitterness and anger towards her daughter, so they live in their own separate worlds. When Shirin has a heart attack, Saba races against time to sell their home, lowering the price, and even risking her burgeoning romance with her senior co-worker Ankur — who dreams of starting a new life abroad — to pay for her mom’s heart surgery.

title: Poran Jaye Jolia Re
cast: Dev|Subhashree Ganguly|Biswajit Chakraborty|Laboni Sarkar|Tota Roy Chowdhury
overview: Not hot enough Anna lives in London and is in love with an English man, Harry. However, when her father pressures her to get married to an Indian Bengali villager, she hatches a plan to get rid of him after her wedding.

title: Biye Bibhrat
cast: Abir Chatterjee|Lahoma Bhattacharya|Parambrata Chatterjee|Sudipa Basu|Swastika Dutta
overview: Shakya, a star singer yet tired of several failed relationships, decides to get hitched to a bride his mother has selected for him. But drama ensues, when Chandramauli, the bride's former boyfriend, tries to win her over.

title: Shapod
cast: Tariq Anam Khan|Sabnam Faria|Fs Nayeem|Shampa Reza|A.K. Azad Shetu
overview: There are countless small incidents hidden in the history of our liberation. Some of those are so brutal that my heart trembles when I hear those stories. This telefilm reflects the barbarism people of this country faced at the hands of the brutal Pakistani army.

title: Mahishasur Marddini
cast: Rituparna Sengupta|Saswata Chatterjee|Parambrata Chatterjee|Shaheb Bhattacherjee|Sritama Dey
overview: The film has been conceptualized as an apology letter to women from all sections of society, who have faced discrimination as well as have been victimized by both men and women in the patriarchal system.

title: Dear Ma
cast: Jaya Ahsan|Saswata Chatterjee|Chandan Roy Sanyal|Dhritiman Chatterjee|Shayan Munshi

title: Memories of Gloomy Monsoons
cast: Aynun Nahar Putul|Fazlul Haque|Shakkho Shahid|Abdullah Al Sentu
overview: The film revolves around the everyday life of people living in villages near rivers. The film shows how villagers get exploited by loan sharks, the struggles of farmers and more.

title: Mission Extreme
cast: Arifin Shuvo|Jannatul Ferdous Oishee|Manoj Kumar Pramanik|Taskeen Rahman|Misha Sawdagor
overview: Nabil Al Shahriar is a conscientious police officer of CTTC, is trying to track down a group of terrorists, who want to create inquietude and rampancy of terrorism. To stave them off, he along with his associates tries to find out what they’re up to.

title: Sathi
cast: Jeet|Priyanka Upendra|Ranjit Mallick|Kanchan Mullick|Rajesh Sharma
overview: A man sacrifices everything for his love, but his identity remains hidden from her for most of the movie.

title: Baishe Srabon
cast: Prosenjit Chatterjee|Parambrata Chatterjee|Raima Sen|Goutam Ghose|Abir Chatterjee
overview: A serial killer terrorises the city of Kolkata and leaves behind verses of Bengali poetry. The police seek the help of a retired officer to unravel the case and find the perpetrator.

title: Kaleidoscope Now
cast: Anjan Dutt|Sawon Chakraborty|Bidipta Chakraborty|Suprobhat Das|Subhasish Mukherjee
overview: A tribute to auteur Mrinal Sen, the film intricately weaves the personal and professional journeys of Kunal Sen and Ranjan through their collaboration on an ambitious film project, Chaalchitra, in 1981.

title: Byomkesh Hotyamancha
cast: Abir Chatterjee|Suhotra Mukhopadhyay|Kinjal Nanda|Arna Mukhopadhyay|Paoli Dam
overview: Set in the tumultuous Naxalite uprising in Bengal in 1971, Byomkesh Bakshi gets involved in a story of vengeance when he decides to attend a play at the theatre and becomes witness to a crime unfolding on the center stage. As Byomkesh digs deep into the case, it opens him to a tripartite story of love, betrayal, and infidelity. And how the mystery is laid bare for Byomkesh to solve.

title: Mona: Jinn-2
cast: Fazley Zakaria|Sazzad Hossain|Tariq Anam Khan|Ahmed Rubel|Suprovat
overview: A 12-year-old girl, her visage twisted by an otherworldly force, gnawing on a bone with a menacing.....

title: Shastri
cast: Mithun Chakraborty|Soham Chakraborty|Debashree Roy|Sauraseni Maitra|Rajatabha Dutta
overview: Porimol, a humble factory worker, dreams of changing his luck. After losing his job and facing mounting struggles, something mysterious happens that grants him the ability to predict the future.

title: Power
cast: Jeet|Nusrat Jahan|Sayantika Banerjee|Manasi Sinha|Kharaj Mukherjee
overview: Being a policeman's doppelganger is a mixed blessing in this action-packed caper.

title: Tor Naam
cast: Gaurav Bajaj|Victor Banerjee|Suman Bannerjee|Biswanath Basu|Mithu Chakrabarty
overview: Tor Naam is a 2012 Bengali movie directed by Jaya Sankar and produced by Weird Industries. The film is a remake of the Telegu movie Kotha Bangaru Lokam.

title: Three Daughters
cast: Chandana Banerjee|Nripati Chatterjee|Anil Chatterjee|Khagen Pathak|Kali Bannerjee
overview: Three stories with three central female characters linking the stories together.  The first one concerns an orphan girl who grows attached to the postmaster she is caring for after he teaches her to read and write. The second one is a supernatural tale about a woman obsessed with the jewels her husband buys for her. The final one follows a young man who falls for an unconventional girl from his new village instead of his arranged bride, the daughter of a respectable family.

title: Jomalaye Jibanta Bhanu
cast: Saswata Chatterjee|Ambarish Bhattacharya|Debleena Dutt|Saheb Chatterjee|Paran Banerjee
overview: Scientist Samyomoy Banerjee invents a time machine but dies mysteriously. In heaven, Indian actor Bhanu Banerjee suspects foul play and vows to send him back. Will Samyomoy return to finish his invention?

title: Utshob
cast: Zahid Hasan|Shommo Jyoti|Sadia Ayman|Chanchal Chowdhury|Jaya Ahsan
overview: On the eve of Eid, a grumpy, miserly loner Jahangir is visited by three mysterious guests, claiming to be ghosts. As they make him revisit his past, Jahangir is forced to confront the life he has built in bitterness and solitude. A heartwarming tale of regrets, memories and rediscovering love and laughter.

title: The Adversary
cast: Dhritiman Chatterjee|Krishna Bose|Indira Devi|Kalyan Chatterjee|Jayasree Kabir
overview: Siddhartho Chowdhury, a brilliant young medical student, is forced to leave his studies after his father's sudden demise. He is forced to navigate the high unemployment rate and the communist socio-political climate of 1960s Calcutta in search of a job. He lives in a flat with his younger, employed sister, revolutionary brother and widowed mother. The strain of the situation ultimately causes him to hallucinate.

title: Made in Bangladesh
cast: Reekita Nondine Shimu|Novera Rahman|Parvin Paru|Mayabi Rahman|Shahana Goswami
overview: Shimu, 23, works in a clothing factory in Dhaka, Bangladesh. Faced with difficult conditions at work, she decides to start a union with her co-workers. Despite threats from the management and disapproval of her husband, Shimu is determined to go on. Together the women must fight and find a way to register their union.

title: The Golden Thread
cast: Madhabi Mukherjee|Satindra Bhattacharya|Abhi Bhattacharya|Gita Dey|Bijon Bhattacharya
overview: After an old college friend offers him a job at an iron foundry, the upright and honest Ishwar leaves a shanty town on the outskirts of Calcutta where he lives with a group of refugees from East Bengal. With plans to forge a solid living for himself, sister Sita and Abhiram, an orphaned boy he offers a home to, Ishwar is accused of selling out and deserting his people.

title: A River Called Titas
cast: Rosy Afsary|Kabori Sarwar|Rawshan Zamil|Rani Sarkar|Sufia Rustam
overview: An in-depth look at the lives and struggles of a fishing community living by the River Titas in Bangladesh after the Partition of India in 1947.

title: Boudi Canteen
cast: Parambrata Chatterjee|Subhashree Ganguly|Soham Chakraborty|Anashua Majumdar|Arun Bannerjee
overview: Poulami, a school teacher and housewife, dreams of utilising her cooking skills to start her own business. But as she takes a bold step towards building her enterprise, will she find her way to success?

title: Icche
overview: Manas is an insurance agent. He lives with his wife Mamata and son Shamik. Mamata is dissatisfied by her husband's outlook and dreams of bringing up her son differently. But, when Shamik grows up he starts rebelling against his mother's decisions and dominance.  ~Wikipedia

title: Deyaler Desh
cast: Sariful Razz|Shobnom Bubly|Shahadat Hossain|Azizul Hakim|Saberi Alam

title: Lohar Tori
cast: Tanjin Tisha|Manoj Kumar Pramanik|Lenin Chekov|Samonty Shoumi|Shahjahan Samrat

title: Monpura
cast: Chanchal Chowdhury|Farhana Mili|Fazlur Rahman Babu|Mamunur Rashid|Monir Khan Shimul
overview: A heartbreaking tale of a poor yet honest young man as lies, conspiracies and a horrible betrayal by his rich and influential employer leads his life towards uncertainty.

title: Komal Gandhar
cast: Supriya Choudhury|Abanish Banerjee|Anil Chatterjee|Satindra Bhattacharya|Gita Dey
overview: Through the microcosmic perspectivising of a group of devoted and uncompromising IPTA workers, Ghatak with his signature style touches on varied issues of partition, idealism, corruption, the interdependence of art and life, the scope of art, and class-struggle.

title: The Home and the World
cast: Soumitra Chatterjee|Victor Banerjee|Swatilekha Sengupta|Gopa Aich|Jennifer Kendal
overview: When the movie opens, a woman is recalling the events that molded her perspective on the world. Years ago, her husband, a wealthy Western-educated landowner, challenged tradition by providing her with schooling, and inviting her out of the seclusion in which married women were kept, to the consternation of more conservative relatives. Meeting her husband's visiting friend from college, a leader of an economic rebellion against the British, she takes up his political cause, despite her husbands warnings. As the story progresses, the relationship between the woman and the visitor becomes more than platonic, and the political battles, pitting rich against poor and Hindu against Moslem, turn out not to be quite as simple as she had first thought.

title: Pokkhirajer Dim
cast: Mahabrata Basu|Anirban Bhattacharya|Anumegha Banerjee|Shyamal Chakraborty|Debesh Roy Chowdhury
overview: Egg of a magical bird.

title: Dui Prithibi
cast: Jeet|Dev|Koel Mallick|Supriyo Dutta|Debranjan Nag
overview: A rich man falls in love with an idealistic medical student. However, when circumstances force them apart, he learns the true meaning and value of love.

title: Chokher Bali
cast: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan|Raima Sen|Lily Chakravarty|Tota Roy Chowdhury|Prosenjit Chatterjee
overview: A young woman is left to her own devices when her sickly husband dies. Based on the novel by Rabindranath Tagore.

title: Gunin
cast: Pori Moni|Sariful Razz|Iresh Zaker|Dilara Zaman|Mostafa Monwar
overview: The movie is about the clash among two brothers in an eternal love triangle followed by the mysterious death of their grandfather Razab Ali Guning, a village exorciser.

title: Taboo
overview: After a person commits something forbidden, he becomes the talk of the town. People around him try to unfold the events that led to the incident.

title: Raavan
cast: Jeet|Shataf Figar|Kharaj Mukherjee|Lahoma Bhattacharya|Tanushree Chakraborty
overview: Is Ram Mukherjee Raavan in disguise?

title: Kakababur Protyaborton
cast: Prosenjit Chatterjee|Aryann Bhowmick|Anirban Chakrabarti|Srijit Mukherji|Alonso Grandio
overview: A famous hotel in Nairobi is about to close. People don't go to that hotel like before. Kakababu and Santu go to the hotel to find out the reason. Based on Jongoler Modhye Ek Hotel.

title: Devi
cast: Sharmila Tagore|Soumitra Chatterjee|Chhabi Biswas|Karuna Banerjee|Purnendu Mukherjee
overview: A devout upper-class Hindu has a vision in a dream that his daughter-in-law is the human incarnation of the Goddess Kali and begins worshipping her.

title: Kurban
cast: Ankush Hazra|Priyanka Sarkar|Shantilal Mukherjee|Kanchan Mullick|Subrata Guha Roy
overview: Kurban tells the story of a Muslim family in Bengal. The story will tell a humane tale in a rural backdrop. In the film, Hasan has his abba, ammi, ammi's adopted sister, her son Hasu, and Hijal. Hasan loves them immensely. Hasan is a sensitive person who looks at life differently than others, which throws him grave challenges. A storm comes to Hasan's happy family and his values are questioned. The story deals with what he does then.

title: Boumar Banobas
cast: Laboni Sarkar|Satabdi Roy|Dulal Lahiri|Tapas Paul

title: Feludar Goyendagiri: Darjeeling Jawmjawmaat
cast: Tota Roy Chowdhury|Anirban Chakrabarti|Kalpan Mitra|Shaheb Bhattacherjee|Subrat Dutta
overview: The suave Prodosh C. Mitter aka Feluda has ruled over our hearts with his sharp wit, impressive intellect and astute observation skills for over five decades now! The story starts off with the murder of Birupaksha Majumdar by Vishnudas Balaporia in the cold Darjeeling Mountains. Feluda, Topshey and Lalmohun Ganguly investigate.

title: Antoratma
cast: Shakib Khan|Darshana Banik|Jhuna Chowdhury|Shahed Sharif Khan|Aruna Biswas
overview: Prothom is lonely and longs for Rupkotha's love.

title: Utsab
cast: Madhabi Mukherjee|Mamata Shankar|Rituparna Sengupta|Prosenjit Chatterjee|Pradip Mukherjee
overview: Family tension runs high when four grown siblings reunite at their elderly mother’s home. When the mother reveals that she might sell off the estate, the announcement stirs up painful memories and uncovers a long-buried secret.

title: Goynar Baksho
cast: Konkona Sen Sharma|Moushumi Chatterjee|Saswata Chatterjee|Paran Banerjee|Srabanti Chatterjee
overview: Shirshendu Mukhopadhyay's famous tale of 3 generations of women & their changing position in society,seen in relation to a box of jewels, handed down from one generation to the next. A film by Aparna Sen.

title: The Elephant God
cast: Soumitra Chatterjee|Siddhartha Chatterjee|Santosh Dutta|Utpal Dutt|Parinita Banerjee
overview: Set in the holy city of Benares, this is the second film about the detective Feluda, who goes on a holiday with his cousin, Topshe, and his friend, Lalmohan Ganguly. But the theft of a priceless deity of Lord Ganesh (the Elephant God) from a local household forces him to investigate.

title: Female 4
cast: Chashi Alam|Marzuk Russell|Mohammad Saidur Rahman Pavel|Ziaul Hoque Polash|Sharaf Ahmed Zibon
overview: In a peaceful battery goli, where everyone took an oath not to fight amongst themselves, chaos ensues as another Female hops into the scene.

title: The Mind Flies
cast: Baishakhi Roy|Subhankar Mohanta
overview: An interfaith couple flee persecution in their village and begin a new life in the city, compelled to live on the open pavements like countless migrants. But their minds are captivated by a throne-like armchair in an exquisite showroom right beside their settlement on which they dream to sit together one day as king and queen.

title: The Exile
cast: Arghya Roy|Adrita De|Arpita De|Soumya Majumdar
overview: Gouranga, a young man in 1960s rural Bengal, embarks on a journey where he encounters not only the local myths about a supernatural presence, but also his own demons which were buried in his past. The film was in the list of TOP 10 Recommended Movies of NFDC Film Bazaar 2023. It also won the Film Bazaar Recommends Award in the Viewing Room Category.

title: Harami
cast: Sunny Kundu|Ushasi Ghosh|Atanu Das|Rishi
overview: A couple visits a resort for their honeymoon. The wife is not happy with the husband as he is unable to give pleasure to her. Two friends who were in the same resort plans to have sex with the wife. They successfully lure the wife to their room after having drinks with the couple. Next morning the wife is shocked after seeing the video of her with the boys.

title: Rajkumar
cast: Shakib Khan|Courtney Coffey|Mahiya Mahi|Tariq Anam Khan|Dilara Zaman
overview: A journey of a son separated from his mother during the 1971 war. A son embarks on a quest to reunite with his mother in the United States, the profound impact of his search leaving an indelible mark and shattered his life forever.

title: Habji Gabji
cast: Parambrata Chatterjee|Subhashree Ganguly|Samontak Dyuti Maitra|Osh Mallick
overview: Ambitious parents Ahana and Aditya, grappling with their erratic working hours, introduce their son Tipu to mobile gaming. Over time, the situation takes a turn as the boy's harmless pastime spirals into a relentless addiction.

title: The Golden Fortress
cast: Soumitra Chatterjee|Santosh Dutta|Siddhartha Chatterjee|Kushal Chakraborty|Shailen Mukherjee
overview: A young boy becomes a target for crooks, after he claims to remember his past life and mentions precious jewels in a golden fortress.

title: Sohag
cast: Katha Nandi|Rahul Sil
overview: Sohag is about a girl who loves Gagan. Gangan borrowed some money and in fear that henchmen of the loanshark is going to attack him

title: Fatafati
cast: Ritabhari Chakraborty|Abir Chatterjee|Swastika Dutta|Loknath Dey|Soma Banerjee
overview: Phullora Bhaduri, a tailor from the suburbs with a gifted sense of design, is ridiculed for being on the heavier side. Can she become a fashion influencer despite the odds?

title: Praktan
cast: Prosenjit Chatterjee|Rituparna Sengupta|Biswanath Basu|Soumitra Chatterjee|Manali Dey
overview: A married woman on journey from Mumbai to Howrah by train meets her ex-husband.

title: Damu
cast: Raghubir Yadav|Rimi Sen|Satya Bandopadhyay|Sabyasachi Chakraborty|Manoj Mitra
overview: A gullible man faces strange situations on his quest fo find an elephant in order to keep a promise he made with a little girl.

title: Ludo
cast: Kamalika Banerjee|Joyraj Bhattacharya|Soumendra Bhattacharya|Ananya Biswas|Ranodeep Bose
overview: Needing a secluded place for a late-night tryst, two couples stow away in a mall after hours, but are quickly ensnared in a gruesome and deadly game.

title: The Stranger
cast: Utpal Dutt|Dipankar Dey|Mamata Shankar|Bikram Bhattacharya|Dhritiman Chatterjee
overview: A well-off Indian family is paid an unexpected, and rather unwanted, visit by a man claiming to be the woman's long lost uncle. The initial suspicion with which they greet the man slowly dissolves as he regales them with stories of his travels, tales that are at odds with their conventional middle class perspective on the world.

title: Kabuliwala
cast: Mithun Chakraborty|Anumegha Kahali|Abir Chatterjee|Sohini Sarkar|Sumit Samaddar
overview: Rahmat, a middle-aged Afghan man, whose heart overflows with fatherly love for a little girl Mini, in the bustling city of Calcutta set in the year of 1965.

title: Khawto
cast: Prosenjit Chatterjee|Paoli Dam|Raima Sen|Ranodeep Bose|Tridha Choudhury
overview: A young couple meet a mysterious man who, in the course of conversation, covers Japanese cuisine, Bengali literature, and his own checkered past.

title: Uranchu
cast: Alokananda Roy|Bidipta Chakraborty|Sudipta Chakraborty|Darshana Banik|Manasi Sinha
overview: Seven women from different walks of life go on a week-long trip to London, where they gain new perspectives on love, life and happiness transform them forever.

title: Pradhan
cast: Dev|Paran Banerjee|Anirban Chakrabarti|Soham Chakraborty|Soumitrisha Kundu
overview: Deepak Pradhan, a young police officer, gets transferred to North Bengal where his junior officers are involved in corrupt practices. When disturbing events from the past start to surface and the pressure builds, will Deepak be able to hold on to his principles to save his integrity and loved ones?

title: Chaalchitro
cast: Tota Roy Chowdhury|Shantanu Maheshwari|Anirban Chakrabarti|Indrajeet Bose|Raima Sen
overview: The thriller delves into the lives of four cops from Kolkata Police, as they go about investigating a series of murders rocking the city. As the plot thickens, the personal lives of the men get stressed and squeezed by the ongoing turmoil.

title: Dujone
cast: Dev|Srabanti Chatterjee|Arun Bannerjee|Debesh Roy Chowdhury|Seema Biswas
overview: Dujone has the college-going Meghna (Srabanti) and Akash (Dev) falling for each other. But with Meghna's dad being in the fish business as opposed to Dev's industrialist dad, objections are an obvious progression. Things get murkier and gory what with Akash's dad keeping him caged in Siliguri and Meghna's against-romance pishi (Seema) keeping a hawk's eye on her every move. And just when you thought you've seen the best of De's muscle flexing and Srabanti's desperation to meet Akash, in comes a contract killer (Arijit) employed by Akash's dad to finish off Meghna. As all action stories should end, Dujone too reaches a fitting finale with Meghna-Akash's love triumphing over all odds.

title: Guptodhoner Sondhane
cast: Abir Chatterjee|Arjun Chakrabarty|Ishaa Saha|Rajatabha Dutta|Kamaleswar Mukherjee
overview: Subarna Sen, an Oxford University professor, travels to India after the death of his maternal uncle. He learns that his uncle's palace has a hidden treasure and decides to find it.

title: Bachelor
cast: Humayun Faridi|Ahmed Rubel|Ferdous Ahmed|Hasan Masood|Arman Parvez Murad
overview: Intertwined story of a group of friends living together and their romantic complications.

title: The Expedition
cast: Soumitra Chatterjee|Waheeda Rehman|Rabi Ghosh|Ruma Guha Thakurta|Charuprakash Ghosh
overview: The story revolves around a North Indian taxi driver, Narsingh, who attempts to reinvent his life by visiting his native place, but instead gets embroiled in a local Marwari businessman's smuggling and human trafficking business.  Preserved by the Academy Film Archive in 2001.

title: The Land of Cards
cast: Anubrata Basu|Joyraj Bhattacharya|Soumyak Kanti DeBiswas|Sayani Gupta|Rii Sen
overview: A royal prince arrives on an island of fascist rule and inspires a rebellion among its women in this hallucinogenic adaptation of a classic play.

title: Ley Chakka
cast: Dev|Payel Sarkar|Ritwick Chakraborty|Kharaj Mukherjee|Biswanath Basu
overview: South Kolkatan cricketer Abir moves with his family to Dorjipara in north Kolkata which is home to 11 Bullets, a cricket team that is out of luck. Abir gives them their first match win ever and also sets their land free from a political goon.

title: Dadar Adesh
cast: Ranjit Mallick|Prosenjit Chatterjee|Abhishek Chatterjee|Anamika Saha|Rupanjana Mitra
overview: A woman dies after learning that her husband is having an extra-marital affair. This creates a rift between the entire family as all the children start blaming their father for their mother's death.

title: Karnasubarner Guptodhon
cast: Abir Chatterjee|Arjun Chakrabarty|Ishaa Saha|Saurav Das|Rajatabha Dutta
overview: Sona Da, Abir and Jhinuk come across a riddle that turns their vacation into a dangerous quest for the hidden treasure of King Shashanka, one of the best-kept secrets of Bengal.

title: Grihapravesh
cast: Subhashree Ganguly|Kaushik Ganguly|Jeetu Kamal|Sohini Sengupta|Rudranil Ghosh
overview: In a fading North Calcutta Rajbari, Titli clings to routine after her husband Shaon vanishes. As Durga Puja nears, Megh arrives, an unexpected guest who brings warmth and a painful revel of thought. Amid rituals and memories, unspoken grief surfaces, stirring buried emotions, silent longing, and the ache of unfinished stories.

title: Projapati
cast: Dev|Mithun Chakraborty|Mamata Shankar|Shweta Bhattacharya|Kharaj Mukherjee
overview: A retired 65-year widower, Gaur Chakraborty, lives with his son, Joy, a wedding planner running his own business. Joy has a very busy schedule. Gaur wishes to be married. Will he be successful?

title: Days and Nights in the Forest
cast: Soumitra Chatterjee|Samit Bhanja|Subhendu Chatterjee|Sharmila Tagore|Pahadi Sanyal
overview: Four friends from Calcutta who have very different personalities make a holiday excursion into the country, to a tiny village in the state of Bihar where they set themselves up in a bungalow. A series of minor events, all connected to their respective reactions to their new environment, reveals their characters more deeply.

title: Aami Shudhu Cheyechhi Tomay
cast: Ankush Hazra|Subhashree Ganguly|Vikram Chatterjee|Misha Sawdagor|Supriyo Dutta
overview: Abhi (Ankush Hazra), son of a rich business man loves Bhoomika (Subhasree Ganguly) since childhood. Though people think him as a spoilt brat, but actually he is a good person by heart. He doesn't care what people think about him. He loves Bhoomika and can do anything for his love. However, Bhoomika does not like him. She joins a college in Darjeeling to pursue higher studies. Meanwhile, Abhi also takes admission in the same college in pursuit to win his love.

title: Kacher Manush
cast: Prosenjit Chatterjee|Dev|Ishaa Saha|Tulika Basu|Pinky Banerjee
overview: Kuntol and Sudarshan meet at the railway track where they have come to commit suicide.

title: Byomkesh Gotro
cast: Abir Chatterjee|Sohini Sarkar|Anjan Dutt|Priyanka Sarkar|Rahul Banerjee
overview: Convinced that his life is in jeopardy, Satyakam, the son of a business magnate hailing from Mussoorie, approaches Byomkesh with a plea for help. The legendary detective soon heads to Mussoorie, where he finds out that the youngsters worst fears have come true. Can Byomkesh unravel the mystery shrouding Satyakam's murder before it is too late?

title: Ardhangini
cast: Churni Ganguly|Jaya Ahsan|Kaushik Sen|Ambarish Bhattacharya|Lily Chakravarty
overview: After Suman suffers an accident, the two women in his life - Meghna, the wife, and Shubhra, the ex-wife - are compelled to meet each other. Ardhangini revolves around the awkward emotional duel between the two wives - past and present - in a time of personal crisis.

title: Bhooter Bhabishyat
cast: Parambrata Chatterjee|Sabyasachi Chakraborty|Paran Banerjee|Swastika Mukherjee|Mumtaz Sorcar
overview: A young director listens to a hilariously scary story narrated by a stranger, where a group of ghosts try to save the only place they can haunt in peace.

title: Bojhena Shey Bojhena
cast: Soham Chakraborty|Mimi Chakraborty|Abir Chatterjee|Payel Sarkar|Supriyo Dutta
overview: A horrible accident takes place between two buses on the highway in Behrampore which includes students returning after winning their kabadi match, a newly-wed couple, a lover taking his love of life to meet his parents and a girl traveling for the very first time to the city of Kolkata - later it's revealed how lives of two couples among those passengers were connected and things take a tragic turn after the accident.

title: Mini
cast: Ayanna Chatterjee|Mimi Chakraborty|Rudrajit Mukherjee|Mithu Chakrabarty|Kamalika Banerjee
overview: The story aims to throw light on the real essence of friendship where age can’t be a boundary. It’s a refreshing tale of a young and hot fashion designer aunt Titli (Mimi Chakraborty) and her school going mischievous niece Mini (Ayanna Chatterjee).

title: Chotushkone
cast: Parambrata Chatterjee|Aparna Sen|Goutam Ghose|Chiranjeet Chakraborty|Payel Sarkar
overview: Four famous directors and old friends are reunited together by an unknown producer to make a film. They have to make four short story in this film with one common theme: Death.

title: Netri: The Leader
cast: Afiea Nusrat Barsha|Ananta Jalil|Pradeep Ram Singh Rawat|Kabir Duhan Singh|Ravi Kishan
overview: The film will feature Afiea Nusrat Barsha in lead and Ananta Jalil will play the role of her bodyguard.

title: Megher Kopat (Love Under the Clouds)
cast: Rakib Hossain Evon|Cindy Rolling|Sabrina Tonni|Afroza Momen|Zaman Saif
overview: In a film marked by social clash and family crises, the narrative delves into the emotional intricacies of its central character, Dhruvo. Raised in the countryside by his struggling mother, Dhruvo moves to the city in search of job opportunities, burdened by the loss of his father before birth and a persistent emptiness in his life. Despite his devotion to his mother, he remains unable to alleviate her pain. His life takes a dramatic turn with the arrival of Miss Zara, leading to a turbulent love triangle involving his girlfriend Taniya. Accompanied by his friend Saif, Dhruvo embarks on a journey of self-discovery, only to uncover a hidden past of his mother. Surrounded by societal prejudices and personal doubts, Dhruvo navigates through challenges to ultimately find a path to new possibilities and personal freedom.

title: Chiriyakhana
cast: Uttam Kumar|Shailen Mukherjee|Shyamal Ghoshal|Gitali Roy|Bankim Ghosh
overview: When Byomkesh Bakshi's new client, Dr. Nishanath Sen, is murdered at Golap Colony, he decides to probe into the case with the help of his close aide, Ajit.

title: The Eken: Benaras e Bibhishika
cast: Anirban Chakrabarti|Suhotra Mukhopadhyay|Somak Ghosh|Saswata Chatterjee|Rishav Basu
overview: Eken Babu arrives in Benaras with Bapi and Pramatha and soon finds himself entangled in a perplexing mystery. Strange coded messages lead him to a sinister conspiracy threatening the Masaan Holi festival. Racing against time, he must outsmart shadowy figures to save the sacred city from chaos.

title: Priyotama
cast: Swastika Mukherjee|Jeet|Biswajit Chakraborty|Mayukh Mukherjee|Laboni Sarkar
overview: A young woman falls in love with the man of her dreams and the couple decides to getting married. However, an unfortunate accident paralyses their lives forever.

title: Hothat Nirar Jonyo
cast: Jaya Seal|Bickram Ghosh|Arindam Sil|Tina Majumdar|Saptarshi Dasgupta
overview: Rani (Ghosh) is a housewife with a successful husband, Tapas, and a kid. Living a routine existence, Rani looks after her family and attend her dance classes. One day her old friend from college Abinash (Ghosh) comes into her life. Abinash is a renowned musician today and has been travelling around the world. Abinash says to Rani that he has had relationships with a few women, but cannot offer himself up fully because the memory of Rani stands in his way. He asks her to spend a day with him so that he can get over her. Abinash also has a girlfriend Tina who is in love with him. Rani, torn between principles and passion, succumbs to Abinash's persistence. This creates havoc in her personal life while Abinash, his goal complete, moves away from her.

title: Abhimaan
cast: Jeet|Subhashree Ganguly|Sayantika Banerjee|Anjana Basu|Animesh Bhaduri
overview: Abhimaan is a family drama that tells the story of every family, where there is emotion, love, ego, romance and action in equal measure.

title: Shri Swapankumar-er Badami Hyena'r Kobole
cast: Abir Chatterjee|Paran Banerjee|Pratik Dutta|Shruti Das|Goutam Halder
overview: Kolkata is in danger as Badami Hyena, an evil force, looms threat over the city. Dipak Chatterjee, the long-forgotten detective created by pulp-fiction writer Samarendranath Pandey, better known by his pen name Shri Swapankumar, comes out of his web of hurt pride to save the City of Joy. But Shri Swapankumar soon charts a crazy narrative that complicates Dipak's fate! Can the madcap detective save his city and himself?

title: I Love You
cast: Dev|Payel Sarkar|Tapas Paul|Arun Bannerjee|Paoli Dam
overview: A rich young man must prove his love for a simple village belle; she is humiliated by his family, so he opts to rusticate with hers.

title: Bandhan
cast: Jeet|Koel Mallick|Victor Banerjee|Sumanta Mukherjee|Shantilal Mukherjee
overview: Mina narrates the story to the audience. She is no more and her husband stays with their son in Singapore. They have no contact with her family as she had married against her family's wish.

title: Anuranan
cast: Rahul Bose|Rituparna Sengupta|Raima Sen|Rajat Kapoor|Haradhan Bandopadhyay
overview: The story of two couples - each with their own struggles to survive as a couple and as individuals. After living in London for a few years, Rahul and Nandita have recently moved back to Kolkata and become friends with Amit and Preeti. It is the lives of these four friends that creates a resonance, a chord, that echoes through their present and future.

title: Swayamsiddha
cast: Satya Bandopadhyay|Utpal Dutt|Ranjit Mallick|Ratna Ghoshal|Mithu Mukherjee
overview: Synopsis:::  Chandi is a village girl. She is bold, brave, and extremely courageous. She is the protector of the underdog and punishes the wrongdoers of society in her own way. The zamindar of the estate witnesses Chandi at her act of justice and decides to marry her to his younger son. However, his wife opposes as Chandi hails from a not-so-rich household and proposes her marriage to the elder son Gobindo, a mentally challenged man and the son of Zamindar’s late first wife.

title: How sweet
cast: Ziaul Faruq Apurba|Tasnia Farin|Mohammad Saidur Rahman Pavel|Arfan Mredha Shiblu|Abdullah Rana
overview: Sweety, a runaway bride, accidentally tosses Adnan's beloved camera into the river. Determined to seek compensation, Adnan and his friend chase her to Barisal. There, they find themselves tangled in a web of troubles as Sweety struggles to escape another marriage. How will they get out of this mess?

title: Neel Shukh
cast: Mehazabien Chowdhury|Farrukh Ahmed Rehan|Golam Farida Chhonda|Reshma Ahmed|Mukul Siraj

title: Bogla Mama Jug Jug Jiyo
cast: Kharaj Mukherjee|Riddhi Sen|Ditipriya Roy|Aparajita Adhya|Rajatabha Dutta
overview: Set in the backdrop of the late 1980s, Bogla Charan Bhattacharya is a funny, witty, middle aged theatre fanatic who is loved by the entire town for his problem-solving skills. Bogla Charan along with his band of rugged young adults dive into hilarious adventures only to create further inconveniences. But in the end, Bogla's charm and cleverness always saves the day.

title: Dorod
cast: Shakib Khan|Sonal Chauhan|Rahul Dev|Payel Sarkar|Rajesh Sharma
overview: A series of sudden murders unfold in the city of Varanasi, targeting prominent individuals. The escalating violence shocks the local police as they grapple with the growing list of victims. As the investigation progresses, an auto driver named Dulu Mia emerges as the key suspect. The police must unravel the mystery behind the serial killings and uncover the motives driving these tragic events.

title: Phande Poriya Boga Kande Re
cast: Soham Chakraborty|Srabanti Chatterjee|Kaushik Chakraborty|Dipankar Dey|Surajit Sen
overview: The film is filled with hilarious moments and sequences that will entertain the mass audience greatly. The credit for this goes squarely to Soham who puts in a sparklingly fresh and funny performance and dances well too in his image of a very ordinary and simple boy who is scared out of his wits with the threat of death hanging over him like Damocles’ sword. It feels good to finally meet a hero who is timid of his opponents, does not sport a six-abs body and is like most young men of his age.

title: Bishorjan
cast: Jaya Ahsan|Abir Chatterjee|Kaushik Ganguly|Lama Halder|Arun Guha Tharkurta
overview: A young mother refusing to go see Durga bishorjon with her son. Bishorjon takes place with immense celebrations as the two Bengals drown their Durga idols in the river Ichamati separating them. The young lady remembers one such day after bishorjon in her past.

title: Khokababu
cast: Dev|Subhashree Ganguly|Ferdous Ahmed|Biswajit Chakraborty|Laboni Sarkar
overview: The film is about Khokababu (Dev) who is a cool and a clever guy. Bhaiji is a well-known don in his territory whom everybody fears and obeys. Khoka joins Bhaiji's circle as an accountant where he has a wacky senior Khanra Babu. Khoka with his super wit starts to obtain every luxury that a perfect office should have and starts to hoax Bhaiji. Problems occur when Khoka falls in love with Bhaiji's sister Pooja (Subhasree Ganguly). That's how our super-clever Chalu Cheez Khokababu takes the story ahead.

title: Osomoy
cast: Tasnia Farin|Sharaf Ahmed Zibon|Intekhab Dinar|Iresh Zaker|Ziaul Hoque Polash
overview: Caught between her middle-class background and her rich university friends, Urbi navigates a world of wealth and privilege. But as she chases her dreams, she falls into a life-changing chaos, paying a high price for her ambitions.

title: Chaar
cast: Abir Chatterjee|Koel Mallick|Paran Banerjee|Saswata Chatterjee|Subhrajit Dutta
overview: Chaar is a Bengali anthology film based on four short stories by different writers: "Bateswarer Abodan" by Parasuram, "Porikkha" by Sharadindu Bandyopadhyay, "Kagtarua" by Satyajit Ray and "Dui Bondhu" by Satyajit Ray.

title: Banished
cast: Churni Ganguly|Lia Boysen|Saswata Chatterjee|Martin Wallström|Raima Sen
overview: This is a story of isolation and hope, of a writer in exile. The writer is banished for her attack on religious fundamentalism and patriarchy and her cat is suddenly left alone.

title: Antarjal
cast: Siam Ahmed|Sunerah Binte Kamal|Bidya Sinha Saha Mim|ABM Sumon|Rawnak Hasan
overview: Few of the country's major cyber networks are under attack by a ruthless group of International cyber criminals. Three young minds come forward and join the country's cyber security division to fight the attack. But they get indulged in bigger trouble as they now have to face more evil forces from both the country and abroad.

title: Superman
cast: Danny Sidak|Nuton|Antora|Munmun
overview: A child from a dying world is sent to Earth, where his alien physiology renders him superhuman. Bengali remake of the 1978 classic.

title: Dingi
overview: Homeless children are chased away at the harbour by boatmen. But the boys have an ingenious way of retaliating...

title: Manush
cast: Jeet|Jeetu Kamal|Bidya Sinha Saha Mim|Susmita Chatterjee|Saurav Chakrabarti
overview: An intense journey of a father and daughter!

title: Baazi
cast: Jeet|Mimi Chakraborty|Sabyasachi Chakraborty|Prodip Dhar|Danielle Adkins
overview: Aditya, the son of a terminally ill businessman, discovers that his father has lost all his wealth to a swindler. Seeking revenge for this crime, he travels to London.

title: Bolo Na Tumi Amar
cast: Dev|Koel Mallick|Tota Roy Chowdhury|Sabyasachi Chakraborty|Bharat Kaul
overview: A couple marry in order to save the bride from her father's choice of groom, but they don't actually love each other. It's "make it work" time.

title: Lokkhi Chele
cast: Ujaan Ganguly|Ritwika Pal|Purab Seal Acharya|Indrasish Roy|Churni Ganguly
overview: The Indian Bengali film tells us a story about the life of a young doctor who stood against the social superstitions prevalent in the rural areas and is hell bent on bringing in a sea of changes among the villagers.

title: The Coward
cast: Soumitra Chatterjee|Madhabi Mukherjee|Haradhan Bandopadhyay|Santi Chatterjee|Satish Haldar
overview: Amitabha Roy is a Calcutta-based scriptwriter, driving around in the country to collect material for a film. His vehicle breaks down in a small town. A tea planter, Bimal Gupta, offers hospitality for the night. Amitabha is forced to accept the offer as he has no alternative.  Preserved by the Academy Film Archive in 2005.

title: Gumnaami
cast: Prosenjit Chatterjee|Anirban Bhattacharya|Tanushree Chakraborty|Surendra Rajan|Sanjay Gurbaxani
overview: Gumnaami is a film based on the Mukherjee Commission Hearings which happened from 1999 to 2005 where the three theories about Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose's death were discussed and debated. It is a dramatization of the hearings where an investigative journalist supporting the Gumnaami Baba theory locks horns with the official lawyer who supports the plane crash theory. In their clash, the Death in Russia theory also comes up.

title: Badsha - the Don
cast: Jeet|Nusraat Faria Mazhar|Shraddha Das|Rajatabha Dutta|Biswanath Basu
overview: an ambitious boy named Badshah who dreams of becoming a don. He gains access to the crime of city's don and uses his own cleverness to play of the top two - Tangrar Tony and Jyanrar Johny fierce rivals with each other . He goes to London on a project. How he becomes don.

title: Rupkatha Noy
cast: Soumitra Chatterjee|Radhika Apte|Kaushik Sen|Rahul Banerjee|Sohini Sarkar
overview: Five young people are driven by primal human instincts - to escape, find thrill, seek revenge or wait for destiny. And one old wizened man is trying to touch upon their minds.

title: Chokh
cast: Om Puri|Anil Chatterjee|Shyamanand Jalan|Sreela Majumdar|Biplab Chatterjee
overview: The film is set in during the Emergency period in December 1975. Jadunath a labour union leader, of Jethia Jute Mill in Kolkata has been given death sentence, for the murders of owner Jethia’s brother, and another worker, even though he never committed them. Before dying, he pledges his eyes for donation. However when the mill owner finds about this he tries to manoeuvre the medical system to get both the eyes for his blind son. Meanwhile the doctor discovers that the donation papers provided by the Jethia to be fake. Soon the mill workers get united behind the widow of Jadunath and hold protest rally against the injustice.

title: Shesh Pata
cast: Prosenjit Chatterjee|Gargee RoyChowdhury|Vikram Chatterjee|Rayati Bhattacharya Basu|Pradip Chakrabarti
overview: Valmiki, a formerly well-known author, living a life of debt, receives an opportunity and an advance fee to write about his late wife. But, when he is unable to deliver, he seeks a ghostwriter to help him.

title: Sneher Protidan
cast: Prosenjit Chatterjee|Rachana Banerjee|Ranjit Mallick|Jisshu Sengupta|Moumita Chakraborty
overview: Sneher Protidan is a 2003 Indian Bengali drama film released on 2003. The film is directed by Swapan Saha, produced by Paban Kanoria.

title: Belashuru
cast: Soumitra Chatterjee|Swatilekha Sengupta|Shankar Chakraborty|Rituparna Sengupta|Aparajita Adhya
overview: Arati Sarkar suffers from Alzheimer’s disease. The family realises that they are gradually losing her. They celebrate the bond that parents share with their children and other members of the family.

title: Shohorer Ushnotomo Din E
cast: Vikram Chatterjee|Solanki Roy|Anamika Chakraborty|Debopriyo Mukherjee|Anindya Chatterjee
overview: Kolkata natives Ritoban and Anindita rekindle their college romance after years apart. Amidst the city's timeless essence, they grapple with sacrificing dreams for love or love for dreams.

title: C/O Sir
cast: Saswata Chatterjee|Raima Sen|Sudipta Chakraborty|Indraneil Sengupta|Ardhendu Banerjee
overview: Jayabrata Ray, a teacher of a reputed school in Kurseong, finds himself in a helpless situation after losing his eyesight. Although the school authorities allow him to continue with his job for a while, but all hell breaks loose when he starts getting threat calls from the management asking him to vacate his property that is situated right inside the school premises. Jayabrata, who had also been a student of the same school, could see through their real intention and simply refuses to budge.

title: Kailashey Kelenkari
cast: Sabyasachi Chakraborty|Parambrata Chatterjee|Bibhu Bhattacharya|Dipankar Dey|Biplab Chatterjee
overview: Detective Feluda, with the help of his nephew Topshe and the writer Jatayu, investigates smuggling and illegal trading in ancient sculptures across India.

title: Dawshom Awbotaar
cast: Prosenjit Chatterjee|Anirban Bhattacharya|Jisshu Sengupta|Jaya Ahsan|Animesh Bhaduri
overview: What happens when a serial killer terrorizes the city of Kolkata by mirroring the mythological stories of Vishnu and his ten avatars in his killing methods? A prequel crossover of Baishe Srabon and Vinci Da.

title: Chaplin
cast: Rudranil Ghosh|Srijit Mukherji|Padmanabha Dasgupta|Arijit Dutta
overview: Bangshi Das is an impersonator of Charlie Chaplin. He earns peanuts by being the 'joker' at birthday parties. However, he prefers to call himself an actor rather than a worker. His life circles around his son who is the greatest critic of his performances. Poverty never seems bitter as the father-son duo knows how to make fun of it.

title: Chengiz
cast: Jeet|Susmita Chatterjee|Shataf Figar|Rohit Roy|Ayush Das
overview: The movie revolves around Chengiz, an underworld mafia from the 1970s to the mid-90s that ruled the streets of Calcutta.

title: Basanta Bilap
cast: Soumitra Chatterjee|Aparna Sen|Rabi Ghosh|Kajal Gupta|Anup Kumar
overview: A romantic comedy about a series of clashes between the female residents of a ladies' hostel Basanta Bilap, and four boys of the neighbourhood, aided and abetted by their boudi (sister-in-law).

title: Punormilone
cast: Siam Ahmed|Tasnia Farin|Shashwta Datta|Nur Imran Mithu|Tajnuva Jabeen
overview: Antu, Riyad, Nayan are three very close cousins. After Riyad's marriage, a relationship develops between Antu and Riyad's wife Trina, and eventually turns into love. This creates a rift in the family. What will end this distance of family?

title: Ganadevata
cast: Soumitra Chatterjee|Madhabi Mukherjee|Sandhya Roy|Samit Bhanja|Ajitesh Bandopadhyay
overview: Set in 1920's during the British Raj, the film is about the breakdown of socio-economic structures, impact of industrialization and non-cooperation movement in rural Bengal.

title: Binodiini - Ekti Natir Upakhyan
cast: Rukmini Maitra|Kaushik Ganguly|Mir Afsar Ali|Rahul Bose|Om Sahani
overview: Binodini Dasi, a prostitute, who has a knack for theatre, manages to garner a lot of attention because of her performances.

title: Miss Call
cast: Soham Chakraborty|Rittika Sen|Supriyo Dutta|Shantilal Mukherjee|Prodip Dhar
overview: Influenced by her friends, Leela begins using missed calls to scam people into recharging her phone balance. She befriends Krishna, one of her targets, and the two become close despite not meeting each other. But one day she goes missing, and Krishna becomes the prime suspect.

title: Gali Theke Rajpath
cast: Uttam Kumar|Sabitri Chatterjee|Chhabi Biswas|Tulsi Chakraborty|Nripati Chatterjee
overview: Raja was a professional thief who went to jail for a crime. His very close assistant Bhola waited for him and when Raja returned from prison, they started planning a bigger one. One day a family came to their locality. Within a few days, Raja and Bhola became closer to that family. Mala was the only female earning member and she worked in theatre. Raja did not disclose his real identity and tried hard to impress her a lot. In the meantime, a tout Gobardhan nagged Mala a lot to join films. Raja and Bhola gave him a good punishment and saved Mala in several situations. Later Raja tried to cheat a businessperson, but an unavoidable situation changed his life. At last, Mala came to know everything about Raja and accepted him as her partner. Raja also decided to change his life and put his best effort into becoming a good man. He meets Mala and asks her to forgive Raja. Raja once again regains Mala's love and the film ends on a happy note.

title: Daag
cast: Mosharraf Karim|Aisha Khan|Nishat Priom|Somu Chowdhury|A.K. Azad Shetu
overview: OC Alamgir rescued that baby who was found in a dustbin and restore him to a hospital. The baby without identity drew a huge attentation in social media. Thousands childless family applied to adopt the child. OC Alamgir is given the charge to investigate the selected couples. At the time of investigation OC Alamgir suffers from mental agony as his own child died met a very premature death. At that time there came the original mother of the nameless child. Why this child was thrown away? What would be the consequence of this child?

title: The Kingdom of Diamonds
cast: Tapan Chatterjee|Rabi Ghosh|Utpal Dutt|Soumitra Chatterjee|Santosh Dutta
overview: When Goopy and Bagha learn about Hirak Raja's tyranny, they try to set him right with the help of Udayan, a school teacher, and their magical powers.

title: Nater Guru
cast: Jeet|Koel Mallick|Moushumi Chatterjee|Ranjit Mallick|Kanchan Mullick
overview: A man tries to bring together his girlfriends' parents, who have been estranged for fifteen years because of disagreements, misunderstandings, and pride.

title: Shatru
cast: Jeet|Nusrat Jahan|Supriyo Dutta|Biplab Chatterjee|Kharaj Mukherjee
overview: The story of Sub-inspector Dibakar Singho who settles every dispute in his town with wisdom and logic, is compelled to use force when an extortionist with mafia links - Arjun Sarkar confronts him. An official remake of the Tamil Superhit film Singam which starred Surya and Anushka Shetty. Singam was written by Tamil director, Hari, who is known for his movies with rural settings.

title: Bhoy Peyo Na
cast: Srabanti Chatterjee|Om Sahani|Darshana Banik
overview: Horror at Bakhrahat.

title: Mon Kharap
cast: Ankush Hazra|Riddhi Sen|Kaushik Sen
overview: It is a dark comedy that reflects the current society. Nirban Sen, a psychologist, deals with patients and through them, we see how our everyday problems are plaguing us.

title: Vinci Da
cast: Rudranil Ghosh|Ritwick Chakraborty|Sohini Sarkar|Anirban Bhattacharya|Riddhi Sen
overview: A gifted make-up artist gets entangled up in a world of crime with a psychopathic vigilante.

title: Kishmish
cast: Dev|Rukmini Maitra|Kamaleswar Mukherjee|Anjana Basu|Kharaj Mukherjee
overview: Krishanu ‘Tintin’ Chatterjee (Dev), an aspiring graphic novelist, meets Rohini Sen (Rukmini Maitra), a rich, progressive girl, at a college in the hills and the duo fall in love. They are all set to get married when their parents’ past returns to mess things up.

title: Byomkesh Bakshi
cast: Abir Chatterjee|Saswata Chatterjee|Ushasie Chakraborty|Swastika Mukherjee|Rudranil Ghosh
overview: Set against the backdrop of The Partition, Byomkesh Bakshi and his assistant Ajit must solve the murder of the head of the dysfunctional Halder family.

title: Surjo
cast: Vikram Chatterjee|Madhumita Sarkar|Darshana Banik|Prasun Gain|Swaralipi Ghosh
overview: Uma, wanting to flee an unwanted marriage, discovers a graphic novel that Surjo once occupied. Intrigued by the unfinished story of Surjo's adventures and starts tracing his step. Will Uma be able to accept the person when she meet? Is Surjo the same person as she heard from the stories about him?

title: The Bong Connection
cast: Shayan Munshi|Parambrata Chatterjee|Raima Sen|Peeya Rai Chowdhary|Victor Banerjee
overview: The film is based on the lives of Bengali's across the world, especially on those settled abroad. It attempts to delineate the pain and dilemma of Bengali's estranged from their places of origin. It seeks to explore sensitive souls singing to the tunes of Tagore.

title: Saat Pake Bandha
cast: Jeet|Ranjit Mallick|Koel Mallick|Subhasish Mukherjee|Supriyo Dutta
overview: Rahul agrees to marry Pallavi according to his father's wish but insists on a condition that the marriage will be a contractual one. However, things change when Rahul meets with an accident.

title: Premer Kahini
cast: Dev|Koel Mallick|Ranjit Mallick|Mousumi Saha|Jisshu Sengupta
overview: A young guy falls in love with a girl who is engaged to be married.They meet again and the girl also fall in love with him.On the day of her wedding,the girl's father gets a letter and the lovers get married.

title: 100% Love
cast: Jeet|Koel Mallick|Supriyo Dutta|Biswajit Chakraborty|Biswanath Basu
overview: Rahul, who hails from a middle-class family, comes across Anuradha, immediately falls in love with her and travels to Australia. However, his father dies and he soon learns that she is getting married to his friend.

title: Adventures of Jojo
cast: Jashojeet Banerjee|Samiul Alam|Rudranil Ghosh|Padmanabha Dasgupta|Abhishek Singh
overview: Jojo, a twelve year old boy, and his friend Shibu try to save a famed animal and the forest from poachers, while they travels to Baropahari to visit his uncle.

title: Amazon Obhijaan
cast: Dev|David James|Laboni Sarkar|Tamal Ray Chowdhury|Svetlana Gulakova
overview: Anna, an Italian woman, approaches Shankar, an explorer, to accompany her in search of the golden city of El Dorado. He accepts the offer and sets out on an adventure through the Amazon.

title: Critical Encounter
cast: Roopa Ganguly|Silajit Majumder|Soumitra Chatterjee|Haradhan Bandopadhyay|Arjun Chakraborty
overview: The story is of terrorism that’s plaguing different parts of the Northeast as the backdrop. Shilajeet Majumdar, a militant on the run, takes refuge in a dilapidated mansion. Rupa Ganguly stays there with her father-in-law Soumitra Chatterjee and his father Haradhan Bandopadhyay who’s confined to bed and is unable to speak. This film focuses on the friction and undercurrent of tension between the lady of the house and the terrorist.

title: Dabaru
cast: Samadarshi Sarkar|Arghya Basu Roy|Rituparna Sengupta|Chiranjeet Chakraborty|Dipankar Dey
overview: Dabaru is a melodramatic tale about a young chess player named Surya who rose from the alleys of North Kolkata to become a grand master.

title: Rajkahini
cast: Rituparna Sengupta|Jisshu Sengupta|Abir Chatterjee|Nigel Akkara|Saswata Chatterjee
overview: In August 1947, the British passed a bill regarding the partition of Bengal. Delving into the grim history of the Partition, Mukherjee's movie Rajkahini is woven around a border between the two nations that runs through a brothel housing 11 women.

title: The Egyptian Mystery
cast: Prosenjit Chatterjee|Aryann Bhowmick|Tridha Choudhury|Indraneil Sengupta|Rajit Kapoor
overview: Al Mamun, an Egyptian business tycoon, asks his friend Kakababu to help him decode some hieroglyphic symbols that will help trace the will of his teacher, Mufti Mohammad.

title: Hoichoi Unlimited
cast: Dev|Kharaj Mukherjee|Saswata Chatterjee|Rajatabha Dutta|Roja Paromita Dey
overview: Four men plan to bring back the fun in their lives by planning a trip to Uzbekistan without informing their wives about it. However, their wives soon begin to suspect their intentions and chase them.

title: Barood
cast: Mithun Chakraborty|Rajatabha Dutta|Shankar Chakraborty|Subhendu Chatterjee|Lokesh
overview: A corrupt politician bribes an honest and courageous police officer to get his way. However, little does he know that the policeman joins hands with him only to ruin his political

title: Kedara
cast: Kaushik Ganguly|Rudranil Ghosh|Bidipta Chakraborty|Indranil Roy|Mousumi Sanyal Dasgupta
overview: Narsimha, an old ventriloquist and 'horbola' lives in a decrepit locality of Kolkata. Once a favourite among children, he barely manages to survive now and is reduced to a shabby madman. Abandoned by his family, he has a solitary friend in a local 'kabadi-wala', who, all of a sudden, brings him an old, majestic chair- a 'kedara'.

title: Sukh Dukher Sansar
cast: Rituparna Sengupta|Tapas Paul|Satabdi Roy|Abhishek Chatterjee
overview: Amar, the eldest of four siblings, works hard in order to provide a better life for his younger brothers and sisters. However, his life falls apart when his younger sister meets with an accident and becomes blind. How will Amar and his family deal with this catastrophe?

title: Obhishopto Nighty
cast: Paoli Dam|Indraneil Sengupta|Parambrata Chatterjee|Tanushree Chakraborty|Mir Afsar Ali
overview: The story of the film revolves around a cursed nightie which changes hands in a logical manner, not magically. The original owner of the nightie had experienced unfulfilled love, which ultimately led to a curse on it.  A wannabe actress comes to Kolkata from a village in pursue of her career. She can cross all limits in order to become successful. She uses that nightie for seducing producers and she doesn't regret in what she is doing. The events that take place later form the climax of the story.

title: Guerrilla
cast: Jaya Ahsan|Shampa Reza|Ahmed Rubel|A.T.M. Shamsuzzaman|Shatabdi Wadud
overview: Bilkis Banu lost her husband Hasan on the night of 25th March 1971. She tries to forget him and concentrate on the urban guerrilla movements of Dhaka with Altaf Mahmud, Shahadat, Mrs Khan and many more. But when spies and the razakars inform them, most of their people get arrested and Bilkis has to run for her life, towards her village.

title: Dhanyee Meye
cast: Uttam Kumar|Jaya Bachchan|Jahar Roy|Rabi Ghosh|Partho Mukerjee
overview: Bogola, the captain of a football team, travels to a village to play in a tournament. There, he meets and falls in love with Monosha. The president of the local football club tries to force Monosha and Bogola to marry to keep the tournament trophy in the family. However, their love prevails, and they can marry despite the opposition.

title: Kaliachak - Chapter 1
cast: Asim Aktar|Rupanjana Mitra|Parthasarathi Chakraborty|Deboprasad Haldar|Debapratimm Dasgupta
overview: In the tranquil yet enigmatic village of Kaliachak, resides Asik, a bright student, who dreams of living a life as vast as the open sky. However, beneath the seemingly straightforward life lies a dark world of deceit and despair.

title: The Guerrilla Fighter
cast: Dhritiman Chatterjee|Simi Garewal|Bijon Bhattachariya|Jochan Dastidar|Dhruba Mitra
overview: A political activist escapes the prison van and is sheltered in a posh apartment owned by a sensitive young woman. Both are rebels: the activist against political treachery and the other on social level. Both are bitter about badly organized state of things. Being in solitary confinement, the fugitive engages himself in self-criticism and, in the process, questions the leadership. Questions are not allowed, obeying that is mandatory. Displeasure leads to bitterness, bitterness to total rift. The struggle has to continue, both for the political activist, now segregated, and the woman in exile.

title: Bonbibi
cast: Parno Mittra|Dibyendu Bhattacharya|Arya Dasgupta|Ranojoy Bishnu|Sohini Sarkar
overview: The plot starts with a British family visiting the rural places of the Sunderbans. Resham, a fatso, pale but jovial woman in her late 20s, carries out the responsibilities of a tourist guide to the Brits. Five years ago Resham’s husband had gone to the jungle to fetch honey but had not returned. Hence it is believed that Resham now belongs to the clan of widows whose spouses have unfortunately fallen prey to the tigers. Resham and all the other women like her live on the edge of a village, their locality is called Vidhva Palli, or “abode for the widows”.  The government is educating the women to make them independent. They are providing English education so they can become guides to curious tourists and Resham is clearly one of the best in the business. The climax of the story is stitched with a sequence of multiple mind-boggling situations. Will Resham be able to have a successful love story with Himon? Who's Dakshin Ray /Khoda Badshah /Jahangir?

title: Ballabhpurer Roopkotha
cast: Satyam Bhattacharya|Debraj Bhattacharya|Shyamal Chakraborty|Surangana Bandyopadhyay|Sumanta Roy
overview: The almost crumbling Rajbari of Ballabhpur only has two men living — the last descendant of Ray dynasty, Bhupati Ray, and his inherited menial, Manohar. Both the dwellers are overburdened with heavy debts and seek no hope of betterment until one day, Kolkata's soap King, Mr. Haldar, plans buying the property. Can Bhupati Ray and Manohar succeed in selling it?

title: Tiger
cast: Mithun Chakraborty|Debashree Roy|Rajatabha Dutta|Dulal Lahiri|Bharat Kaul
overview: The film deals with how a teacher along with his students fight corruption.

title: Khaad
cast: Ardhendu Banerjee|Lily Chakravarty|Pallavi Chatterjee|Shaheb Bhattacherjee|Mimi Chakraborty
overview: Because of a train strike, a group of tourists, mostly unrelated to each other, get stuck in New Mal Junction. These people are honeymooners (Saheb and Mimi), family vacationers (Pallavi Chatterjee, Koushik Banerjee, Tridha Choudhury), an ailing mother and her son (Lily Chakraborty, Kaushik Ganguly), a priest (Ardhendu Banerjee), a heroine and her abnormal brother (Gargi Roy Choudhury, Rajdeep Ghosh), one trekker (Kamaleshwar Mukherjee), a bus conductor (Rudranil), and a retired teacher (Maasud Akthar). One of the tourists, the priest manages to arrange a bus from the church for them to reach North Bengal. The other tourists also join him in the bus trip, but unfortunately the bus meets with a terrible accident. It falls off a cliff into an abyss, but the tourists survive with minor injuries. Injured and traumatized, they realize that they have become completely detached from any form of human contact.

title: Once Upon a Time in Calcutta
cast: Sreelekha Mitra|Shayak Roy|Bratya Basu|Arindam Ghosh|Satrajit Sarkar
overview: Just when the people of an expanding Calcutta feel their dreams might be fulfilled, they hear the sound of things falling.

title: Jiban Trishna
cast: Uttam Kumar|Suchitra Sen|Bhanu Banerjee|Pahadi Sanyal|Bikash Roy
overview: A philanderer, the only son of a wealthy doctor, is attracted to a poor orphaned artist. Her stepbrother loathes rich people, and would go to any extent to get money off them. What would happen if the roles reversed?

title: Bohurupi
cast: Shiboprosad Mukherjee|Abir Chatterjee|Ritabhari Chakraborty|Koushani Mukherjee|Pradeep Bhattacharya
overview: A mysterious dacoit is on the run. A supercop gets involved with him in a cat and mouse chase.

title: Ashchorjyo Prodeep
cast: Saswata Chatterjee|Rajatabha Dutta|Sreelekha Mitra|Mumtaz Sorcar|Mir Afsar Ali
overview: The story of a modern day Aladdin, set against the backdrop of contemporary Calcuttan consumer society.

title: Booking
cast: Pori Moni|ABM Sumon|Sushama Sarker|Shilpi Sarker Apu|Mahadi Hasan Pial
overview: Being arrogant, Tania’s first instinct might be to reject the proposal without giving it much thought. However, upon realizing that the man she misunderstood as a car driver is actually interested in marrying her, Tania may feel compelled to reassess her previous judgment of him.

title: X=Prem
cast: Shruti Das|Anindya Sengupta|Arjun Chakrabarty|Madhurima Basak|Soumendra Bhattacharya
overview: Khilat, a young software engineer and Joyee are determined to face any and all problems that life throws at them. Will they ever get there happily ever after?

title: Mrigaya
cast: Vikram Chatterjee|Ritwick Chakraborty|Anirban Chakrabarti|Saurav Das|Priyanka Sarkar
overview: The concept of hunting plays a major factor in the story of the film, with multiple people hunting each other, both figuratively and literally.

title: Force
cast: Arya Dasgupta|Prosenjit Chatterjee|Arpita Pal|Kharaj Mukherjee|Ena Saha
overview: Force is a new commercial Bengali movie, is based on the love and relationship of a father and a son. Arjun is an encounter specialist police officer whose goal is to eradicate both crime and criminals from the society. He lost his wife during the birth of his son, Abhimanyu. His son is an autistic patient and suffers from neurodevelopmental problems.

title: Annadata
cast: Prosenjit Chatterjee|Sreelekha Mitra|Abdur Razzak|Sunil Mukherjee|Arindam Sil
overview: A rich businessman adopts Shankar into his family. Years later, Shankar proves his loyalty by saving his master's house Chowdhury Villa from his biggest rival Rudraprasad Sen.

title: Rangbaaz
cast: Dev|Koel Mallick|Rahul Dev|Rajatabha Dutta|Kharaj Mukherjee
overview: Madhurima, a rich girl, falls in love with Raj when they get stranded on an island. But Raj is uninterested, as he is on a mission to avenge his father's death.

title: Egaro: The Eleven
cast: Ranodeep Bose|Baidyanath Das|Biswajit Chakraborty|Shankar Chakraborty|Kharaj Mukherjee
overview: Egaro celebrates the centenary of the historical football match between Mohun Bagan and East Yorkshire Regiment for the IFA Shield where Bagan snatched the shield on 29 July 1911 during a time when India was under British rule.

title: Chorabali
cast: Barun Chanda|Tanushree Chakraborty|George Baker|Locket Chatterjee|Shataf Figar
overview: Sumon is compelled to grow up in the city's underworld as mafia lord Osman Ali's killer machine. After killing a pregnant woman carrying Osman Ali's illegitimate child, Sumon's conscience leads him to defy Ali's order.

title: Sheyal Debota Rahasya
cast: Sabyasachi Chakraborty|Saswata Chatterjee|Indrajit Deb|Ashok Mitra|Bhola Bose
overview: Sheyal Debota Rahasya is a Mystery, Thriller TV Film of Feluda Series. This film is about The Anubis Mystery. Feluda must solve the Mystery case.

title: Hercules
cast: Parambrata Chatterjee|Biswajit Chakraborty|Saswata Chatterjee|Paoli Dam
overview: Hercules is the story of a common man: His actual name is Harakailash, his timid nature and compromising attitude has prompted the local people to call him Hercules in jest.

title: Networker Baire
cast: Yash Rohan|Nazifa Tushi|Sariful Razz|Khairul Basar|Nazia Haque Orsha
overview: A group of four friends, on the verge of the end of their academic life sets on a tour to Cox's Bazaar. Expecting to live their life at the fullest. But some unexpected events that take place on the tour make their worlds go upside down.

title: Bhai Amar Bhai
cast: Prosenjit Chatterjee|Anushree Das|Abhishek Chatterjee|Rozina|Subhendu Chatterjee
overview: When a fire breaks out, three children lose their father and get separated from each other while escaping. However, when the siblings reunite, they vow to take revenge against their father's killer.

title: Guldasta
cast: Swastika Mukherjee|Debjani Chatterjee|Arpita Chatterjee|Ishaan Mazumdar|Anubhav Kanjilal
overview: A tale of three women who bond over loneliness and whose lives get intertwined as they deal with their hardships.

title: The Puppet’s Tale
cast: Abir Chatterjee|Jaya Ahsan|Parambrata Chatterjee|Dhritiman Chatterjee|Ananya Chatterjee
overview: Shashi, an urbane doctor, returns to his native village, a place seemingly mired in a backward way of life, for a short visit. As he becomes closely involved with the villagers, Shashi’s short stay threatens to become permanent.

title: Maayakumari
cast: Abir Chatterjee|Rituparna Sengupta|Arunima Ghosh|Sauraseni Maitra|Rajatabha Dutta
overview: Set in the Backdrop of 1940s, the film is based on Maayakumari’s sudden disappearance.

title: Konttho
cast: Shiboprosad Mukherjee|Paoli Dam|Jaya Ahsan|Koneenica Banerjee|Chitra Sen
overview: Arjun Mallik is a popular RJ who is not only famous but well-loved. His listeners connect with him personally and his voice is music to their ears. However, his perfect life comes to an absolute halt when he is diagnosed with throat cancer. A story of hope, a story of friendship, a story of struggle - Konttho, is about the indomitable human spirit.

title: Memories in the Mist
cast: Mithun Chakraborty|Rahul Bose|Sameera Reddy|Sudipta Chakraborty|Laboni Sarkar
overview: A man struggles with his memories of his powerful father.

title: Herogiri
cast: Dev|Mithun Chakraborty|Koel Mallick|Sayantika Banerjee|Kharaj Mukherjee
overview: Shuvo is content being single, even though his father wants him to marry. When his friend tells him about a girl and her father who are cheating naive men, he decides to teach them a lesson.

title: Adda
cast: Dipangshu Acharya|Prantik Banerjee|Swarnabh Banerjee|Sabyasachi Chakraborty|Kasturi Chakraborty
overview: Two angels, Black and White, come down to Earth and spy in on the lives of a eclectic bunch of yuppies in order to decide humanity's fate.

title: Laptop
cast: Churni Ganguly|Rahul Bose|Ananya Chatterjee|Aparajita Adhya|Kaushik Ganguly
overview: The story revolves around a stolen Laptop which becomes a witness of the lives of those who own it from time-to-time, connecting all of them in the process.

title: Sanjhbati
cast: Lily Chakravarty|Dev|Paoli Dam|Soumitra Chatterjee|Sohini Sengupta
overview: Sulekha, a lonely elderly woman, misses her son who lives in a different country but finds comfort in the company of her caretakers.

title: Company Limited
cast: Barun Chanda|Paromita Chowdhury|Sharmila Tagore|Indira Roy|Promod Ganguli
overview: The chronicles of Shyamalendu Chatterjee, an ambitious and self-made young man, as he rises his way up the corporate ladder.  Preserved by the Academy Film Archive in partnership with The Film Foundation in 2001.

title: Toofan 2
cast: Shakib Khan|Chanchal Chowdhury|Mimi Chakraborty|Masuma Rahman Nabila
overview: Sequel to the 2024 action blockbuster Toofan.

title: Mountains of the Moon
cast: Dev|Martin Cito Otto|Nabeel Khan|Paul Ditchfield|David James
overview: Chander Pahar follows Shankar Choudhury, a 20 year-old that takes a job working for the Uganda Railway, and winds up quitting his job in search of diamonds and the Kenya's Mountain of the Moon. Based on the popular Bengali adventure novel of the same name.

title: Loveria
cast: Soham Chakraborty|Puja Banerjee|Rajatabha Dutta|Nondini Chatterjee|Biswanath Basu
overview: A car mechanic, Aditya, falls in love with hot Sweety, a spoiled child. Although they want to get married, Sweety's rich father is against their relationship.

title: Cockpit
cast: Dev|Rukmini Maitra|Koel Mallick|Paran Banerjee|Saayoni Ghosh
overview: Cockpit is a story based on true incidents. The story follows a flight that is going from Mumbai to Calcutta and gets hit from bad turbulent weather.

title: Datta
cast: Rituparna Sengupta|Saheb Chatterjee|Joy Sengupta|Biswajit Chakraborty|Devlina Kumar
overview: Based on Sarat Chandra Chattopadhyay's classic 'Datta', Banamali proposes his daughter Bijoya's hand to his childhood friend's son, Narendra. But, Bijoya is attracted to Bilas and has always been skeptical about Narendra. However, when Bijoya meets Narendra, her feelings take a turn towards the unexpected.

title: That Cloud Never Left
overview: In a not-so-faraway village, people use discarded reels of 35-mm film to make loud toys such as rattlers, whistles and whirligigs. Every day several hundred toys are crafted, and for each of these hundred toys they splice, slit and rip filmstrips. As they follow this routine with uninterrupted monotony, a few narratives leak out from the shredded analogues of film and infuse the place with phantasmagoria.

title: Subho Mahurat
cast: Sharmila Tagore|Rakhee Gulzar|Nandita Das|Sumanta Mukherjee|Tota Roy Chowdhury
overview: An actress mysteriously dies after the "Shubho Mahurat," a celebration of the first shot of the film. A journalist and her perceptive aunt investigate.

title: The Padma Boatman
cast: Raisul Islam Asad|Roopa Ganguly|Champa|Utpal Dutt|Humayun Faridi
overview: Based on the timeless literary work by Manik Bandyopadhyay, Padma Nadir Majhi was directed by Gautam Ghosh. The movie illustrates the tumultuous lives of the fishermen and their families, living by the river Padma. Beautiful shots of the river, Ghosh's flair for realism and brilliant display of acting skills by noted actors of Bangladesh and West Bengal, including Utpal Dutt, Robi Ghosh, Abul Khayer, Raisul Islam Asad, Champa, and Rupa Ganguli, fetched the movie local and international honours.

title: Four Chapters
cast: Dhritiman Chatterjee|Rituparna Sengupta|Joy Sengupta|Subrat Dutta|Kabir Suman
overview: Defying his father’s wishes by following his rebellious uncle’s example, a young Bengali from an upper caste tries to help those on the lower end of the spectrum and, while he’s at it, offers to marry his brother’s pregnant mistress.

title: Kuhelika
cast: Safa Kabir|Nazia Haque Orsha|Yash Rohan|Sharif Siraj|Rakib Hossain Evon
overview: Four friends goes on a tour. They face a sudden incident and while running away they seek help from another place where they meet another lady, a man and a child. From here the plot twists and all of them comes to a version of themselves which other peoples are unaware about.

title: Punorjonmo
cast: Afran Nisho|Mehazabien Chowdhury|Shahed Ali|Quazi Nawshaba Ahmed|Mukul Shiraj
overview: Rafsan Haq is a famous chef of Bangladesh. After disappearing for three years, one day his wife Neela suddenly shows up in a local police station. Everyone around Rafsan including the police became skeptical of this miraculous event and started doubting Neela's identity. What will Rafsan do now? Accept the love of his life or doubt her?

title: Moner Manush
cast: Prosenjit Chatterjee|Mir Naufel Jisan|Priyanshu Chatterjee|Paoli Dam|Chanchal Chowdhury
overview: The movie is about a poet and singer Lalon Fakir who belongs to a cult called baul and who believes and inculcates that the value of a human being is above the narrow belief of religions.

title: Bachchan
cast: Jeet|Aindrita Ray|Mukul Dev|Payel Sarkar|Ashish Vidhyarthi
overview: A huge fan of Amitabh Bachhan falls in love with a Colonel's daughter and tries to woo her. Later, he finds a mobile phone with a obscene video which belongs to a ruthless gangster and starts blackmailing him.

title: Patalghar
cast: Soumitra Chatterjee|Biplab Chatterjee|Kharaj Mukherjee|Monu Mukherjee|Joy Sengupta
overview: Several interested parties go in search of a sleep-generating machine which was made 150 years ago by a scientist. However, a little boy is named the scientist's heir and becomes his legacy.

title: Parbona Ami Chartey Tokey
cast: Bonny Sengupta|Koushani Mukherjee|Kharaj Mukherjee|Tulika Basu|Swastika Dutta
overview: Shibu, the son of a widow, faces difficulties when he tries to express his love to his cousin Aparna.

title: Life in Other Words
cast: Masum Basher|Aanon Siddiqua|Ferdousi Ahmed|Hridoy Khan|Shohel Mondol
overview: When the ill tempered Mr. Kabir and the rest of his family are having an extraordinarily terrible day, a game of cricket stands as their only hope of coming together.

title: Sasurbari Zindabad
cast: Prosenjit Chatterjee|Rituparna Sengupta|Ranjit Mallick|Anamika Saha|Tota Roy Chowdhury
overview: Binodini Roy, a renowned industrialist doesn't like her son-in-law who is an uncultured mechanic.

title: One
cast: Prosenjit Chatterjee|Yash Daasguptaa|Supriyo Dutta|Nusrat Jahan|Rachel White
overview: The plot revolves around IPS Officer Ronojoy Bose, who wants to arrest Aditya Sen, an affluent scientist and son of minister of health who uses secret illegal medical practices for profit.

title: The Middleman
cast: Pradip Mukherjee|Satya Banerjee|Dipankar Dey|Lily Chakravarty|Aparna Sen
overview: A bright and idealistic young graduate steels himself for a dog-eat-dog world, only to flounder in a job market packed with thousands of other hopefuls. When he eventually decides to start his own business as a middle-man, he discovers that the world of business does not live up to his lofty ideals.  Preserved by the Academy Film Archive, in partnership with The Film Foundation, in 1996.

title: Lawho Gouranger Naam Re
cast: Dibyojyoti Dutta|Subhashree Ganguly|Indraneil Sengupta|Ishaa Saha|Bratya Basu
overview: Iconic rendition of Sri Chaitanya on film

title: The Holy Man
cast: Charuprakash Ghosh|Rabi Ghosh|Gitali Roy|Satya Bandopadhyay|Santosh Dutta
overview: A wandering baba initiates a widower layer and his youngest daughter, irritating her boyfriend Satya and the ever-skeptical Nibaran.

title: Aamar Boss
cast: Rakhee Gulzar|Shiboprosad Mukherjee|Srabanti Chatterjee|Sauraseni Maitra|Gourab Chatterjee
overview: A modern family drama unfolds around a unique concept an office-based old-age crèche started by the boss's mother. This innovative initiative not only enhances employee productivity but also fosters a more caring and inclusive work environment.

title: Abhijaan
cast: Parambrata Chatterjee|Soumitra Chatterjee|Jisshu Sengupta|Basabdatta Chatterjee|Qaushiq Mukherjee
overview: A tribute to the life and accomplishments of the legendary Bengali actor Soumitra Chatterjee, who was a pioneer in Indian cinema with a career spanning seven decades.

title: Tarokar Mrityu
cast: Ranjit Mallick|Ritwick Chakraborty|Parno Mittra|Soham Majumdar|Anindya Banerjee
overview: A married couple has come to Kalimpong for a vacation. They book a bungalow which is rumoured to be haunted. During their stay, they experience some paranormal activities which lead to murder. Then investigating starts and the mystery surrounding the house is also solved.

title: Bilambita Loy
cast: Supriya Choudhury|Uttam Kumar|Deepa Chatterjee|Nirmal Kumar|Asit Baran
overview: A promising artist and a singer fall in love in college and get married against their families' wishes. The singer soon begins performing to support her husband and becomes nationally renowned. On the other hand, the artist fails to earn a livelihood and becomes alcoholic.

title: Ahalya
cast: Soumitra Chatterjee|Radhika Apte|Tota Roy Chowdhury|Ayushman Mitra|Dhruva Lal
overview: Ahalya, set as a modern-day thriller, is an ode to a legend from Ramayana. The 14-minute-long film replays the deadly game of Gods, spinning a web of intrigue, seduction, desire and mystery between Gods and Apsaras. Ahalya is a deadly game you can’t escape.

title: Porichoy Gupta
cast: Ritwick Chakraborty|Indraneil Sengupta|Joy Sengupta|Darshana Banik|Sabyasachi Chakraborty
overview: Set in mid-20th century Bengal, Porichoy Gupta explores hidden identities through the intertwined lives of a mysterious landlord and his archaeologist friend.

title: Partner
cast: Jeet|Santu Mukherjee|Swastika Mukherjee|Kanchan Mullick|Anamika Saha
overview: Ayan and elder Dasu are two strangers who decide to end their lives due to their failures. However, things change after they meet each other at the same suicide spot. Based on Shaktipada Rajguru's story.

title: An Enemy of the People
cast: Soumitra Chatterjee|Dhritiman Chatterjee|Dipankar Dey|Ruma Guha Thakurta|Mamata Shankar
overview: Ashoke Gupta is an idealistic doctor working in a town near Calcutta. He discovers that the water at a popular temple is the source of an outbreak of typhoid and hepatitis. In order to save lives, he risks his career to try and call attention to this polluted water source, while a local group of building contractors attempt to discredit him in various ways.

title: Hrid Majharey
cast: Abir Chatterjee|Raima Sen|Indrasish Roy|Prasun Chatterjee|Barun Chanda
overview: An affair that begins one rainy evening on a lonely Calcutta street. And ends on yet another rainy evening in the Andaman Islands. A journey dotted by love, jealousy and destiny, it is loosely inspired by the works of William Shakespeare.

title: Biyallish
cast: Pradeep Kumar|Manju Dey|Bikash Roy|Suruchi Sengupta|Leela Ghosh
overview: The 'Quit India Movement' of 1942.

title: Mastan
cast: Jeet|Swastika Mukherjee|Hara Patnaik|Barsha|Debu Bose
overview: Raju, a poor boy whose mother dies of starvation. He is taken under the fold by the local smuggler Bhanuptatap . He grows up to become an antisocial and an associate of the smuggler

title: Hubba
cast: Mosharraf Karim|Indraneil Sengupta|Gambhira Bhattacharjee|Loknath Dey|Anujoy Chattopadhyay
overview: The notorious Bimal Mandal, who ruled the Rishra-Hindmotor-Konnagar area for years, gets arrested by Dibakar Sen. However, he gets away due to lack of evidence. Soon, Dibakar and Hubba, seem to become alter egos of one another and morality gets blurred.

title: The Case Is Closed
