overview: Archi, a local politician’s daughter, and Parshya, a fisherman’s son, fall in love resulting in violence between the families due to the stringent casteism in the village.

title: Pandharichi Vari
cast: Jayshree Gadkar|Ashok Saraf|Raja Gosavi|Bal Dhuri|Raghavendra Kadkol
overview: A villager embarks on a pilgrimage with his family. Things take an awry turn when a group of thugs decide to rob the family's valuables and join them in the pilgrimage.

title: Babu
cast: Ruchira Jadhav|Sanjay Khapre|Neha Mahajan
overview: Charusheela Tandel and her brother Anil, are at loggerheads with Krishna Bhoir's son, Babu Bhoir. Matters get aggravated when, after years, Babu gets the contract which belonged to Anil, transferred in his name. To seek revenge, Anil takes his own marriage proposal to Supriya's father who is Babu's girlfriend. He also gets Babu jailed & gets back the contract in his name. What Happens next ?

title: Juna Furniture
cast: Mahesh Manjrekar|Sachin Khedekar|Upendra Limaye|Sameer Dharmadhikari|Medha Manjrekar
overview: Govind Pathak's son Abhay Pathak is held responsible for the death of his wife Suhasini. Govind, who wishes the young generation to give time and attention to their parents, brings forward the agony of senior citizens.

title: Ved
cast: Riteish Deshmukh|Genelia D'Souza|Jiya Shankar|Ashok Saraf|Siddharth Jadhav
overview: Satya lives in a railway colony who dreams of playing for the railway cricket team and eventually representing Team India. Soon he falls madly in love with Nisha. However, Satya`s life takes a drastic change when a local Politician Bhaskar creates havoc in his personal and professional life. 12 Years Later, Satya is a drunk miserable man hopelessly waiting for his love. He is married to Shravani who has been crazily in love with Satya since her childhood. Who`s love has more madness - Satya or Shravani?

title: Mulshi Pattern
cast: Sunil Abhyankar|Om Bhutkar|Upendra Limaye|Mohan Joshi|Pravin Vitthal Tarde
overview: A stark portrayal of the hardships faced by farmers, Mulshi Pattern tackles some of the raging issues of our times. The film lays bare the deep flaws of the system which turns the farmer into a criminal and a social outcast.

title: Ashleel Udyog Mitra Mandal
cast: Sai Tamhankar|Abhay Mahajan|Parna Pethe|Sayalee Phatak|Akshay Tanksale
overview: When the epitome of female sexuality, the iconic Savita Bhabhi, comes in 21-year-old Aatish's dreams, he invites her to be the chief guest of the local Dahi Handi festival. Aatish, spellbound by the magical lady who has seen it all, drives himself and those around him into a state of frenzy.

title: Nay Varan Bhat Loncha Kon Nai Koncha
cast: Kashmera Shah|Ganesh Yadav|Shashank Shende|Ganesh Revdekar|Dhananjay Mandrekar
overview: This movie is a brutal look at coming of age in a city whose citizens have been famished by brutality and sin for centuries. It is said that the night sky of Mumbai has been forever haunted - hiding the beautiful twinkling stars by the curse of countless lives lost in a ruthlessly expanding city. The film, soaked in the fog of these ancestors, explores what it takes to grow up in a deprived community, looking to satiate the hunger of one's soul. Enacted by two young souls, The film is a director's masterpiece.

title: Natrang
cast: Atul Kulkarni|Sonalee Kulkarni|Kishore Kadam|Priya Arun Berde|Vibhavari Deshpande
overview: Guna is a village labourer in the hinterlands of Maharashtra. Holding a passion for the 'tamasha' theatre shows, he decides to start his own troupe. Instead of the prestigious role of the king he always dreamed of, he ends up having to play a 'nachya', an effeminate, homosexual man. He goes ahead with the decision, which forever changes him and his family, as he ends up torn between his artistic passion and his societal prestige.

title: Pawankhind
cast: Chinmay Mandlekar|Mrinal Kulkarni|Ajay Purkar|Ruchi Savarn Mohan|Prajakta Mali
overview: The historical rearguard last stand that took place on 13 July 1660 at a mountain pass in the vicinity of fort Vishalgad, near the city of Kolhapur, Maharashtra, India between the Maratha Warrior Baji Prabhu Deshpande and Siddi Masud of Adilshah Sultanate, known as Battle of Pavan Khind.

title: Aatmapamphlet
cast: Manas Tondwalkar|Khushi Hajare|Poonam Kayal|Kunal Jadhav|Shiva
overview: Ten-year-old Ashish falls head-over-heels in love with his classmate, Srushti. While he grows up, the country goes through several socio-economic changes.

title: Panghrun
cast: Amol Bavdekar|Gauri Ingavale|Medha Manjrekar|Vidyadhar Joshi|Sulekha Talwalkar
overview: PANGHRUN is a love story that takes place in this dark age when women could do no more than honor their family name, fall in love with a person chosen for them by someone else, and remain faithful to him at any cost. Inspired by a short story by the renowned poet and author B B Borkar, and directed by Mahesh Manjrekar, PANGHRUN is a tragic tale of love, compassion and ultimate sacrifice one will make, to have a shot at redemption.

title: Ekda Yeun Tar Bagha
cast: Tejaswini Pandit|Girish Kulkarni|Onkar Bhojane|Namrata Awate Sambherao|Vishakha Subhedar
overview: A group of friends start a hotel at their village but things don't go as smoothly as they expected it to be, with tons of eccentric customers, hilarious errors, and untimely deaths.

title: Jait Re Jait
cast: Smita Patil|Mohan Agashe|Sulabha Deshpande|Nilu Phule
overview: A story centered on a Nagya who is a drummer having a passion for being a "pure one" (punyavant). He meets Chindhi, who has abandoned her husband as she considers him useless.

title: Anvatt
cast: Umesh Kamat|Urmilla Kothare|Makarand Anaspure|Bhargavi Chirmule|Vibhavari Deshpande
overview: It is a story about Vinay (Adinath Kothare) and Madhura (Urmila Kanetkar) decide to spend a year in a remote village as per Vinay's late grandfather's wish. As days pass by, the couple encounters strange experiences.

title: Hirkani
cast: Ameet Khedekar|Sonalee Kulkarni|Makrand Deshpande|Jitendra Joshi|Prasad Oak
overview: When the Raigad fort gates get shut down before she could leave, a simple village woman climbs down the cliff in the middle of the night to get back her infant son.

title: Gharat Ganpati
cast: Nikita Dutta|Bhushan Pradhan|Ajinkya Deo|Ashwini Bhave|Sanjay Mone
overview: Set against the picturesque landscape of Konkan, Gharat Ganpati offers an endearing glimpse into the lives of the Gharat family.

title: Nude
cast: Kalyanee Mulay|Chhaya Kadam|Naseeruddin Shah|Kishore Kadam|Madan Deodhar
overview: Yamuna along with her son Laxman locates in Mumbai leaving behind her abusive husband. She takes shelter in the house of her aunt Chandra whom she calls Akka. Yamuna's only aim is to give better education to her son. Chandra finds her a job as a sweeper in an art school. Yamuna finds that Chandra poses as a nude model to the students of the school. Chandra confines Yamuna to take up the job of being nude out there the students don't look at you in lust but as a project.

title: Aapla Manus
cast: Nana Patekar|Sumeet Raghvan|Iravati Harshe|Ajay Devgn|Ila Bhatey
overview: Sr Inspector Maruti Nagargoje is investigating a murder case which took place in the house of a couple.Who claim that they weren't in the house when the incident happened.Maruti has a different way of working as he doesn't consider statement given to police on crime scene as valuable and conducts his own interrogation with suspects.

title: Delivery Boy
cast: Prathamesh Parab|Prithvik Pratap|Ankita Landepatil|Ganesh Yadav
overview: Bhau and Chochya, are small time real estate agents in a small town who happens to meet Dr. Amruta Deshmukh from the city who wants to open a surrogacy hospital in their town.

title: Fandry
cast: Somnath Awghade|Rajeshwari Kharat|Suraj Pawar|Kishore Kadam|Nagraj Popatrao Manjule
overview: Set in contemporary times, Fandry ('Pig') tells the story of teenager Jabya and his family, who are Dalits. While Jabya is struggling in his love life, having fallen for Shalu, a rich upper caste girl in his class, his family is on the lookout for a way to hunt down a wild pig to earn some money.

title: Court
cast: Vira Sathidar|Vivek Gomber|Geetanjali Kulkarni|Pradeep Joshi|Shirish Pawar
overview: A sewerage worker's dead body is found inside a manhole in Mumbai. An ageing folk singer is tried in court on charges of abetment of suicide. He is accused of performing an inflammatory song which might have incited the worker to commit the act. As the trial unfolds, the personal lives of the lawyers and the judge involved in the case are observed outside the court.

title: Yek Number
cast: Dhairya Gholap|Sayli Patil
overview: A flamboyant village boy Pratap, an aspiring politician who's struggling to prove his love to his childhood sweetheart Pinky, picks up an unrealistic challenge to win her over. But on his way to prove himself unknowingly he gets thrown into an internationally induced assassination plan of a fiery political leader. Left with no choice but to prove his innocence he chooses the wrong yet the right path, to succeed or fail.

title: Sangeet Manapmaan
cast: Subodh Bhave|Sumeet Raghvan|Vaidehi Parshurami|Nivedita Joshi Saraf|Upendra Limaye
overview: Based on Krushnaji Prabhakar Khadilkar's musical play of the same name.

title: Natsamrat
cast: Nana Patekar|Medha Manjrekar|Vikram Gokhale|Jitendra Joshi|Shridhar Limaye
overview: Appa, a veteran theatre actor who has primarily worked in adaptations of Shakespeare's plays, falls upon hard times in his old age.

title: Shivrayancha Chhava
cast: Bhushan Patil|Mrinal Kulkarni|Chinmay Mandlekar|Trupti Toradmal|Prasanna Ketkar
overview: Aurangzeb wished to turn Burhanpur into the capital city and appointed Bahadur Khan as the Subhedar who made the lives of its residents miserable. Unable to tolerate this, Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj raids the city and saves the people from the unjust rule.

title: Daagdi Chawl 2
cast: Neha Bam|Ankush Chaudhari|Makrand Deshpande|Yatin Karyekar|Vijay Nikam
overview: Explore the lives of the residents of Daagdi Chaawl, a notorious slum in Mumbai, as they attempt to rebuild after the destruction of their homes.

title: Antarvasna
cast: Shivani Tanksale|Sanjay Khapre|Shriya Pilgaonkar|Rasika Dugal|Srinika Patwardhan
overview: A middle-aged housewife and mother of a 12 year old kid struggles to find time for herself to manage between unending housework and a regular ignorant husband.

title: Ani... Dr. Kashinath Ghanekar
cast: Subodh Bhave|Anand Ingle|Mohan Joshi|Amruta Khanvilkar|Sonali Kulkarni
overview: The true story of the first Marathi superstar Kashinath Ghanekar, chronicling his struggles and hardships in marriage and life to pursue his passion for acting and attain the unmatched heights of stardom in Marathi theatre and cinema.

title: Kachha Limbu
cast: Ravi Jadhav|Sachin Khedekar|Sonali Kulkarni|Manmeet Pem
overview: Based on a novel written by legendary Marathi writer Shri. Jaywant Dalvi, Kaccha Limbu is set in the 80's. Mr. Katdare and his wife Shaileja live with their mentally unstable son. While Mr. Katdare works perpetual night shifts at the telegraph office, Shaileja works for a private firm. Their son, Bacchu, is now 16 years old and his growing age and sexuality are a cause of concern for this couple, especially Shaileja. Mr. Katdare tries to find the solution for his problems in death, while Shaileja, in her quest for happiness, finds herself drifting towards her benign boss Mr. Pandit.  How this couple, who is on the verge of getting lost in the quagmire of their circumstances, fight their way back to sanity and togetherness is a heart warming story of this film, Kaccha Limbu, which is a term used on the Indian playgrounds to signify the underdog.

title: Har Har Mahadev
cast: Subodh Bhave|Sharad Kelkar|Milind Shinde|Sharad Ponkshe|Amruta Khanvilkar
overview: The young Shivaji Shahaji Bhosale is building the foundation of Hindavi Swarajya. This is the beginning of a memorable journey for the man who will go on to be known as Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. But to turn this dream of Swarajya into reality, he must unite the Watandars.

title: Navra Mazha Navsacha
cast: Sachin Pilgaonkar|Supriya Pilgaonkar|Ashok Saraf|Vijay Patkar|Sonu Nigam
overview: Journey of a husband and wife from Mumbai to Ganpatipule to fulfill a vow.

title: Mukkam Post Bombilwaadi
cast: Prashant Damle|Vaibhav Mangle|Adwait Dadarkar|Geetanjali Kulkarni|Mrinmayee Godbole
overview: Set in 1942, Mukkam Post Bombilwaadi is a hilarious tale of a peaceful Indian village suddenly thrown into chaos with the arrival of Hitler. Amid World War II's disruption, people in the village, led by their local theater group, battle to defeat the dictator. Will they succeed in their comical quest to conquer Hitler?..

title: Online Binline
cast: Rutuja Shinde|Siddharth Chandekar|Hemant Dhome|Prasad Kamat|Pournima Manohar
overview: Sid, an Internet addict, loves Kimaya but is unsure of approaching her without the facade of the virtual world. When his friend also falls in love with her, he competes against him to win her heart.

title: Maza Ghar Maza Sansar
cast: Mugadha Chitnis|Ajinkya Deo|Asawari Joshi|Reema Lagoo|Rajan Tamhane
overview: Prasad and Nayan are happy to be with each other and also choose a separate house, but Prasad's uncle wants his sister Suman to get married first. Prasad decides to postpone his wedding and sacrifice his house by dropping his plans and uses the money for Suman's wedding. Prasad and Nayan get married soon and are living happily but cracks develop between his mother and Nayan which is never ending and takes worst turn when Suman comes to stay with them during her pregnancy.

title: Shrimant Damodar Pant
cast: Vijay Chavan|Bharat Jadhav|Kranti Redkar|Ragini Samant|Rajiv Sawant
overview: An exceptional marathi stage play describing the human relationships in a strange manner

title: The Disciple
cast: Aditya Modak|Arun Dravid|Sumitra Bhave|Deepika Bhida Bhagwat|Kiran Yadnyopavit
overview: Self-doubt, sacrifice and struggle converge into an existential crisis for a devoted classical vocalist as the mastery he strives for remains elusive.

title: Majhi Prarthana
cast: Padmaraj Rajgopal Nair|Anusha Adep|Upendra Limaye|Jainendra Nikale|Vijayendra Mandavkar
overview: Set in British-era rural Maharashtra, Majhi Prarthana – Akalpaniya Prem Katha is a heart-wrenching tale of unimaginable love. Golya and Prarthana’s love blooms like a wildflower amidst thorns and they find solace in each other’s hearts, shining brighter than the stars. But as their love deepens, a dark force rises —an unrelenting shadow of power and betrayal determined to crush their dreams. Will their love withstand the storm and carve its name into history, or will it be lost in the abyss of fate?

title: Sher Shivraj
cast: Chinmay Mandlekar|Mrinal Kulkarni|Mukesh Rishi|Digpal Lanjekar|Isha Keskar
overview: One of the greatest and bravest incident from the life of The Great Maratha King Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj where he defeated Afzalkhan with his brilliant tactics and courage.

title: 7 Roshan Villa
cast: Prasad Oak|Tejaswini Pandit|Sonali Khare|Pradeep Velankar|Savita Malpekar
overview: 7 Roshan Vila is a suspense thriller and a revenge story. Tejswini the daughter of a rich Pharmaceutical company’s owner, who marries Prasad, a middle class individual who becomes the “Gharjavai” and later on acquires his father-in-law’s company. Tejaswini frequently hallucinates and is on medicines. In between all of this Prasad is pushing her to mental breakdown by constantly telling her that she is not mentally unstable. He also has an affair forming a love triangle. The story takes a new turn when Twjaswini starts forming ideas for Revenge on Prasad leading to attempted murders.

title: Deool Band
cast: Gashmeer Mahajani|Girija Joshi|Mohan Joshi|Mohan Agashe|Nivedita Joshi Saraf
overview: Dr Raghav Shastri, a young NASA scientist, returns to India and realises that the entire nation blindly worships God. An atheist, he decides to challenge the existence of the Almighty and tries to shut a temple. But in a twist of fate, Swami Samartha himself descends and questions the non-believer.

title: Anandi Gopal
cast: Bhagyashree Milind|Lalit Prabhakar|Sonia Albizuri|Kshitee Jog|Yogesh Soman
overview: Anandibai Joshi, the First Indian woman who went against all odds to get herself educated and became a doctor to set an example and inspired generations to come. In times, when gender equality and feminism are raised at almost every forum and podium, a couple in the 1800's practiced and fought for these very ideas. Anandi Gopal is a love story more than a biopic about the struggle of a husband to teach his wife and her response and determination to become the first Indian Female Doctor.

title: Devmanus
cast: Mahesh Manjrekar|Renuka Shahane|Subodh Bhave|Siddharth Bodke|Anshuman Joshi
overview: A devout priest's peaceful existence unravels after a moral transgression forces him to choose between confession and making amends.

title: Ghayaal
cast: Madhukar Toradmal|Padma Chavan|Ashok Saraf|Nina Kulkarni|Ajinkya Deo
overview: A man and a woman fall in love and decide to get married. Problems arise when the couple realise that their families have been bitter rivals for a long time.

title: Gulkand
cast: Sai Tamhankar|Prasad Oak|Samir Choughule|Esha Dey|Tejas Raut
overview: At least 10 known health benefits of 'Gulkand' (Rose-Petal Jam). This film is about the 11th and perhaps the most important benefit - Happiness—a film as sweet, fragrant and healthy as the condiment itself. Nostalgia re-creates relationship drama like no other emotion. When young lovers unite - the whole world conspires to challenge them at every step...but what happens when 'older lovers' re-unite? Gulkand is one such rosy sweet story that celebrates the innocence; the high-strung emotions; the melodrama; the sweetness and the tragic-comedy nature of the perpetual global pandemic - love.

title: Vedaat Marathe Veer Daudale Saat
cast: Akshay Kumar|Pravin Tarde|Vishal Nikam|Hardik Joshi|Satya Manjrekar
overview: It shows the inspirational story of the extraordinary bravery of seven Maratha warriors of Maratha Empire to achieve dream of Swaraj in 1674.

title: Shyamchi Aai
cast: Vanamala Pawar|Madhav Vaze|Damuanna Joshi|Umesh|Baburao Pendharkar
overview: The plot revolves around a boy called Shyam and his relationship with his mother. It shares the effect Shyam's mother has had on Shyam's life and upbringing, and how he is taught to stick to his ideals and principles, even in the face of poverty. The relationships of all the individuals in Shyam's family are explored.

title: Bonus
cast: Gashmeer Mahajani|Pooja Sawant|Jaywant Wadkar|Mohan Agashe
overview: Aditya runs his family business he follows a vegan diet.His dream is to take business to another level and wants his workers to be paid well.But his grandfather opposes against the decision of paying bonus to his workers and challenges him to live their life for a month.

title: Shala
cast: Dilip Prabhavalkar|Santosh Juvekar|Ketaki Mategaonkar|Anshuman Joshi|Jitendra Joshi
overview: Set in the 70's in rural India, four 9th grade kids were writing their destiny. Joshi (14) is madly in love with Shirodkar (14) a beautiful Indian looking girl. Both study in the same class. The age old question "What is love anyway?"

title: Savita Damodar Paranjpe
cast: Subodh Bhave|Trupti Toradmal|Raqesh Bapat|Pallavi Patil|Angad Mhaskar
overview: The life of a married couple turns upside down after 8 years of marriage as some hard truths between them come to light. The answers to all these questions will be revealed in this psychological thriller based on true events.

title: Hi Anokhi Gaath
cast: Shreyas Talpade|Gauri Ingavale|Sharad Ponkshe|Suhas Joshi
overview: A young aspiring dancer's father forces her to marry a stoic, yet understanding man. Then begins a sweet-and-sour relationship with her husband. But when he comes to know she loves another man, he strives to bring her and her lover close, shaking the foundation of their marriage.

title: Paani
cast: Adinath Kothare|Rucha Vaidya|Nitin Dixit|Subodh Bhave|Kishore Kadam
overview: Set in a quaint Marathwada village of Maharashtra, a man tired of relentless droughts decides to take matters in his own hands by encouraging the villagers to finally put an end to the dreary odyssey of their sufferance.

title: Poshter Girl
cast: Madhav Abhyankar|Hemant Dhome|Anand Ingale|Hrishikesh Joshi|Jitendra Joshi
overview: Poshter Girl takes you on a mad roller coaster ride of a quaint, little village in Maharashtra - Tekawde, which is ill-famous for female infanticide and as a result there are no girls left within the village. When the question of boys' marriage is on heat, a beautiful and Intelligent girl enters the scenario and changes everything. This is the story of the girl Rupali and her chosen 5 candidates who would do anything to win her heart.

title: Bucket List
cast: Madhuri Dixit|Sumeet Raghvan|Vandana Gupte|Pradeep Velankar|Renuka Shahane
overview: 'Bucket List' is a story of a woman trapped in the confines of her own choices and her journey to self discovery. Madhura Sane is a 40 y.o housewife (by choice) belonging to a quintessential middle/upper middle class family in Pune. One fine day, through a chance encounter, Madhura comes face to face with a choice that could potentially change her whole life. And that choice involves...a Bucket List.

title: Boyz 4
cast: Ritika Shrotri|Parth Bhalerao|Pratik Lad|Sumant Shinde|Girish Kulkarni
overview: Kabir decides to break friendship with Dhariya and Dhungiya after they come in merit by cheating in exams and shifts to London for further studies.

title: Mitwa
cast: Prarthana Behere|Aruna Irani|Swapnil Joshi|Sonalee Kulkarni
overview: Shivam Sarang, a rich hotelier from Goa, does not believe in love or the institution of marriage. But when Nandini, a smart woman, joins his hotel as an employee, he is attracted to her.

title: Vaalvi
cast: Subodh Bhave|Anita Date-Kelkar|Shivani Surve|Swapnil Joshi|Namrata Awate Sambherao
overview: Vaalvi is a dark comedy that explores the profound human nature involving selfishness, apathy and self-preservation.

title: Medium Spicy
cast: Lalit Prabhakar|Sai Tamhankar|Parna Pethe|Sagar Deshmukh|Neha Joshi
overview: Chef Nissim, a millennial in Mumbai, finds himself at a crossroads in his love life-- Chef Gowri is a feisty go-getter who likes to live life off the beaten path while Prajakta assures a more serene and stable life. Whether to go all-in with the spice or to choose a sweeter flavour for life, is a choice that Nissim has to make. His liberal, upper middle-class family with a mixed bag of viewpoints doesn't make his decision easier.

title: Maharashtra Shahir
cast: Ankush Chaudhari|Sana Kedar Shinde|Mrunmayee Deshpande
overview: A biopic of Krishnarao Ganpatrav Sable, akka Shahir Sable.

title: Subhedar
cast: Chinmay Mandlekar|Ajay Purkar|Smita Shewale|Mrinal Kulkarni|Digpal Lanjekar
overview: Jay Shivaray In 'Subhedar', one will experience the thrilling feat of a mighty warrior who sacrifices his life to build the victory pylon of Swarajya on the summit of the fort, setting aside the marriage of his son.

title: Ashi Hi Banwa Banwi
cast: Ashok Saraf|Sachin Pilgaonkar|Laxmikant Berde|Siddharth Ray|Supriya Pilgaonkar
overview: Chaos ensues when two brothers, Dhananjay and Shantanu, force two friends to pose as their wives as their landlady allows only married couples as tenants.

title: Mauli
cast: Riteish Deshmukh|Siddharth Jadhav|Saiyami Kher|Jitendra Joshi|Genelia D'Souza
overview: Mauli is a tough cop whose in control when in uniform.But a big terror to criminals without uniform he gets transferred to Kapur village which has no respect for cops and it's temple is closed since last 15 years due to terror of Nana Londhe.Mauli beats his men black and blue where he finds admire in Renuka.Its soon reveled that Mauli is a simple man but the actual terror cop is his twin brother with the same name.Mauli's brother dies while trying to save Mauli from Nana leaving Mauli helpless in the village and face humiliation in front of Nana's terror.

title: Bali
cast: Swapnil Joshi|Pooja Sawant|Abhishek Bachankar|Rohit Kokate
overview: This movie is about the life of a middle class, widowed father, Shrikant that takes an unexpected turn when his seven year old Son, Mandar collapses and is referred to Jansanjeevani Hospital for a detailed diagnosis. Things take a turn when Mandar starts talking to a mysterious nurse which he claims to be staying in the abandoned part of the hospital.

title: Kaagar
cast: Rinku Rajguru|Shubhankar Tawde|Shashank Shende|Shantanu Gangne|Bharati Patil
overview: Yuvraj works for a renowned politician, Prabhakar, and falls in love with his daughter, Rani. However, a brewing political conspiracy changes the course of many lives.

title: Cycle
cast: Hrishikesh Joshi|Priyadarshan Jadhav|Bhalchandra Kadam|Deepti Lele|Abhijeet Chavan
overview: Keshav, an astrologer, deeply values his cycle as it is his most prized possession. However, problems arise when a couple of thieves steal his bicycle.

title: Jarann
cast: Amruta Subhash|Rajan Bhise|Seema Deshmukh|Vikram Gaikwad|Kishore Kadam
overview: Escaping the past is impossible

title: Against the Tide
overview: Two friends, both Indigenous fishermen, are driven to desperation by a dying sea. Their friendship begins to fracture as they take very different paths to provide for their struggling families.

title: Pak Pak Pakaak
cast: Nana Patekar|Saksham Kulkarni|Narayani Shastri|Usha Nadkarni|Jyoti Subhash
overview: A mischievous boy, living with his grandmother in a village that people believe is haunted, meets the ghost "Bhutya". How the "Bhutya" transforms the boy's character and the whole village in the process, forms the rest of the story.

title: The First Wedding
overview: Bhumi and Akash decide to get married, an unheard union in a world of only same sex couples. We see snippets of their life through camcorder footage, and an interview discussing their decision to fight the system.

title: Mumbai Pune Mumbai
cast: Swapnil Joshi|Mukta Barve
overview: A girl from Mumbai who comes to Pune to meet a prospective groom, with the idea of rejecting him, ends up spending the day with a complete stranger.

title: Navra Mazha Navsacha 2
cast: Sachin Pilgaonkar|Supriya Pilgaonkar|Swapnil Joshi|Ashok Saraf|Vaibhav Mangle
overview: Bhakti and Vacky are once again on a journey to seek blessings at Ganpati Pule but this time because of their daughter Shraddha who makes an unusual and hilarious vow which she forces her fiancé to fulfill as a condition to marry her. With all the adventures and obstacles on their Konkan railway journey, will they be able to fulfill their vow this time as well?

title: Sant Dnyaneshwaranchi Muktaai
cast: Sameer Dharmadhikari|Mrinal Kulkarni|Ajay Purkar|Manoj Joshi|Yogesh Soman
overview: Depicts the life and spiritual journey of Muktaai, the revered sister of the saint and poet Sant Dnyaneshwar, highlighting her profound impact on Marathi literature and culture.

title: Sridevi Prasanna
cast: Sai Tamhankar|Siddharth Chandekar|Sulabha Arya|Siddharth Bodke|Ramakant Dayma
overview: Sridevi and Prasanna find a unique connection despite family pressure, challenging the usual ideas about love and romance.

title: Me Shivajiraje Bhosale Boltoy
cast: Sachin Khedekar|Abhijit Kelkar|Ganesh Yadav|Mahesh Manjrekar|Makarand Anaspure
overview: Representing thousands of Marathi's, Dinkar Maruti Bhosle, feels he is lost in Aamchi Mumbai and voices his concern about being overlooked and victimized over other communities. Ultimately he curses his ancestors for being born a Marathi. That's when Shivaji Raje gets his attention and gives him a piece of his mind

title: Family Katta
cast: Vandana Gupte|Dilip Prabhavalkar|Sai Tamhankar|Aadesh Shrivastava
overview: A splintered family reunites for the parents' golden anniversary. Will things go as planned? Or will new challenges and old problems resurface? Family Katta is an absorbing drama featuring top notch acting talent from the Marathi industry.

title: Jogwa - The Awakening
cast: Mukta Barve|Upendra Limaye|Kishore Kadam|Priya Arun Berde|Vinay Apte
overview: Suli's life takes a turn after she is forcefully made to serve the local deity because of an ancient tradition. When she meets Tayappa, who shares a similar fate, they find comfort in one another.

title: Tu Hi Re
cast: Swapnil Joshi|Sai Tamhankar|Tejaswini Pandit|Girish Oak|Sushant Shelar
overview: Nandini(Sai Tamhankar) is someone who is a staunch believer in love marriages but following her father's orders, she gets married to Siddharth (Swapnil Joshi) who is coping with heartbreak. Eight years later, Siddharth and Nandini are leading happy lives in Mumbai with their daughter. Kamlakar Bhanushali (Girish Oak), a politician who has some connection with Siddharth's past, comes to Siddharth's workplace and makes a proposal to him. He tells Siddharth that he's ready to fund Siddharth's work plant with Rs 25 crore provided he gets rid of Nandini. Turns out, Siddharth used to be in a relationship with Bhanushali's daughter Bhairavi (Tejaswini Pandit).How this situation resolves forms the crux of the story.

title: Ghar Banduk Biryani
cast: Akash Thosar|Nagraj Popatrao Manjule|Sayaji Shinde|Suraj Pawar|Sayli Patil
overview: Ghar Banduk Biryani is witty and thrilling story of one who is longing for a home, another who is struggling for his right and a third person with a hunger for ambition.

title: Baji
cast: Shreyas Talpade|Amruta Khanvilkar|Jitendra Joshi|Ravi Jadhav|Ila Bhatey
overview: It is an action-adventure-romance laced superhero vigilante film that transcends both folklore and present day. It is based on the legend of a man who took upon himself to protect the common man against oppression and injustice.

title: Raja Shivaji
cast: Riteish Deshmukh|Sanjay Dutt|Abhishek Bachchan|Mahesh Manjrekar|Sachin Khedekar
overview: Chronicles the rise of young Shivaji Bhonsale, who challenged the might of established empires to found the Maratha kingdom and lay the groundwork for “Swarajya” (self-rule) during a turbulent period of Indian history.

title: Jhimma
cast: Sonalee Kulkarni|Siddharth Chandekar|Nirmiti Sawant|Kshitee Jog|Suhas Joshi
overview: The movie  revolves around a group of seven women travelling to London and discovering themselves.

title: Aaba Zindabad
cast: Sonalee Kulkarni|Ashok Saraf|Aanand Kale|Vijay Chavan|Kishori Ambiye
overview: Widower Vitthal Patil (Aaba) wishes his son Yurvaj completes his education and settles well.But Yuvraj only spends his money by doing parties in name of studies. Aaba is joyful when Yuvraj tops in college but finds that he faked his marksheet and scolds him. Yuvraj feels that Aaba does not have right to scold him as he himself is illiterate. Aaba then decides to take education and joins Yuvraj's college where he is made fun at first but soon everyone respects and loves him making Yuvraj jealous while college lecturer Madam Godse falls in love with Aaba.

title: Susheela Sujeet
cast: Sonali Kulkarni|Swapnil Joshi|Renuka Daftardar|Sunil Godabole|Rajendra Shisatkar
overview: Two strangers find themselves locked in a room and make increasingly absurd attempts to get out.

title: Sarsenapati Hambirrao
cast: Pravin Tarde|Sunil Abhyankar|Raqesh Bapat|Devendra Gaikwad|Amit Jadhav
overview: Based on the Maratha warrior Hansaji Mohite who was later given the title of Sarnobat Hambirrao, the film portrays his life as the Commander in Chief of Chatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's army.

title: Pachhadlela
cast: Bharat Jadhav|Shreyas Talpade|Dilip Prabhavalkar|Vandana Gupte|Laxmikant Berde
overview: Due to a job transfer, three friends move into a town where the bank they work at assigns them by way of living quarters a creepy mansion with a haunted history. One of the friends, Bharat (Bharat Jadhav), is prone to being possessed. The four ghosts enter Bharat's body at will and use him for their own intentions, resulting is hilarious misunderstandings, confusions, and the unfolding of a story of sinister revenge.

title: Ghaath
cast: Jitendra Joshi|Milind Shinde|Janardan Kadam|Dhananjay Mandaokar|Suruchi Adarkar
overview: An unsparing psychological portrait of the civil war that has been raging in central India for over 50 years. Set in the middle of the jungle, we see what happens to perpetrators and victims whose lives are marked by a constant proximity to violence and death.

title: Bhikari
cast: Swapnil Joshi|Sayaji Shinde|Rucha Inamdar|Kirti Adarkar|Kailash Waghmare
overview: An unfortunate event in Samrat's life puts him in a situation where he has to make a choice. A choice that very few will ever make. A choice to try and get back his mother's life.

title: Ankush
cast: Ketaki Mategaonkar|Deepraj Ghule|Sayaji Shinde|Mangesh Desai|Shashank Shende
overview: Ankush, an clever boy belonging to a middle-class family, has high expectations placed on him. Ravi falls in love with him. In an attempt to save his own life, Ankush gets caught between a group of bullies.

title: Amhi Satpute
cast: Sachin Pilgaonkar|Supriya Pilgaonkar|Ashok Saraf|Swapnil Joshi|Amruta Sant
overview: Amhi Satpute is a 2008 Marathi remake of the Hindi action comedy film Satte Pe Satta. It was made by Sachin Pilgaonkar who also appears in it, alongside other primary cast including Ashok Saraf, Supriya Pilgaonkar, Swapnil Joshi, Atul Parchure and Nirmiti Sawant.

title: Fakta Ladh Mhana
cast: Mahesh Manjrekar|Bharat Jadhav|Sachin Khedekar|Sanjay Narvekar|Siddharth Jadhav
overview: The film begins with the sad state of affairs in a village, where politician turned Industries Minister Patil and his brother with the help of local politician Kulkarni (Vaibhav Mangale) make the lives of poor farmers miserable forcing them to sale their lands after the SEZ comes into force. Mahesh Manjrekar, Sanjay Khapre, Siddhu The only opposition comes from an ex-serviceman (Satish Pulekar) who refuses to bow down. He is murdered by Kulkarni and his men but his mentally challenged nephew is the mute witness against Kulkarni. His helpless uncle after witnessing the thumb rule, rushes him to the city in search of an elder nephew (Bharat Jadhav) of the ex-serviceman. Thus begins the revenge

title: Sari
cast: Ritika Shrotri|Ajinkya Raut|Sanjay Khapre|Mrinal Kulkarni
overview: Introverted girl whose routine life brightens up when she falls for Rohit, one of her fellow college mates. Will they be together?

title: Deool
cast: Nana Patekar|Dilip Prabhavalkar|Girish Kulkarni|Mohan Agashe|Sonali Kulkarni
overview: Keshya, a simple villager believes that god has arrived in his village but everyone disbelieves him. Later when the politics plays its part things take a drastic change

title: Duniyadari
cast: Swapnil Joshi|Ankush Chaudhari|Urmilla Kothare|Sai Tamhankar|Jitendra Joshi
overview: Duniyadari (Marathi: दुनियादारी) is a 2013 Marathi movie directed by Sanjay Jadhav. This movie is about journey of every individual which eventually makes one realize the true face of life. It has been acclaimed by Marathi audience. Critical reception of the film is positive.

title: Fussclass Dabhade
cast: Amey Wagh|Siddharth Chandekar|Kshitee Jog|Nivedita Joshi Saraf|Harish Dudhade
overview: The Dabhade family's wedding brings together laughter, chaos, and emotional moments as old conflicts resurface. Despite the tension, the family is reminded of the unbreakable bonds of love, loyalty, and shared history that define them.

title: Dharmaveer
cast: Prasad Oak|Kshitish Date|Makakarand Date|Shruti Marathe|Vijay Nikam
overview: A biopic on life of a Hindu nationalist leader Anand Dighe, through various incidents narrated by his close aides.

title: Coffee
cast: Siddharth Chandekar|Mohan Joshi|Spruha Joshi
overview: Coffee is a symbol of freshness and energy. Having a coffee is a wonderful experience, Actually it has very different taste, a little bitter a little sweet, but the combination is very nice, The same we can say about relationships, the taste of relationships is a bit sweet a little & bit bitter like this, But overall relationships are great itself, Intimacy, love, resentment, estrangement,

title: Vihir
cast: Mohan Agashe|Madan Deodhar|Girish Kulkarni|Alok Rajwade|Jyoti Subhash
overview: Vihir is a story of two adolescent boys Sameer and Nachiket (cousins, who are best friends) who struggle with their unconventional outlooks on life and family. They write to each other telling each other about their doings and happenings in life. They get to meet after a long time as Sameer with his mother and sister visit Nachiket's village for a family wedding.

title: Raja Shiv Chhatrapati
cast: Smita Patil|Shreeram Gojamgunde|Sumati Gupte|Reema Lagoo|Vasant Aathawale
overview: A film based on Maharashtra's beloved king, Raja Shiv Chhatrapati's life.

title: Union
cast: Prateeksha Lonkar|Atul Kulkarni|Shreyas Talpade|Priya Bapat|Tushar Dalvi
overview: Bhet is a Marathi movie released in 2002. Chandrakant Kulkarni has directed the movie & produced it along with Nitin Patil. Movie plot is based on a mother-son who reunite against all odds & how egos are defeated by emotions and feelings.

title: Chandramukhi
cast: Amruta Khanvilkar|Adinath Kothare|Rajendra Shisatkar|Samir Choughule|Mrunmayee Deshpande
overview: A political background based musical love story set in 80's. Vishwas Patil's Chandramukhi is an excellent novel that weaves together the worlds of Politics and Tamasha

title: Aawhan
cast: Kashmera Shah|Sachin Khedekar|Amruta Khanvilkar|Subodh Bhave|Mohan Joshi
overview: Maalinga becomes a victim of MLA Jaganath Kaalam's exploitation but seeks justice. After the MLA's contact with influential personalities makes her life even more difficult, she decides to fight back.

title: Prawaas
cast: Ashok Saraf|Padmini Kolhapure|Shashank Udapurkar|Vikram Gokhale|Rajit Kapoor
overview: After a medical emergency gives him a wake-up call, Abhijat Inamdar decides to live his life to the fullest by helping other people with their problems and searching for his purpose to live.

title: Bamboo
cast: Abhinay Berde|Vaishanvi Kalyankar|Parth Bhalerao|Shivaji Satham|Samir Choughule
overview: Bamboo is a Marathi movie starring Abhinay Berde, Vaishanvi Kalyankar, Parth Bhalerao, Shivaji Satam and Samir Choughule in prominent roles. It is directed by Vishal Devrukhka.

title: Jaundya Na Balasaheb
cast: Girish Kulkarni|Sai Tamhankar|Manava Naik|Mohan Joshi|Bhalchandra Kadam
overview: The film addresses issues related to the younger generation in politics, and argues that one need not have a problem with dynastic politics, if the heirs are worthy and manage to prove their eligibility.

title: A Match
cast: Nandini Chikte|Taranath Khiratkar|Sangita Sonekar|Suyog Dhawas|Sandip Somalkar
overview: It chronicles the experiences of a young woman yearning to determine her own future in a world where patriarchal traditions deprive women of agency and arranged marriage is presented as the only option for self-betterment.

title: Dhadakebaaz
cast: Laxmikant Berde|Ashwini Bhave|Mahesh Kothare|Deepak Shirke|Prajakta Kulkarni
overview: Lakshya finds a bottle, which has Gangaram trapped in it who is his lookalike. He promises to make everything possible with the sand in the bottle, but once the sand is over he will be free to go.

title: Sunrise
cast: Adil Hussain|Tannishtha Chatterjee|Gulnaaz Ansari|Komal Gupta|Esha Amlani
overview: Inspector Joshi is a grieving father searching for his daughter Aruna, kidnapped years ago when she was six. In his despair, life converges with a recurring dream in which Joshi pursues a shadowy figure who leads him to 'Paradise', a night-club where teenage girls dance to a leering crowd. He is convinced he will find Aruna there and vows to bring her back to Leela, his broken wife.

title: Firebrand
cast: Usha Jadhav|Sachin Khedekar|Girish Kulkarni|Rajeshwari Sachdev
overview: While she advocates for her female clients in divorce cases, a lawyer's trauma from sexual violence impacts her own marriage.

title: Shikshanachya Aaicha Gho
cast: Bharat Jadhav|Siddharth Jadhav|Sachin Khedekar|Saksham Kulkarni|Mahesh Manjrekar
overview: Shikshanacha Aaicha Gho is a 2010 Indian Marathi film directed by Mahesh Manjrekar starring Sachin Khedekar, Bharat Jadhav, Saksham Kulkarni, Gauri Vaidya, Siddharth Jadhav and Kranti Redkar. The film was released on 15 January 2010.[2] Films music composed by trio Ajit-Atul-Sameer. After Astitva with 9 years long gap Mahesh Manjrekar directed Marathi film.This film was later remade in Tamil & Telugu as Dhoni and in Bengali as "Chalo Paltai" starring Prosenjit Chatterjee.

title: Katyar Kaljat Ghusali
cast: Shankar Mahadevan|Amruta Khanvilkar|Sakshi Tanwar|Subodh Bhave|Sachin Pilgaonkar
overview: Katyar Kaljat Ghusli is a 2015 Marathi film based on a play by the same name. Directed by Subodh Bhave, the film stars Sachin Pilgaonkar, Shankar Mahadevan, and Subodh Bhave in lead roles. The film marks the acting debut for Mahadevan and directorial debut for Bhave. The original play premiered in 1967 in Mumbai, where Hindustani classical vocalist Vasantrao Deshpande played one of the protagonists. In 2010, the play was relaunched with protagonists essayed by Rahul Deshpande, grandson of Vasantrao Deshpande and singer Mahesh Kale. The film's music is composed by Shankar–Ehsaan–Loy, and retained some of the songs from the original play composed by Jitendra Abhisheki.

title: Ti Saddhya Kay Karte
cast: Ankush Chaudhari|Tejashri Pradhan|Abhinay Berde|Aarya Ambekar|Tushar Dalvi
overview: Anurag wonders about his first love Tanvi, whom he hasn't seen in years. Will their love be rekindled when they reconnect after a long time apart?

title: Laal Batti
cast: Mangesh Desai|Bhargavi Chirmuley|Chhaya Kadam|Manoj Joshi
overview: Laal Batti examines the unseen facets of the day-to-day lives of policemen. Oftentimes, the public regards the men in khakee as irredeemable and corrupt, choosing to maintain a safe distance from them. The film aims to correct this warped perception by presenting a humane portrait of Maharashtra's law-enforcement officers. Inspector Pawar becomes suspicious of commando Ganesh Dhangde because of his odd behaviour and decides to investigate the truth about his real identity.

title: Manjula of The Mohits
cast: Jayshree Gadkar|Baburao Pendharkar|Suryakant Mandhare|Master Vithal
overview: To capture the fort of Javal, Shivaji assigns the job to Bahiriji Naik. Manjula Mohite, a fearless girl who is desired by Kedarji of Javal, works along with Bahiriji to capture the fort.

title: Boyz 2
cast: Parth Bhalerao|Om Ahire|Rohit Aryan|Kishori Ambiye|Onkar Bhojane
overview: Naru Bondwe son of college trustee Madan Bondwe keeps of doing re admission in college and has rivalry with Juniors.Dhariya,Dhungya and Kabir are known to fight for rights of Juniors.But Kabir has now staying away from hostel as he doesn't want more trouble with seniors due to his 12th standard board exams.A grade committee is about to visit the college in the year and the principal gives a teacher Vikram Sabnis to put an end to Junior and Senior rivalry.Chitra a beautiful girls enters the college and Kabir attract towards he rand shifts back to hostel.The rivalry of Juniors and Seniors takes to a worst turn that before the grade committee's visit.Naru and Kabir selected members from both teams should loose their virginity towards a girl.And as a proof record the video failing which the looser has to leave the college.

title: Aajcha Divas Majha
cast: Sachin Khedekar|Ashwini Bhave|Mahesh Manjrekar|Hrishikesh Joshi|Satish Alekar
overview: The movie is an entertaining and a cinematic journey of a morally-stricken Chief Minister who works efficiently and actively to help a beleaguered elderly singer who is yet to receive the government allotted flat applied for eight long years ago!  The story line depicts originally of characters such as the CM, his wife, his PA, the Principle Secretary and many personnel from the assembly. Story revolves within the time period of afternoon 3 PM to 6 AM dawn during which it highlights the political decision making process and also gives us an insight to the unending mind games between politicians and bureaucrats within our system.

title: Killa
cast: Amruta Subhash|Archit Deodhar|Parth Bhalerao|Gaurish Gawade|Atharva Upasni
overview: An 11-year-old boy struggles to cope with the death of his father while trying to make new friends in an unfamiliar place, after his mother gets a job transfer.

title: Jhimma 2
cast: Rinku Rajguru|Nirmiti Sawant|Kshitee Jog|Shivani Surve|Suhas Joshi
overview: To celebrate Indu's 75th birthday, the whole gang goes on a foreign trip as chaos ensues between young women and their mother-in-laws.

title: Gabhricha Paus
cast: Girish Kulkarni|Sonali Kulkarni|Jyoti Subhash|Aman Attar|Veena Jamkar
overview: There's more at stake than just failed crops when a drought strikes a rural community in this comedy-drama from India.

title: Karkhanisanchi Waari
cast: Geetanjali Kulkarni|Mohan Agashe|Amey Wagh|Shubhangi Gokhale|Bhushan Manjule
overview: Karkhanis family is the last joint family in Pune. When the eldest brother, Purushottam passes away, it is his last wish that his ashes be scattered in 3 different locations - the ancestral house, the family farm and the Chandrabhaga river in Pandharpur. He leaves an envelope for the family, which is to be opened post the dispersion of his ashes.

title: Canvas
cast: Madhura Velankar|Sameer Dharmadhikari|Vijay Kenkre|Abhijeet Satam|Sunil Dev
overview: A detective investigates a series of murders where the killer leaves a canvas painting beside the dead body of the victim.

title: Once There Was A Clown
cast: Laxmikant Berde|Mohan Agashe|Dilip Prabhavalkar|Madhu Kambikar|Varsha Usgaonkar
overview: Aburao, the son of a troupe dancer, has grown-up to become a brilliant clown. His talent brings him fame but also alienates him from his ideals and his loved ones.

title: Double Seat
cast: Mukta Barve|Ankush Chaudhari|Vandana Gupte|Vidyadhar Joshi|Shubhankar Tawade
overview: Double Seat is a story of newly wed lovebirds Amit and Manjiri struggling to find their private space in overwhelming city of Mumbai.

title: The Sacred Grove
cast: Atul Kulkarni|Sonali Kulkarni|Jyoti Subhash|Ashwin Chitale|Tushar Dalvi
overview: Devrai depicts a story of a man who suffers from schizophrenia and is struggling to come to terms with his illness and the frustration of his helpless sister.

title: Zapatlela
cast: Dilip Prabhavalkar|Laxmikant Berde|Mahesh Kothare|Raghavendra Kadkol|Vijay Chavan
overview: Inspector Mahesh kills a gangster but his spirit enters into a near by doll. Later, a puppetry master receives this doll as a gift but this doll will turn his good life into hell.

title: Balgandharva
cast: Subodh Bhave|Nitin Chandrakant Desai|Vibhawari Deshpande|Kishore Kadam|Abhijit Kelkar
overview: Balgandharva, the eminent towering singer from the bygone golden era of Marathi "sangeet natak" (musical dramas) definitely deserved some modern celluloid space. This film does well to document his life, the younger generation who is unaware of his charisma will get to know him.  The film chronicles his life , his acting career well. It gives a good overview of how the drama companies were run and how he influenced the running. His values and character stand out amidst all the tragedies in his life.

title: Home Sweet Home
cast: Mohan Joshi|Reema Lagoo|Hrishikesh Joshi|Spruha Joshi|Vibhawari Deshpande
overview: Shyamal and Vidhyadhar, an old couple, find themselves in a dilemma when they have to leave the house where they spent their entire married life to move into a new one.

title: Kay Dyache Bola
cast: Makarand Anaspure|Sharvari Jamenis|Mohan Agashe|Sachin Khedekar|Umesh Kamat
overview: Two friends commit a crime and seek the help of a lawyer who is related to one of them. Although the lawyer has never won any lawsuit, he willingly takes the case that leads to comical situations. Inspired by "My Cousin Vinny".

title: Fatakadi
cast: Sushma Shiromani|Ashok Saraf|Shreeram Lagoo|Nilu Phule|Ramesh Deo
overview: Fatakdi is determined to avenge her father's death by trying to manipulate the murderer's son into revealing the truth and takes help from a local policeman named Bavlya.

title: Anumati
cast: Vikram Gokhale|Reema Lagoo|Nina Kulkarni|Subodh Bhave|Kishore Kadam
overview: Ratnakar, an old man, is devastated when he discovers that his wife is ill. He helplessly goes through a series of trials and tribulations in order to save his dying wife.

title: Bai Ga
cast: Swapnil Joshi|Prarthana Behere|Sukanya Kulkarni|Namrata Gaikwad|Neha Khan
overview: When Dhanush asks God why Dhanush and Aboli's life is not going well, he realizes that he has not treated his wives properly in the last five lives. God gives him a chance to correct his mistake by bringing his wives from the previous five births into this birth and punishes Dhanush to find out the desire of each of them and fulfill it.

title: I Want This Husband Only
cast: Dada Kondke|Jayshree Talpade|Asha Patil|Dhumal|Ratnamala
overview: Villagers are fed up with mischief of Gopal (Gopya) and complain about him to village Church Priest, who tells Gopa that to put an end to all his mischief he should get married. But Gopya tells him that is impossible as their fortune teller has told his family that his father will pass away when he gets married. Gopya lives has a step mother who considers him as her own son and wants him to get married. Gopya meets Gopi and both get attracted towards each other but his father tries to bring obstacles in it.

title: Parallel Folds
cast: Sharmila Tagore|Amol Palekar|Radhika Apte|Sameer Dharmadhikari|Kishore Kadam
overview: A prosperous but lonely businessman has suicidal thoughts as his 60th birthday approaches. Then, he runs into his college sweetheart. Her mesmerizing beauty, poise and silence suddenly personify his vacuum of last 30 years. He was oblivious to his soul mate's shocking yesteryear's. Shama had chosen to be a recluse - hidden from the light of sunrise. Her life hasn't turned out the way she'd hoped, either. Can the couple find hope and rekindle their love?

title: Chhatrapati Sambhaji
cast: Bharat Dabholkar|Bal Dhuri|Lokesh Gupte|Mohan Joshi|Rajit Kapoor
overview: Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, son of Shivaji Maharaj, who grew up without parental love. Sambhaji proved himself a fearless and brave ruler, winning battles and instilling fear in the Mughal Empire.

title: Gallit Gondhal, Dillit Mujra
cast: Makarand Anaspure|Suzanne Bernert|Nagesh Bhonsle|Sayaji Shinde
overview: Kolsewadi has never seen any progress in the village, thanks to the bickering and fights between MLA Chandrakant Tope and Sarpanch Bajirao Dole. Narayan Wagh, a villager, makes the most of this to his advantage. He manages to coax the villagers and enters the electoral fray to fight the upcoming village elections.

title: Vishu
cast: Mrinmayee Godbole|Gashmeer Mahajani|Sunny Kamble|Pradnesh Tari
overview: Vishu, a guy with a happy go lucky attitude meets Aarvi Kalsekar, a headstrong and straightforward girl. Vishu falls for Aarvi but because of their opposite natures their lives change forever.

title: Habaddi
cast: Karan Dave|Mayur Khandge
overview: When the news of his village's school Kabaddi team travelling to Mumbai breaks out, a 10-year-old boy with a speech defect sees the opportunity to meet the girl he adores. But how will he chant 'Kabaddi, Kabaddi' without stammering?

title: Zenda
cast: Pushkar Shotri|Rajesh Shrungarpure|Santosh Juvekar|Siddharth Chandekar|Sachit Patil
overview: Zenda (Marathi: झेंडा) is 2010 Indian Marathi film directed by Avdhoot Gupte and starring Santosh Juvekar. Avdhoot Gupte himself composed the music for the film. The film depicts the journey of four young ambitious scholars to succeed in life and the impact of a split in a major political party on their journey. Zenda depicts a feud between two cousins in rival political parties, inspired by the real-life feud between Raj Thackeray, chief of Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) and his cousin, Uddhav Thackeray, Executive President of Shiv Sena. Avdhoot Gupte however believes that it is more about the Marathi youth, with just a couple of characters in the movie representing Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray. The film was released in early 2010, in theatres across Maharashtra state.

title: Dithee
cast: Amruta Subhash|Kishore Kadam|Mohan Agashe|Uttara Baokar|Dilip Prabhavalkar
overview: Dithee tells the story of a simple ironsmith and his journey of undergoing the pain of his son's death and experiencing the principle of non-duality.

title: Uladhaal
cast: Bharat Jadhav|Ankush Chaudhari|Madhura Velankar|Aditi Sarangdhar|Siddharth Jadhav
overview: Uladhaal is about a gold shield created in the 1700s by a Maratha King to honour a warrior, Somajirao, for saving his life. The shield was protected by Somajirao’s family and the next generations. But the precious possession is stolen en-route by a renowned thief, Guru and his gang. But as fate has it, it gets stolen from Guru and the rest is a hilarious trip of complications.

title: Harishchandra's Factory
cast: Nandu Madhav|Vibhavari Deshpande|Atharva Karve|Mohit Gokhale|Ketan Karande
overview: In 1913 India's cinema industry is born from Dadasaheb Phalke's efforts to make Raja Harishchandra (1913), India's first feature-length B&W silent film.

title: Gadhvacha Lagna
cast: Makarand Anaspure|Sonalee Kulkarni|Rajashree Landge|Sanjay Khapre|Nandu Pol
overview: Savlya, a potter who adores his donkey, goes to heaven. When he returns, he decides to construct a seven-storey building and get his donkey married to the king's daughter.

title: Phullwanti
cast: Prajakta Mali|Gashmeer Mahajani|Prasad Oak|Snehal Tarde|Vaibhav Mangle
overview: An esteemed, prestigious court dancer is challenged by the holistic views of society as she is seen as an impure woman who just entertains, but the dancer decides to go against the grain and prove to the people that it's their view what's impure, not her.

title: Mala Aai Vhhaychy!
cast: Urmilla Kothare|Stacy Bee|Samrouddhi Porey|Vivek Raut|Sulabha Deshpande
overview: Surrogation has become a large scale business in India these days. This film is based on a true incident. Mary a photo model from a foreign country comes to India with a dream of becoming a mother. But, destiny has a different plan. Due to circumstances, if Mary denies to accept the child from a surrogate mother, then what ?

title: Ghungroo
cast: Nisha Bajaria|Pooja Pant|Gautami Patil|Arshiya Sharma|Vedant Desai
overview: A tale revolving around an influential man who falls in love with a dancer. Even though their love is ostracized by the society, they raise a child who goes on to become a service officer.

title: Aamchya Sarkhe Aamhich
cast: Sachin Pilgaonkar|Ashok Saraf|Nivedita Joshi Saraf|Varsha Usgaonkar|Sudhir Joshi
overview: Aamchyasarkhe Aamhich is a 1990 Indian Marathi-language comedy drama film written and directed by Sachin Pilgaonkar and produced by Prakash Patil

title: Vazandar
cast: Priya Bapat|Sai Tamhankar|Siddharth Chandekar|Chetan Chitnis|Aditi Deshpande
overview: A captivating journey of two women who aim to lose their weights and achieve their goal of the size-zero waistline.

title: Bhutacha Honeymoon
cast: Ruchita Jadhav|Bharat Jadhav|Madhu Kambikar|Vijay Chavan|Sandeep Pathak
overview: School teacher Shankar Jagdale is newly transferred to the village without knowing that it's haunted by a ghost, and hasn't seen a marriage or a child birth in the entire decade gone by. While Shankar tries to get married to the girl he likes, he gets to know that the ghost is the reason behind the village's present situation, and also that the ghost has threatened to interfere and make a mockery of his marriage programs, if he doesn't get the ghost married before him.

title: Ananya
cast: Hruta Durgule|Amey Wagh|Chetan Chitnis|Yogesh Soman|Suvrat Joshi
overview: An ambitious and recently engaged accounting student is involved in a motor vehicle accident that results in the double amputation of her arms. As the life she once knew crumbles around her she must now decide whether to accept her fate or work to overcome these barriers and reclaim her life.

title: Hrudayantar
cast: Mukta Barve|Subodh Bhave|Trushnika Shinde|Nishtha Vaidya|Meena Naik
overview: An emotional drama that explores the marital crisis of a couple through turbulent times.

title: Huppa Huiyya
cast: Siddharth Jadhav|Mohan Joshi|Usha Nadkarni|Girija Oak|Mangesh Desai
overview: A heart warming tale of faith overcoming obstacles.

title: The Childhood of Krishna
cast: Neelkanth|Mandakini Phalke|Purushottam Parchure|Yadav Gopal Takle|Narayan Pache
overview: The playmates of Krishna are insulted by a female villager who splashes water on them. They take revenge by stealing butter from her house. When they are beaten up by the woman, they again take revenge with the aid of Krishna. He receives a gift of fruit for his help but gives it away. Krishna then enters the room of a wealthy merchant and his wife at night and ties the man's beard to his wife's hair. These exploits lead to a large crowd complaining of Krishna's antics to his foster parents.

title: Our People
cast: Reema Lagoo|Dilip Prabhavalkar|Prashant Damle|Sachin Khedekar|Renuka Shahane
overview: Raghunath is the only working member of his family living with his father, his wife Janaki and two children Anand and Rani, his family is more demanding towards him than his income but his wife controls everyone expenses and teaches them how to live in a small income.

title: Punha Gondhal Punha Mujra
cast: Makarand Anaspure|Sayaji Shinde|Maledina Alexendra|Purnima Ahire|Alok Nath
overview: Politician Narayan Wagh and his opponent Vishwasrao Tope hail from the same village. When Narayan wins the election by a narrow margin, Vishwasrao plays dirty to seek revenge.

title: Raanti
cast: Sharad Kelkar|Santosh Juvekar|Sanjay Narvekar|Shanvi Shrivastava|Chhaya Kadam
overview: A man with a troubled history must shield a young girl from relentless enemies determined to end her life.

title: Jhing Chik Jhing
cast: Bharat Jadhav|Chinmay Kambli|Madhavi Juvekar|Dilip Prabhavalkar|Arati More
overview: The film is set around the problem of agrarian debt and farmer suicides in Maharashtra. Mouli (Bharat Jadhav), a farmer who ekes out a living on a 2 acre farm is trying his best to support his family. He is in debt to the tune of Rs. 10,000 to the local money lender (Uday Sabnis). Mouli's wife Manda (Madhavi Juvekar) tries her best to sustain the family on the little that they have. Mouli and Manda's children Shyam (Chinmay Kambli) and Dipti (Aarti More) go to the local school - and both are bright children who have a lot to look forward to. Shyam wants to become 'someone' and Dipti has her first crush ! When it seems that all is lost - including the land - and suicide is the only option - Shyam decides that he is not going to die and tries his best to save the family. What he does and the alternative to suicide and debt free farming (the word used in the film is swawalambhi) is the crux of the film.

title: Lokshahi
cast: Tejashri Pradhan|Mohan Agashe|Sameer Dharmadhikari|Girish Oak|Ankit Mohan
overview: It's a story of a naïve girl's personal dilemma over moral action set against the backdrop of strained political drama.

title: Bhalu
cast: Prakash Bhende|Uma Bhende|Vikram Gokhale|Viju Khote|Raja Mayekar
overview: Sajjala, an orphan, is raised by Appakaka, her father's friend. When Appakaka is falsely charged with killing Jayantrao, Sajjala's betrothed, she vows to prove his innocence.

title: Ole Aale
cast: Nana Patekar|Siddharth Chandekar|Makarand Anaspure|Tanvi Azmi|Sayali Sanjeev
overview: Setting out on a voyage to uncover life's true meaning, a son and his father come across an enigmatic traveler. This odyssey unfolds as a series of unforeseen revelations, nurturing a deep bond while navigating the challenges that test the father-son relationship.

title: YZ
cast: Mukta Barve|Sai Tamhankar|Akshay Tanksale|Parna Pethe|Sagar Deshmukh
overview: The title is not just a slang word but a hip new attitude, importantly a fresh perspective on life. A coming-of-age comedy about a 33-year-old who is trapped between the identity of a boy and a man. YZ tells the story of Gajanan, who ends up in Pune, and how his friendship with an 18-year-old called Battees, opens him up to a new world around him. When the most under confident person in the world meets the most confident one, a series of maddening events is bound to happen. YZ is an incredible journey of friendship, innocence, happiness, love, true spice of life and the beauty within. YZ is all about discovering our own real, mad and bold YZ version. So, break free and be YZ!

title: Dharmarakshak Mahaveer Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj: Part 1
cast: Thakur Anoop Singh|Amruta Khanvilkar|Kishori Shahane|Bhargavi Chirmuley|Vineet Sharma
overview: Follows the life of Maratha warrior Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj.

title: Lai Bhaari
cast: Riteish Deshmukh|Sharad Kelkar|Radhika Apte|Tanvi Azmi|Uday Tikekar
overview: Sumitra travels to Pandharpur to find a ray of hope, after Sangram killed her husband and son and took over their business.

title: A Little For You And A Little For Me
cast: Sulabha Deshpande|Varsha Usgaonkar|Ajinkya Deo|Vikram Gokhale|Nikhil Kakade
overview: Samir, a college student, has never struggled for anything in his life while his parents want him to be more responsible. Things take a turn when he gets caught in a drug raid.

title: Mukkam Post Devach Ghar
cast: Myra Vaikul|Spruha Parab|Mangesh Desai|Usha Nadkarni|Madhavi Juvekar
overview: Jija is on a unique mission-to send a letter addressed to "Mukkam Post Devach Ghar" (God`s Home). Her journey, filled with humorous twists, emotional moments, and heartfelt connections, brings her family and the community together in unexpected ways.

title: Girlz
cast: Ankita Lande|Ketaki Narayan Kulkarni|Anvita Phaltankar|Nikhil Chavan
overview: Mati, an 18-year-old college girl convinces her conservative parents to let her go on an independent trip to Goa where she meets two other women who come from different backgrounds.

title: Bioscope
cast: Veena Jamkar|Nina Kulkarni|Spruha Joshi|Smita Tambe|Mangesh Desai
overview: Bioscope is an anthology film having 4 short films inspired from 4 poems.

title: Twelve Months
cast: Gajanand Bind|Seema Biswas|Alok Chaturvedi|Devika Daftardar|Subrat Dutta
overview: Baromas is a feature film in Hindi based on the Sahitya Academy award winning Marathi novel of the same name by Sadanand Deshmukh and directed by FTII-educated Dheeraj Meshram. The movie addresses the plight of dry land farmers and the educated unemployed in rural India.

title: Badha
cast: Amruta Subhash|Rajesh More|Devika Daftardar|Jyoti Subhash
overview: A young girl is forced to live apart from her family because of suspicions that she is a witch.

title: Ved Laavi Jeeva
cast: Vaidehi Parshurami|Adinath Kothare|Arun Nalawade|Ganesh Yadav|Mangala Kenkre
overview: Romance unexpectedly develops between a mechanic and a young woman from a wealthy family.

title: Sakhi
cast: Ashok Saraf|Sonali Kulkarni|Subodh Bhave|Lokesh Gupte|Jyoti Joshi
overview: The friendship between a widower and a married woman is misunderstood.

title: Aai Shappath..!
cast: Reema Lagoo|Tushar Dalvi|Ankush Chaudhari|Subodh Bhave|Mansi Salvi
overview: Ratnagiri-based young Gargi, who lives a fairly wealthy lifestyle with her widowed mother, Devki, re-locates to Pune to enroll in a hostel. It is here she will have to deal with a hostile room-mate, Roopa Bhattacharya; a wealthy Mohan Ranade, who wants to flirt with her; follow the instructions of her guardian, Shekhar, who wants to wed her; learn dancing and singing from famous maestro Pundit Omkarnath; as well as return home to deal with the fact that her mother had a secret life and that her father is still alive.

title: Short and Sweet
cast: Sonali Kulkarni|Harshad Atkari|Rasika Sunil|Shridhar Watsar|Ajit Bhure
overview: A man is kept in the dark regarding his father's identity. But when his mother shows him who his father is, he becomes embarrassed of his father's abnormally short height. Through laughs and fights, they try to bridge the gap between them.

title: Me Vasantrao
cast: Rahul Deshpande|Anita Date-Kelkar|Pushkaraj Chirputkar|Ashutosh Gokhale|Yatin Karyekar
overview: A biopic on the life of the Hindustani Classical maverick Vasantrao Deshpande, who himself narrates the soft melodies and sharp notes in his adventure that ultimately orchestrated his worldwide success and grand reverence by all.

title: Mann Kasturi Re
cast: Tejasswi Prakash|Abhinay Berde|Vinamra Babhal|Rajshri Deshpande|Veena Jamkar
overview: Worlds collide when rich girl Shruti falls in love with middle class boy Siddhant. She is full of life and charming while he is quiet and sweet. Siddhant is serious about his career and looking after his mother. However Shruti convinces him to get into a relationship with her and he agrees. Everything looks hunky-dory until that one night that changes everything.

title: Gavthi
cast: Shrikant Patil|Yogita Chavan|Kishor Sawmitra|Nagesh Bhosale|Kushal Badrike
overview: About a young village boy Gajanan - his rags to riches story and all the struggles he lives through. Success came with enormous sacrifices for Gajanan, who gave up everything, including his childhood love, to make it big in the city.

title: Friends
cast: Swapnil Joshi|Gauri Nalawade|Sagar Karande|Abhit Patil
overview: A dreamy man arrives in the city of Mumbai with many dreams and immediately falls in love with a girl, who turns out to be his best friend's sister. Will he be forced to sacrifice his love for the sake of friendship?

title: Aai Tulja Bhawani
cast: Madhu Kambikar|Kuldeep Pawar|Lata Arun|Mohan Kothivan|Ratnamala
overview: Priest Kadam Baba finds Venu, an orphan girl at the footsteps of the Aai Tulza Bhavani temple. He raises her up and she considers him as her real father. But unfortunately she is the daughter of a rape victim Kashi. Inamdar, who is the chairman of a sugar factory, wishes to get his handicap daughter, Mugdha married to Madhav, a lab in-charge in his factory. But Madhav falls for Venu and eventually they both get married. This angers Inamdar, he hatches a plan to get Madhav thrown out of his factory. More to their worst Madhav's mother is unhappy with their marriage as Venu didn't get dowry along with her. This results in conflict between her and Venu. Madhav's mother buries the holy idol of Aai Tulza Bhavani. Helpless Venu fights with the situation.

title: Boyz
cast: Santosh Juvekar|Pratik Lad|Ritika Shrotri|Shilpa Tulaskar|Sharvari Jamenis
overview: Gayatri has taken care of her son Kabir as a single mother. But cracks have developed in their relationship as Gayatri always avoids telling Kabir about his father. Kabir's only communication is his aunt Radhika. Gayatri and Radhika send Kabir to a boarding school where he is doing well in all aspects. Dhairya and Dhungya are two mischievous village boys who are sent to boarding school as the villagers want to keep them away. Kabir meets Dhairya and Dhungya and the school starts to witness changes.

title: Cactus Pears
cast: Bhushaan Manoj|Suraaj Suman|Jayshri Jagtap|Dhananjay Jambar|Sandhya Pawase
overview: A thirty-year-old city-dweller compelled to spend ten-day mourning of his father in the rugged countryside of Western India tenderly bonds with a local farmer struggling to stay unmarried. As the mourning ends, forcing his return, he must decide the fate of his relationship born under duress.

title: Baipan Bhari Deva
cast: Vandana Gupte|Rohini Hattangadi|Suchitra Bandekar|Sukanya Kulkarni|Shilpa Navalkar
overview: Six estranged sisters decide to take part in a Mangalgauri competition, and reunite at their childhood home to practice. They must overcome their past and face their struggles head-on.

title: Ranangan
cast: Sachin Pilgaonkar|Mukta Barve|Prarthana Behere|Siddharth Chandekar|Swapnil Joshi
overview: Shyamrao Deshmukh is a selfish politician.Hi son Varad was married earlier but his first wife left him in few months while second wife committed suicide on the wedding day itself.Shyamrao decides him to marry again with Sanika whose lover Avinash ditched after she got pregnant.After her getting married to Varad ,Sanika sees Shyamrao's adopted son Sholk in the house whose look alike of Avinash and also shares his habits Sanika believes that Sholk is Avinash .But what was Shyamrao's intention of getting Varad married to already pregnant Sanika.

title: Dharmaveer 2
cast: Prasad Oak|Kshitish Date|Makakarand Date|Snehal Tarde
overview: Explores Anand Dighe's life, tracing his political journey and capturing the essence of his impactful legacy as a prominent figure.

title: Triple Seat
cast: Ankush Chaudhari|Pallavi Patil|Shivani Surve|Pravin Tarde|Rakesh Bedi
overview: The life of a young happy couple gets turned upside down when they receive a call from an unknown woman claiming to be in danger.

title: Prem Mhanje Prem Mhanje Prem Asta
cast: Sachin Khedekar|Mrinal Kulkarni|Pallavi Joshi|Sunil Barve|Suhas Joshi
overview: The film grapples with multiple issues, but primarily the changing nature of love and its impact on the twin institutions of marriage and family.

title: Baloch
cast: Rohit Aawale|Tejashree Jadhav|Bhaurao Nanasaheb Karhade|Vishal Nikam|Ashok Samarth
overview: A period war film about Marathas fighting for their rights against the Balochs.

title: Anaahat
cast: Sonali Bendre|Anant Nag|Deepti Naval
overview: A woman pushes against social mores by asserting her right to sexual fulfillment.

title: 15 August
cast: Rahul Pethe|Mrunmayee Deshpande|Adinath Kothare|Vaibhav Mangle|Satish Phulekar
overview: On India's Independence Day, a zany mishap in a Mumbai chawl disrupts a young love story while compelling the residents to unite in aid of a little boy.

title: Happy Journey
cast: Atul Kulkarni|Priya Bapat|Pallavi Subhash|Madhav Abhyankar|Shivkumar Subramaniam
overview: Niranjan, after years of shouldering family responsibilities, becomes distant from his family. However, he happens to meet his sister's spirit and the two set out on a trip to rekindle their bond.

title: Balak Palak
cast: Shashwati Pimplikar|Madan Deodhar|Bhagyashree Shankpal|Rohit Phalke|Prathamesh Parab
overview: BP is about four teenage friends (Avya, Bhagya, Chiu and Dolly), who over hear that, a friend, a resident of their colony, Jyoti tai, has left their colony, as she has brought disgrace to her family.  Having received unsatisfactory explanations from their parents for Jyoti tai's exit. It becomes imperative to find out what exactly was her disgraceful act. Kids decide to take up this challenge.  In this journey to discover, they end-up bonding little too much with their over mature school-mate 'Vishu', the guiding star for the foursome. He enlightens them by throwing his divine light upon blue films. He feels, one has to read, watch, and if need be, perform to understand the true meaning of life (read SEX).

title: Nana Mama
cast: Bharat Jadhav|Makarand Anaspure|Vijay Chavan|Kuldeep Pawar|Deepak Shirke
overview: Nana, a taxi driver, unknowingly helps DD, a notorious criminal. In order to return the favor, DD forces him to join his gang, but Mama, a smart police officer, ruins his plan.

title: Shut Up And Dance
cast: Jitendra Joshi|Aniket Vishwasrao|Akshay Tanksale|Hemant Dhome|Parna Pethe
overview: Suryabhan Tanaji Deshmukh, the sarpanch of Kharbujewaadi and an ardent follower of Shivaji Maharaj, tries his best to restore a decaying fort.

title: Aga Bai Arechya
cast: Sanjay Narvekar|Priyanka Yadav|Bharati Achrekar|Siddharth Jadhav|Shubhangi Gokhale
overview: Shriranga Deshmukh is frustrated with all the women in his life. However, when he gets back from his native place, he realises he has supernatural powers allowing him to listen to any woman's thought. Inspired by "What Women Want".

title: AB aani CD
cast: Vikram Gokhale|Amitabh Bachchan
overview: Two playschool friends Bachchan and Gokhale meet almost after 70 years for a birthday party.

title: India Is My Country
cast: Chhaya Kadam|Shashank Shende|Mangesh Desai|Hemangi Kavi|Rajveersinhraje Gaikwad
overview: Sonu and Afrin are both seven years old who have enmity with each other. Sonu has a pet goat and he loves it. Sonu's father Jagdish is an Indian soldier, from the village proudly known as Soldier's Village. After some days, India and Pakistan's war begins. Jagdish is battling in the war and his mother vows that if Jagdish will come back home safe then she will kill the goat as a sacrificial gratitude.

title: Gulabjaam
cast: Siddharth Chandekar|Sonali Kulkarni|Madhura Deshpande|Chinmay Udgirkar|Mahesh Ghag
overview: Aditya is a young Maharashtrian man from London who comes to Pune to find a someone who would teach him traditional Maharashtrian cooking. His aim is to open a Marathi Gourmet Restaurant in London. In search of a perfect guru, he meets eccentric Radha, a woman who makes lunch boxes for the students and working men in her area. Aditya needs to pass many tests before Radha would accept him as student. But once she starts teaching him, a new path of life opens for Aditya. Gulabjaam is a food film, where Marathi food is almost the third important character.

title: Doghat Tisra Aata Sagla Visara
cast: Makarand Anaspure|Mohan Joshi|Mrunmayee Lagoo|Prasad Oak
overview: A newly married couples' lives are turned upside down when a childhood friend visits them unexpectedly.

title: Khabardar
cast: Vijay Chavan|Sunil Tawde|Makarand Anaspure|Bharat Jadhav|Nirmiti Sawant
overview: Bharat, a reporter, is given the opportunity to pursue the story of an escaped convict, Anna Chimbori. Maruti bears witness to a murder committed by Anna Chimbori and turns to Bharat for help.

title: Takatak
cast: Prathamesh Parab|Ritika Shrotri|Abhijit Amkar|Pranali Bhalerao|Bharat Ganeshpure
overview: Revolves around two sisters Kamaxi and Minaxi living inn a small village of Kolhapur

title: Ata Thambaycha Naay!
cast: Ashutosh Gowariker|Rohini Hattangadi|Prajakta Hanamghar|Parna Pethe|Om Bhutkar
overview: A film based on an inspiring true story.

title: Mani Mangalsutra
cast: Hrishitaa Bhatt|Ravindra Mankani|Anjali Kusre|Umesh Kamat|Lalan Sarang
overview: The film ‘Mani Mangalsutra’ based on an original true story written by Late Advocate Supriya Sarwate , which goes on to define the perfect man and woman relationship, which is more out of affection and caring for each other rather than just limiting it to sexual relationship. Young Film maker Gauri Karekar Sarwate was so much inspired by this unusual story written by her late mother-in-law, that she decided to make a film on this true story.  The film portrays the camouflaged values of our Indian culture and successfully displays the unwavering bonds between husband and wife irrespective of cast, creed and nationality.

title: The Silence
cast: Nagraj Popatrao Manjule|Anjali Patil|Kadambari Kadam|Mugdha Chaphekar|Vedashree Mahajan
overview: Late at night on a local train in Mumbai, young Chini witnesses a woman being sexually abused. This experience forces her to face up to demons from her past. Based on a true story, the narrative revolves around a little girl growing up in poverty with her father in a rural area. When he’s unable to manage caring for her himself, he sends Chini to her uncle in a nearby town, where life-changing events occur. Blending past and present and with forceful drama, the film tackles crucial, taboo topics, tracing the recurring question of responsibility – or silence.

title: Bhai - Vyakti Ki Valli - Uttarardha
cast: Sagar Deshmukh|Iravati Harshe|Satish Alekar|Sunil Barve|Amol Bavdekar
overview: Second part of the biopic of a Marathi comedian, India's first stand-up comedian P. L. Deshpande.

title: I Am Sindhutai Sapkal
cast: Jyoti Chandekar|Ameya Hunaswadkar|Nina Kulkarni|Upendra Limaye|Ananth Narayan Mahadevan
overview: This is the journey of Sindhutai Sapkal, a poor village girl who grew up tending buffaloes while craving an education, but her unsympathetic mother had her married off to an older man when she was 12 years old. What could have been a predictable life took a much different course when Sindhutai was unjustly accused of carrying another man's child and was thrown out of the house by her husband and his family.

title: Jeeva Sakha
cast: Seema Deo|Varsha Usgaonkar|Ajinkya Deo|Laxmikant Berde|Ashutosh Gowariker
overview: In Dhangao village Jeeva and Sakha are inseparable brothers living with their widowed mother when Sakha gets a job as police inspector he is posted at other place hence brothers get separated.Jeeva is in love with Paro.Nagya is a spoil brat who tries to bluff village people by asking them to sell their land to DK for Dhangao Industrial Zone but villager's support Jeeva which irks him after Paro gets married to Jeeva,Nagya threatens to kill her brother and makes her father sign the property papers and does so with many villagers when Jeeva takes action DK kills his person and puts blame on Jeeva,Jeeva now hides in jungle and whereabouts are only known to his friend Baadshah,Nagya kills Jeeva 's mother when she refuses to sign on papers.Sakha returns to the village to perform final rights of his mother and is unaware about things happening in his village and thinks Jeeva should be punished for taking law in his hand.

title: Ringan
cast: Shashank Shende|Saahil Joshi|Suhas Sirsat|Kalyanee Mulay|Umesh Jagtap
overview: 'The Quest [Ringan]' is a story about the boundless love between father and son. Their life is hell on earth. Father Arjun's problems are getting too much for him: His land is affected by drought, their livelihood is threatened. Seeing no way out, he considers to take his own life. Only the unconditional love for his son motivates him to not give up and look for work, to be able to keep his land. Will the father be strong enough to secure his son's future? A film and an appeal for morality, reflecting important issues such as integrity, honesty, and mutual responsibility in times of need.

title: Raavsaheb
cast: Jitendra Joshi|Mukta Barve|Rashmi Agdekar|Priyadarshan Jadhav|Mohit Takalkar
overview: In tribal India, a man's conflict with nature escalates, sparking a gripping quest for justice amidst the unforgiving wilderness.

title: Valu
cast: Atul Kulkarni|Bharati Achrekar|Mohan Agashe|Dipak Alegaokar|Girish Kulkarni
overview: A forest officer travels to a remote village to capture a supposedly dangerous bull which they find far trickier than they anticipate. He is accompanied by a documentary film maker to film it.

title: Someone For Somebody
cast: Smita Jaykar|Ashok Saraf|Rakesh Shrivastav|Sooraj Thapar|Ajay Padhye
overview: Rushi, a young Brahmin man, has a hostile relationship with his father. When Rushi's friend takes him to a past-life regression expert, discoveries about his past answer many of his doubts.

title: U for Usha
cast: Kiran Khoje
overview: Usha, a single mother who works as a farm labourer in rural India, finds herself drawn to a female teacher of local primary school, in ways she never knew possible.

title: Boyz 3
cast: Parth Bhalerao|Vidula Chougule|Pratik Lad|Onkar Bhojane|Sameer Dharmadhikari
overview: Kabir agrees to travel to his native place to complete the legal formalities of his mother's properties. Reluctant to meet his father, Kabir is coaxed into taking a road trip with Dhungya and Dhairya. Will the journey be successful?

title: Astu - So Be It
